original: @1b # // shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa stong phrag nyi shu lnga pa /
analyzed: @1b # // shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa stong phrag nyi shu lnga pa /
translated: Perfection of Wisdom in Twenty-five Thousand Lines

original: bam po nyi shu drug pa /
analyzed: bam po nyi shu drug pa /
translated: Twenty-sixth section

original: smras pa / tshe dang ldan pa rab 'byor ma skyes pa'i chos skye bar mi 'dod pa gang yin /
analyzed: smras pa / tshe dang ldan pa rab 'byor ma skyes pa'i chos skye bar mi 'dod pa gang yin /
translated: He said, “Venerable Subhūti, what is it that you do not assert is the arising of a nonarisen dharma?”

original: rab 'byor gyis smras pa /🔽tshe dang ldan pa sh'a ri'i bu bdag ni gzugs ma skyes pa rang bzhin gyis stong pa skye bar mi 'dod do //
analyzed: rab 'byor gyis smras pa / tshe dang ldan pa sh'a ri'i bu bdag ni gzugs ma skyes pa rang bzhin gyis stong pa skye bar mi 'dod do //
translated: Subhūti replied,🔽“Venerable Śāriputra, I do not assert the arising of form that is nonarisen and empty of a basic nature.

original: tshe dang ldan pa sh'a ri'i bu bdag ni tshor ba dang / 'du shes dang / 'du byed rnams dang / rnam par shes pa ma skyes pa rang bzhin gyis stong pa skye bar mi 'dod do //
analyzed: tshe dang ldan pa sh'a ri'i bu bdag ni tshor ba dang / 'du shes dang / 'du byed rnams dang / rnam par shes pa ma skyes pa rang bzhin gyis stong pa skye bar mi 'dod do //
translated: Venerable Śāriputra, I do not assert the arising of feeling, perception, volitional factors, or consciousness that are nonarisen and empty of a basic nature.

original: tshe dang ldan pa sh'a ri'i bu bdag ni skye mched rnams dang / khams rnams dang / rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba rnams dang / pha rol tu phyin pa thams cad dang / stong pa nyid thams cad dang / byang chub kyi phyogs kyi chos rnams dang /
analyzed: tshe dang ldan pa sh'a ri'i bu bdag ni skye mched rnams dang / khams rnams dang / rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba rnams dang / pha rol tu phyin pa thams cad dang / stong pa nyid thams cad dang / byang chub kyi phyogs kyi chos rnams dang /
translated: Venerable Śāriputra, I do not assert that the sense spheres, elements, dependent origination, all perfections, all emptinesses, and the factors of awakening

original: bsam gtan rnams dang / tshad med pa rnams dang / gzugs med pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa rnams dang / mngon par shes pa rnams dang / de bzhin gshegs pa'i stobs rnams dang / mi 'jigs pa rnams dang / so so yang dag par rig pa rnams dang /
analyzed: bsam gtan rnams dang / tshad med pa rnams dang / gzugs med pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa rnams dang / mngon par shes pa rnams dang / de bzhin gshegs pa'i stobs rnams dang / mi 'jigs pa rnams dang / so so yang dag par rig pa rnams dang /
translated: the concentrations, immeasurables, formless absorptions, and higher knowledges, the powers of the tathāgatas, the fearlessnesses, the aspects of correct understanding,

original: @2a * // sangs rgyas kyi chos ma 'dres pa rnams ma skyes pa rang bzhin gyis stong pa skye bar mi 'dod do //
analyzed: @2a * // sangs rgyas kyi chos ma 'dres pa rnams ma skyes pa rang bzhin gyis stong pa skye bar mi 'dod do //
translated: and the distinct qualities of the buddhas, which are unborn and naturally empty, arise.

original: tshe dang ldan pa sh'a ri'i bu bdag ni rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid kyi bar du ma skyes pa rang bzhin gyis stong pa skye bar mi 'dod do //🔽smras pa / tshe dang ldan pa rab 'byor ci skyes pa skye'am /
analyzed: tshe dang ldan pa sh'a ri'i bu bdag ni rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid kyi bar du ma skyes pa rang bzhin gyis stong pa skye bar mi 'dod do // smras pa / tshe dang ldan pa rab 'byor ci skyes pa skye'am /
translated: “Venerable Śāriputra, I do not assert that the knowledge of all aspects up to the knowledge of all aspects, which is unborn, empty of a basic nature, arises.”

original: 'on te ma skyes pa skye /
analyzed: 'on te ma skyes pa skye /
translated: Śāriputra then asked, “Venerable Subhūti, does what has arisen arise, or does what has not arisen arise?”

original: rab 'byor gyis smras pa /
analyzed: rab 'byor gyis smras pa /
translated: Subhūti replied,

original: tshe dang ldan pa sh'a ri'i bu skyes pa mi skye ste /
analyzed: tshe dang ldan pa sh'a ri'i bu skyes pa mi skye ste /
translated: “Venerable Śāriputra, what has arisen does not arise,

original: ma skyes pa yang mi skye'o //
analyzed: ma skyes pa yang mi skye'o //
translated: and what has not arisen also does not arise.”

original: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: de ci'i phyir zhe na /

original: tshe dang ldan pa sh'a ri'i bu 'di ltar skyes pa gang yin pa dang / ma skyes pa gang yin pa'i chos 'di gnyis ni ldan pa yang ma yin /🔽mi ldan pa yang ma yin te /
analyzed: tshe dang ldan pa sh'a ri'i bu 'di ltar skyes pa gang yin pa dang / ma skyes pa gang yin pa'i chos 'di gnyis ni ldan pa yang ma yin / mi ldan pa yang ma yin te /
translated: “Venerable Śāriputra, it is because these two dharmas, what has arisen and what has not arisen, are not conjoined and are not disjoined.

original: gzugs can yang ma yin pa /🔽bstan du med pa /
analyzed: gzugs can yang ma yin pa / bstan du med pa /
translated: They are not physical;🔽they cannot be shown;

original: thogs pa med pa /
analyzed: thogs pa med pa /
translated: they are unimpeded;

original: mtshan nyid gcig pa ste /
analyzed: mtshan nyid gcig pa ste /
translated: they have one characteristic;

original: 'di lta ste mtshan nyid med pa'o //
analyzed: 'di lta ste mtshan nyid med pa'o //
translated: that is, they are without characteristics.”

original: tshe dang ldan pa sh'a ri'i bu rnam grangs des na skyes pa yang mi skye ste /
analyzed: tshe dang ldan pa sh'a ri'i bu rnam grangs des na skyes pa yang mi skye ste /
translated: “Venerable Śāriputra, for this reason, a birth does not give rise to a birth,

original: ma skyes pa yang mi skye'o //
analyzed: ma skyes pa yang mi skye'o //
translated: and a non-birth does not give rise to a birth.

original: tshe dang ldan pa sh'a ri'i bu rnam grangs des na smra ba skye ba med spobs pa skye ba med do //🔽chos skye ba med do //
analyzed: tshe dang ldan pa sh'a ri'i bu rnam grangs des na smra ba skye ba med spobs pa skye ba med do // chos skye ba med do //
translated: Venerable Śāriputra, for this reason, a non-arisen eloquence does not give rise to an arisen speaker,🔽and a non-arisen Dharma does not give rise to an arisen speaker.

original: gang las brtsams nas smra bar spobs pa'i chos de dag kyang skye ba med do //
analyzed: gang las brtsams nas smra bar spobs pa'i chos de dag kyang skye ba med do //
translated: The Dharma that one would speak about, that Dharma is also non-arisen.

original: smras pa / tshe dang ldan pa rab 'byor ni chos smra ba'i nang nas mchog tu bya bar 'os pa ste /
analyzed: smras pa / tshe dang ldan pa rab 'byor ni chos smra ba'i nang nas mchog tu bya bar 'os pa ste /
translated: ” Śāriputra then said, “Venerable Subhūti, you are worthy of being called the foremost of the eloquent ones among the disciples of the Tathāgata.

original: @2b de ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: @2b de ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: 'di ltar gnas brtan rab 'byor ni gang dang gang yongs su dris pa de dang de la thogs pa med do //🔽rab 'byor gyis smras pa /

original: tshe dang ldan pa sh'a ri'i bu de ni bcom ldan 'das kyis nyan thos chos thams cad la gnas pa med pa dag gi chos nyid do //
analyzed: tshe dang ldan pa sh'a ri'i bu de ni bcom ldan 'das kyis nyan thos chos thams cad la gnas pa med pa dag gi chos nyid do //

analyzed: de dag ni gang dang gang la yongs su dris pa de dang de la thogs pa med do //

analyzed: smras pa / tshe dang ldan pa rab 'byor ji ltar na chos thams cad mi gnas pa yin / rab 'byor gyis smras pa /

analyzed: tshe dang ldan pa sh'a ri'i bu gzugs ni rang bzhin gyis stong pa ste /

analyzed: byang chub kyi lam yongs su sbyong ba yin /
translated: they purify the bodhisattva path?”

original: rab 'byor gyis smras pa /🔽tshe dang ldan pa sh'a ri'i bu sbyin pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa ni 'jig rten pa yang yod /
analyzed: rab 'byor gyis smras pa / tshe dang ldan pa sh'a ri'i bu sbyin pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa ni 'jig rten pa yang yod /
translated: Subhūti replied,🔽“Venerable Śāriputra, there is a mundane perfection of giving,

original: 'jig rten las 'das pa yang yod do //🔽tshul khrims kyi pha rol tu phyin pa dang / bzod pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa dang / brtson 'grus kyi pha rol tu phyin pa dang / bsam gtan gyi pha rol tu phyin pa dang / shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa ni 'jig rten pa yang yod /
analyzed: 'jig rten las 'das pa yang yod do // tshul khrims kyi pha rol tu phyin pa dang / bzod pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa dang / brtson 'grus kyi pha rol tu phyin pa dang / bsam gtan gyi pha rol tu phyin pa dang / shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa ni 'jig rten pa yang yod /
translated: and there is a supramundane perfection of giving.🔽There is a mundane perfection of morality, perfection of patience, perfection of perseverance, perfection of concentration, and perfection of wisdom,

original: 'jig rten las 'das pa yang yod do //
analyzed: 'jig rten las 'das pa yang yod do //
translated: and there is a supramundane perfection of morality, perfection of patience, perfection of perseverance, perfection of concentration, and perfection of wisdom.

original: smras pa / tshe dang ldan pa rab 'byor 'jig rten pa'i sbyin pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa ni gang /
analyzed: smras pa / tshe dang ldan pa rab 'byor 'jig rten pa'i sbyin pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa ni gang /
translated: Subhūti replied, “Venerable Śāriputra, what is the mundane perfection of generosity?

original: 'jig rten las 'das pa ni gang /
analyzed: 'jig rten las 'das pa ni gang /
translated: What is the supramundane perfection of generosity?”

original: rab 'byor gyis smras pa /
analyzed: rab 'byor gyis smras pa /
translated: Subhūti replied,

original: tshe dang ldan pa sh'a ri'i bu 'di la byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po sbyin pa byed cing sbyin bdag tu gyur pa /
analyzed: tshe dang ldan pa sh'a ri'i bu 'di la byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po sbyin pa byed cing sbyin bdag tu gyur pa /
translated: “Venerable Śāriputra, here bodhisattva great beings make gifts and become benefactors.

original: dge sbyong dang / bram ze dang / phongs pa dang / ltogs pa dang / 'gron ba dang / slong ba zas 'dod pa la ni zas skom dang / theg pa dang / gos dang / me tog dang / phreng ba dang / spos dang /
analyzed: dge sbyong dang / bram ze dang / phongs pa dang / ltogs pa dang / 'gron ba dang / slong ba zas 'dod pa la ni zas skom dang / theg pa dang / gos dang / me tog dang / phreng ba dang / spos dang /
translated: To ascetics, brahmins, the destitute, the hungry, travelers, and beggars who want food, they give food and drink, vehicles, clothes, flowers, garlands, incense,

original: byug pa dang / gnas dang / mal stan dang / yo byad dang / sman dang / mi'i yo byad gang ci yang rung ba'i bar du gtong ste /🔽bu pho 'dod pa la ni bu pho yongs su gtong ngo //🔽bu mo 'dod pa la ni bu mo //
analyzed: byug pa dang / gnas dang / mal stan dang / yo byad dang / sman dang / mi'i yo byad gang ci yang rung ba'i bar du gtong ste / bu pho 'dod pa la ni bu pho yongs su gtong ngo // bu mo 'dod pa la ni bu mo //
translated: ointments, dwellings, bedding, utensils, and medicine, up to and any kind of human necessities.🔽To those who want sons, they give sons.🔽To those who want daughters, they give daughters.

original: chung ma 'dod pa la ni chung ma /
analyzed: chung ma 'dod pa la ni chung ma /
translated: To those who want wives, they give wives.

original: rgyal srid 'dod pa la ni rgyal srid /🔽mgo 'dod pa @4a * //🔽la ni mgo / yan lag dang nyid lag 'dod pa la ni yan lag dang nyid lag / sha dang khrag dang / rkang 'dod pa la ni /
analyzed: rgyal srid 'dod pa la ni rgyal srid / mgo 'dod pa @4a * // la ni mgo / yan lag dang nyid lag 'dod pa la ni yan lag dang nyid lag / sha dang khrag dang / rkang 'dod pa la ni /
translated: For those who want a kingdom, he gives them a kingdom.🔽For those who want a head, he gives them a head.🔽For those who want limbs and fingers, he gives them limbs and fingers.

original: sha dang khrag dang / rkang yongs su gtong ste /
analyzed: sha dang khrag dang / rkang yongs su gtong ste /
translated: For those who want flesh, blood, and marrow, he gives them flesh, blood, and marrow.

original: de yang gnas shing yongs su gtong la 'di snyam du bdag ni yongs su gtong ba'o //
analyzed: de yang gnas shing yongs su gtong la 'di snyam du bdag ni yongs su gtong ba'o //
translated: He gives while standing, and he gives thinking, “I am giving.

original: 'di ni len pa'o ;
analyzed: 'di ni len pa'o ;
translated: This is the recipient.

original: /'di ni sbyin pa'i //
analyzed: /'di ni sbyin pa'i //
translated: This is the gift.

original: bdag ni ser sna med pa'o //
analyzed: bdag ni ser sna med pa'o //
translated: I am free from stinginess.

original: bdag ni sbyin pa'i bdag po'o //
analyzed: bdag ni sbyin pa'i bdag po'o //
translated: I am a lord of generosity.

original: bdag ni bdog pa thams cad yongs su gtong pa'o //
analyzed: bdag ni bdog pa thams cad yongs su gtong pa'o //
translated: I am giving away all my possessions.

original: bdag ni sangs rgyas kyi bka' bzhin byed pa'o //
analyzed: bdag ni sangs rgyas kyi bka' bzhin byed pa'o //
translated: I am doing what the Buddha taught.

original: bdag ni sbyin pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod pa'o zhes te /
analyzed: bdag ni sbyin pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod pa'o zhes te /
translated: I am practicing the perfection of generosity.”

original: sbyin pa de byin nas kyang dmigs pa'i tshul gyis sems can thams cad dang thun mong du byas te /
analyzed: sbyin pa de byin nas kyang dmigs pa'i tshul gyis sems can thams cad dang thun mong du byas te /
translated: And after giving the gift, he makes common cause with all sentient beings and dedicates it to the attainment of perfect enlightenment.

original: bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu bsngo zhing bdag gi sbyin pa'i 'bras bu 'dis sems can 'di dag tshe 'di nyid la bde ba dang nye bar len pa med par yongs su mya ngan las 'das par gyur cig ces yongs su bsngo
analyzed: bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu bsngo zhing bdag gi sbyin pa'i 'bras bu 'dis sems can 'di dag tshe 'di nyid la bde ba dang nye bar len pa med par yongs su mya ngan las 'das par gyur cig ces yongs su bsngo
translated: He dedicates it to unsurpassed, perfect, complete awakening, and he dedicates it with the thought, “By the fruit of my generosity, may these sentient beings be happy in this very life, and may they attain nirvāṇa without grasping.”

original: ste / de chags pa gsum la chags shing sbyin pa de yongs su gtong ngo //
analyzed: ste / de chags pa gsum la chags shing sbyin pa de yongs su gtong ngo //
translated: He gives that gift attached to three attachments.

original: gsum gang zhe na /
analyzed: gsum gang zhe na /
translated: What are the three?

original: 'di ltar bdag tu 'du shes pa dang / gzhan du 'du shes pa dang / sbyin par 'du shes pa 'di gsum la chags nas sbyin pa de dag yongs su gtong ste ;
analyzed: 'di ltar bdag tu 'du shes pa dang / gzhan du 'du shes pa dang / sbyin par 'du shes pa 'di gsum la chags nas sbyin pa de dag yongs su gtong ste ;
translated: Thus, attached to these three—the notion of self, the notion of other, and the notion of giving—he gives those gifts.

original: 'di ni 'jig rten pa'i sbyin pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: 'di ni 'jig rten pa'i sbyin pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa zhes bya'o //
translated: This is called the perfection of giving of the worldly.

original: ci'i phyir na 'jig rten pa'i sbyin pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa zhes bya zhe na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir na 'jig rten pa'i sbyin pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa zhes bya zhe na /
translated: Why is it called the perfection of giving of the worldly?

original: de ni 'di ltar 'jig rten las mi g-yo mi 'phags mi 'da' bas de'i phyir 'jig rten pa'i sbyin pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: de ni 'di ltar 'jig rten las mi g-yo mi 'phags mi 'da' bas de'i phyir 'jig rten pa'i sbyin pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa zhes bya'o //
translated: Because it does not transcend the world, it is called the perfection of giving of the worldly.

original: de la 'jig rten las 'das pa'i sbyin pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa gang zhe na /
analyzed: de la 'jig rten las 'das pa'i sbyin pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa gang zhe na /
translated: “What is the supramundane perfection of giving?

original: 'di ltar 'khor gsum yongs su dag pa ste /
analyzed: 'di ltar 'khor gsum yongs su dag pa ste /
translated: It is the purification of the three sectors.

original: de la 'khor gsum yongs su dag pa gang zhe na /
analyzed: de la 'khor gsum yongs su dag pa gang zhe na /
translated: What is the purification of the three sectors?

original: tshe dang ldan pa sh'a ri'i bu 'di la byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po sbyin pa gtong ba'i tshe bdag mi dmigs /
analyzed: tshe dang ldan pa sh'a ri'i bu 'di la byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po sbyin pa gtong ba'i tshe bdag mi dmigs /
translated: Venerable Śāriputra, when bodhisattva-mahāsattvas practice giving, they do not apprehend a self,

original: len pa mi dmigs /
analyzed: len pa mi dmigs /
translated: they do not apprehend a recipient,

original: sbyin pa mi dmigs /
analyzed: sbyin pa mi dmigs /
translated: they do not apprehend a gift,

original: rnam par smin pa la yang dga' bar mi byed cing /
analyzed: rnam par smin pa la yang dga' bar mi byed cing /
translated: and they do not delight in its maturation.

original: tshe dang ldan pa sh'a ri'i bu 'di ni byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po'i 'khor gsum yongs su dag pa'o //
analyzed: tshe dang ldan pa sh'a ri'i bu 'di ni byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po'i 'khor gsum yongs su dag pa'o //
translated: Venerable Śāriputra, this is the bodhisattva-mahāsattvas’ purification of the three sectors.

original: tshe dang ldan pa sh'a ri'i bu de ci'i phyir 'jig rten las 'das pa'i sbyin @4b pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa zhes bya zhe na /
analyzed: tshe dang ldan pa sh'a ri'i bu de ci'i phyir 'jig rten las 'das pa'i sbyin @4b pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa zhes bya zhe na /
translated: “Venerable Śāriputra, why is it called the supramundane perfection of generosity?

original: de ni 'di ltar 'jig rten las g-yo zhing 'phags la 'da' bas de'i phyir 'jig rten las 'das pa'i sbyin pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: de ni 'di ltar 'jig rten las g-yo zhing 'phags la 'da' bas de'i phyir 'jig rten las 'das pa'i sbyin pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa zhes bya'o //
translated: Because it moves, rises above, and transcends the world, it is called the supramundane perfection of generosity.

original: tshul khrims dang / bzod pa dang / brtson 'grus dang / bsam gtan yang de bzhin no //
analyzed: tshul khrims dang / bzod pa dang / brtson 'grus dang / bsam gtan yang de bzhin no //
translated: The same goes for morality, patience, perseverance, and concentration.

original: sh'a ri'i bus smras pa /
analyzed: sh'a ri'i bus smras pa /
translated: Śāriputra said,

original: tshe dang ldan pa rab 'byor shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa 'jig rten pa ni gang yin /
analyzed: tshe dang ldan pa rab 'byor shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa 'jig rten pa ni gang yin /
translated: “Venerable Subhūti, what is the mundane perfection of wisdom?

original: 'jig rten las 'das pa ni gang yin /
analyzed: 'jig rten las 'das pa ni gang yin /
translated: What is the supramundane perfection of wisdom?”

original: rab 'byor gyis smras pa /
analyzed: rab 'byor gyis smras pa /
translated: Subhūti replied,

original: sh'a ri'i bu 'di la 'jig rten pa'i shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa ni byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po bdag gis ser sna'i sems bskyed par mi bya'o snyam ste /
analyzed: sh'a ri'i bu 'di la 'jig rten pa'i shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa ni byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po bdag gis ser sna'i sems bskyed par mi bya'o snyam ste /
translated: “Śāriputra, here the mundane perfection of wisdom is when bodhisattva great beings think, ‘I must not give rise to a miserly mind.’

original: dmigs pa la brten nas sbyin pa gtong zhing de yang bdag dang sems can dang sbyin pa'i 'du shes la gnas nas bdog pa thams cad gtong zhing yongs su gtong ste /
analyzed: dmigs pa la brten nas sbyin pa gtong zhing de yang bdag dang sems can dang sbyin pa'i 'du shes la gnas nas bdog pa thams cad gtong zhing yongs su gtong ste /
translated: They give gifts in dependence on a meditative object, and they give everything they have while maintaining the perception of self, of sentient beings, and of giving.

original: phyi 'am nang gi dngos po zin pa'am ma zin pa yang rung ste /
analyzed: phyi 'am nang gi dngos po zin pa'am ma zin pa yang rung ste /
translated: They give away and completely give away all their possessions, both internal and external, whether they are appropriated or not.🔽There is nothing that they will not give away. They make that root of virtue common to all sentient beings, and they dedicate it to enlightenment in dependence on a meditative object.

original: mi gtong ba'i dngos po gang yin pa de ni 'ga' yang med la dge ba'i rtsa ba de yang sems can thams cad dang thun mong du byas nas dmigs pa la brten pas byang chub tu yongs su sngo bar byed pa dang / de lus dang ngag dang yid dmigs pa la brten cing sbyangs pa'i yon tan la rab tu gnas pa'i tshul khrims la rten par byed la /
analyzed: mi gtong ba'i dngos po gang yin pa de ni 'ga' yang med la dge ba'i rtsa ba de yang sems can thams cad dang thun mong du byas nas dmigs pa la brten pas byang chub tu yongs su sngo bar byed pa dang / de lus dang ngag dang yid dmigs pa la brten cing sbyangs pa'i yon tan la rab tu gnas pa'i tshul khrims la rten par byed la /
translated: They maintain ethical discipline in dependence on a meditative object of body, speech, and mind, and they maintain it in dependence on the ascetic practices.

original: dge ba bcu'i las kyi lam de la brten pa na yang bdag tu lta ba dang / sems can du lta ba dang / dge bar lta ba la brten nas byang chub tu dmigs te /
analyzed: dge ba bcu'i las kyi lam de la brten pa na yang bdag tu lta ba dang / sems can du lta ba dang / dge bar lta ba la brten nas byang chub tu dmigs te /
translated: And when they maintain the path of the ten virtuous actions, they do so in dependence on the view of self, the view of sentient beings, and the view of virtue, and they focus on enlightenment.

original: sems can thams cad dang thun mong du byas shing tshul khrims de yang byang chub tu yongs su sngo bar byed la ;
analyzed: sems can thams cad dang thun mong du byas shing tshul khrims de yang byang chub tu yongs su sngo bar byed la ;
translated: They share it with all sentient beings and dedicate that morality to awakening.🔽And they praise themselves and disparage others by way of apprehending something.

original: de yang dmigs pa'i tshul gyis bdag la stod cing gzhan la smod par byed pa dang / de bdag dang / sems can dang / bzod pa la brten pas sems can thams cad kyis nyes par byas pa bzod cing dge ba'i rtsa ba de yang dmigs pa'i tshul gyis sems can thams cad dang thun mong du byas shing bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu yongs su sngo
analyzed: de yang dmigs pa'i tshul gyis bdag la stod cing gzhan la smod par byed pa dang / de bdag dang / sems can dang / bzod pa la brten pas sems can thams cad kyis nyes par byas pa bzod cing dge ba'i rtsa ba de yang dmigs pa'i tshul gyis sems can thams cad dang thun mong du byas shing bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu yongs su sngo
translated: And they are patient with all sentient beings’ misdeeds because they rely on patience, and they share that wholesome root with all sentient beings by way of apprehending something, and they dedicate it to unsurpassed, perfect, complete awakening.

original: bar byed pa dang / de lus dmigs bzhin pa dang / sems dmigs bzhin pa dang / bsod nams kyi tshogs dang ye shes kyi tshogs dmigs bzhin pa dang / bdag dmigs bzhin pa dang / byang chub dmigs @5a * //
analyzed: bar byed pa dang / de lus dmigs bzhin pa dang / sems dmigs bzhin pa dang / bsod nams kyi tshogs dang ye shes kyi tshogs dmigs bzhin pa dang / bdag dmigs bzhin pa dang / byang chub dmigs @5a * //
translated: And they apprehend the body, they apprehend the mind, they apprehend the accumulation of merit and the accumulation of wisdom, they apprehend the self, they apprehend awakening, and they apprehend the Buddha.

original: bzhin pas brtson 'grus rtsom zhing brtson 'grus des rlom sems su byed la /
analyzed: bzhin pas brtson 'grus rtsom zhing brtson 'grus des rlom sems su byed la /
translated: They practice diligence with a sense of self, and through that diligence they become conceited.🔽And they dedicate that diligence to unsurpassed and perfect awakening, but only in a conceptual way.🔽They cultivate love, compassion, joy, and equanimity, and when they enter into and rise from the meditative absorptions, they savor the experience and become conceited about it.

original: brtson 'grus de yang dmigs pa'i tshul gyis bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu yongs su bsngo ba dang / de byams pa dang / snying rje dang / dga' ba dang / btang snyoms sgom par byed cing bsam gtan la snyoms par 'jug pa la snyoms par zhugs pa dang btang na yang de'i ro myong bar byed cing ro myang ba des kyang rlom sems su byed pas dmigs pa'i tshul gyis dge ba'i rtsa ba sems can thams cad dang
analyzed: brtson 'grus de yang dmigs pa'i tshul gyis bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu yongs su bsngo ba dang / de byams pa dang / snying rje dang / dga' ba dang / btang snyoms sgom par byed cing bsam gtan la snyoms par 'jug pa la snyoms par zhugs pa dang btang na yang de'i ro myong bar byed cing ro myang ba des kyang rlom sems su byed pas dmigs pa'i tshul gyis dge ba'i rtsa ba sems can thams cad dang
translated: They dedicate the roots of virtue that they have made common to all sentient beings to unsurpassed and perfect awakening, but only in a conceptual way.

original: thun mong du byas nas bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu sngo bar byed pa dang / de gzugs stong pa'o snyam du dmigs par byed /
analyzed: thun mong du byas nas bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu sngo bar byed pa dang / de gzugs stong pa'o snyam du dmigs par byed /
translated: They think, “Form is empty.”

original: tshor ba dang / 'du shes dang / 'du byed rnams dang / rnam par shes pa stong pa zhes bya bar dmigs pa nas /🔽byang chub dang sangs rgyas kyi bar du dmigs pas /
analyzed: tshor ba dang / 'du shes dang / 'du byed rnams dang / rnam par shes pa stong pa zhes bya bar dmigs pa nas / byang chub dang sangs rgyas kyi bar du dmigs pas /
translated: form is empty, and that feeling, perception, volitional factors, and consciousness are empty.🔽They meditate on all emptinesses by way of apprehending, up to and including enlightenment and a Buddha.

original: dmigs pa'i tshul gyis stong pa nyid thams cad sgom par byed cing dge ba'i rtsa ba de yang dmigs pa'i tshul gyis sems can thams cad dang thun mong du byas nas bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu sngo bar byed la /
analyzed: dmigs pa'i tshul gyis stong pa nyid thams cad sgom par byed cing dge ba'i rtsa ba de yang dmigs pa'i tshul gyis sems can thams cad dang thun mong du byas nas bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu sngo bar byed la /
translated: They make those roots of virtue common to all sentient beings by way of apprehending and dedicate them to unsurpassed, perfect, complete awakening.

original: dmigs pa'i tshul gyis sdig pa thams cad so sor 'chags par byed bdag dang gzhan gyi dge ba la rjes su yi rang bar byed /
analyzed: dmigs pa'i tshul gyis sdig pa thams cad so sor 'chags par byed bdag dang gzhan gyi dge ba la rjes su yi rang bar byed /
translated: They confess all their sins by way of apprehending, rejoice in the virtue of self and others by way of apprehending,

original: dmigs bzhin pas bdag dang gzhan gyi don du /
analyzed: dmigs bzhin pas bdag dang gzhan gyi don du /
translated: and for the sake of self and others

original: sangs rgyas thams cad la gsol ba 'debs par byed /
analyzed: sangs rgyas thams cad la gsol ba 'debs par byed /
translated: request all the buddhas to teach by way of apprehending,🔽and request the buddhas not to pass away into nirvāṇa by way of apprehending.

original: thabs mi mkhas pas sems can thams cad dang thun mong du byas nas dus gsum du dge ba'i rtsa ba rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid du yongs su bsngo ba 'di ni 'jig rten pa'i shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: thabs mi mkhas pas sems can thams cad dang thun mong du byas nas dus gsum du dge ba'i rtsa ba rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid du yongs su bsngo ba 'di ni 'jig rten pa'i shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa zhes bya'o //
translated: The skill in means of dedicating the wholesome roots of the three times, which are shared with all sentient beings, to omniscience, is called the mundane perfection of wisdom.

original: de la 'jig rten las 'das pa'i shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa gang zhe na /
analyzed: de la 'jig rten las 'das pa'i shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa gang zhe na /
translated: What is the supramundane perfection of wisdom?

original: bdag dang / sems can dang / sbyin par bya ba dang / byang chub mi dmigs pa'i shes rab 'khor gsum yongs su dag pas byang chub kyi phyir sbyin pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa yongs su sbyong bar byed pa dang / bdag dang sems can dang /
analyzed: bdag dang / sems can dang / sbyin par bya ba dang / byang chub mi dmigs pa'i shes rab 'khor gsum yongs su dag pas byang chub kyi phyir sbyin pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa yongs su sbyong bar byed pa dang / bdag dang sems can dang /
translated: The purification of the perfection of generosity for the sake of enlightenment by the wisdom that does not apprehend a self, a sentient being, something to be given, or a bodhisattva, and by the complete purity of the three spheres.

original: tshul khrims dang byang chub mi dmigs pas 'khor gsum yongs su dag pas byang chub kyi phyir tshul khrims yongs su sbyong bar byed pa dang / bdag dang / @5b sems can dang / bzod pa dang / byang chub mi dmigs pas 'khor gsum yongs su dag pas /🔽byang chub kyi phyir bzod pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa yongs su sbyong bar byed pa dang / bdag dang / lus dang / sems dang / brtson 'grus dang / bsod nams dang / ye shes dang byang chub mi dmigs pas 'khor gsum yongs su dag pas /
analyzed: tshul khrims dang byang chub mi dmigs pas 'khor gsum yongs su dag pas byang chub kyi phyir tshul khrims yongs su sbyong bar byed pa dang / bdag dang / @5b sems can dang / bzod pa dang / byang chub mi dmigs pas 'khor gsum yongs su dag pas / byang chub kyi phyir bzod pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa yongs su sbyong bar byed pa dang / bdag dang / lus dang / sems dang / brtson 'grus dang / bsod nams dang / ye shes dang byang chub mi dmigs pas 'khor gsum yongs su dag pas /
translated: They purify the perfection of morality for the sake of enlightenment, by not apprehending morality, enlightenment, the three spheres, or purification.🔽They purify the perfection of patience for the sake of enlightenment, by not apprehending patience, enlightenment, the three spheres, or purification.

original: byang chub kyi phyir brtson 'grus kyi pha rol tu phyin pa yongs su sbyong bar byed pa dang / bdag dang / sems can dang / bsam gtan dang / ting nge 'dzin dang / snyoms par 'jug pa dang / byang chub mi dmigs pas 'khor gsum yongs su dag pas /
analyzed: byang chub kyi phyir brtson 'grus kyi pha rol tu phyin pa yongs su sbyong bar byed pa dang / bdag dang / sems can dang / bsam gtan dang / ting nge 'dzin dang / snyoms par 'jug pa dang / byang chub mi dmigs pas 'khor gsum yongs su dag pas /
translated: They purify the perfection of perseverance for the sake of enlightenment, by not apprehending perseverance, merit, pristine awareness, enlightenment, the three spheres, or purification.🔽They purify the perfection of concentration for the sake of enlightenment, by not apprehending concentration, mental stability, or the three spheres.

original: byang chub kyi phyir bsam gtan gyi pha rol tu phyin pa yongs su sbyong bar byed pa dang / bdag dang / sems can dang / chos thams cad byang chub mi dmigs pas 'khor gsum yongs su dag pas /🔽byang chub kyi phyir shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa yongs su sbyong bar byed pa dang / dge ba'i rtsa ba thams cad kyang yongs su bsngo ba dug med pa dang / yongs su bsngo ba dug med pa dang / yongs su bsngo ba bla na med pa dang /
analyzed: byang chub kyi phyir bsam gtan gyi pha rol tu phyin pa yongs su sbyong bar byed pa dang / bdag dang / sems can dang / chos thams cad byang chub mi dmigs pas 'khor gsum yongs su dag pas / byang chub kyi phyir shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa yongs su sbyong bar byed pa dang / dge ba'i rtsa ba thams cad kyang yongs su bsngo ba dug med pa dang / yongs su bsngo ba dug med pa dang / yongs su bsngo ba bla na med pa dang /
translated: They purify the perfection of concentration for the sake of enlightenment, and they purify the perfection of wisdom for the sake of enlightenment with the purity of the three spheres,🔽not observing a self, sentient beings, or any phenomena in relation to enlightenment. They dedicate all their roots of virtue to unsurpassed, perfect, complete awakening with a dedication that is free of poison, a dedication that is unsurpassed,

original: yongs su bsngo ba mi mnyam pa dang mnyam pa dang / yongs su bsngo ba bsam gyis mi khyab pa dang / yongs su bsngo ba mtshungs pa med pa dang / yongs su bsngo ba gzhal du med pas bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu yongs su sngo bar byed pa ste /
analyzed: yongs su bsngo ba mi mnyam pa dang mnyam pa dang / yongs su bsngo ba bsam gyis mi khyab pa dang / yongs su bsngo ba mtshungs pa med pa dang / yongs su bsngo ba gzhal du med pas bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu yongs su sngo bar byed pa ste /
translated: a dedication that is equal to the unequaled, a dedication that is inconceivable, a dedication that is incomparable, and a dedication that is immeasurable.

original: de ni 'jig rten las 'das pa'i shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: de ni 'jig rten las 'das pa'i shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa zhes bya'o //
translated: This is called the perfection of supramundane wisdom.

original: ci'i phyir na 'jig rten pa zhes bya /
analyzed: ci'i phyir na 'jig rten pa zhes bya /
translated: Why is it called mundane?

original: ci'i phyir na 'jig rten las 'das pa zhes bya zhe na de la 'jig rten pa zhes bya ni gang dag gis 'jig rten du 'gyur ba dang / gang dag 'jig rten du 'grub par byed pa dang / gang dag 'jig rten dang mnyam pa dang /
analyzed: ci'i phyir na 'jig rten las 'das pa zhes bya zhe na de la 'jig rten pa zhes bya ni gang dag gis 'jig rten du 'gyur ba dang / gang dag 'jig rten du 'grub par byed pa dang / gang dag 'jig rten dang mnyam pa dang /
translated: Why is it called supramundane? In this regard, what is called mundane is that by which the world comes to be, that by which the world is accomplished, that which is equal to the world,

original: gang dag 'jig rten gyi phyir sbyin pa dang / gang dag 'jig rten las 'byung bar mi 'gyur ba dang / gang dag 'jig rten gyi yin pa dang / gang dag 'jig rten du 'byung bar 'gyur ba ste /
analyzed: gang dag 'jig rten gyi phyir sbyin pa dang / gang dag 'jig rten las 'byung bar mi 'gyur ba dang / gang dag 'jig rten gyi yin pa dang / gang dag 'jig rten du 'byung bar 'gyur ba ste /
translated: that by which one gives for the sake of the world, that which does not go beyond the world, that which belongs to the world, that which comes to be in the world.

original: de dag ni 'jig rten pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: de dag ni 'jig rten pa zhes bya'o //
translated: These are called mundane.

original: de la 'jig rten las 'das pa gang zhe na /
analyzed: de la 'jig rten las 'das pa gang zhe na /
translated: What is supramundane?

original: gang dag gis 'jig rten sgrol ba dang / gang dag 'jig rten sgrol ba yin pa'am /
analyzed: gang dag gis 'jig rten sgrol ba dang / gang dag 'jig rten sgrol ba yin pa'am /
translated: That by which one is liberated from the world, that by which one is liberated from the world,

original: gang dag gis 'jig rten gyi rgal bar @6a * //🔽bar byed pa'am /🔽gang dag 'jig rten gyi don du mi 'gyur ba'am /
analyzed: gang dag gis 'jig rten gyi rgal bar @6a * // bar byed pa'am / gang dag 'jig rten gyi don du mi 'gyur ba'am /
translated: Those who are a ford for the world,🔽or those who are not for the benefit of the world,

original: gang dag 'jig rten las 'byung bar 'gyur ba'am /
analyzed: gang dag 'jig rten las 'byung bar 'gyur ba'am /
translated: or those who are not for the emergence from the world,

original: gang dag 'jig rten gyi sgrol byed yin pa'am /
analyzed: gang dag 'jig rten gyi sgrol byed yin pa'am /
translated: or those who are a guide for the world,

original: gang dag 'jig rten na sgrol byed yin pa de dag ni 'jig rten las 'das pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: gang dag 'jig rten na sgrol byed yin pa de dag ni 'jig rten las 'das pa zhes bya'o //
translated: or those who are a guide in the world, they are called supramundane.

original: tshe dang ldan pa sh'a ri'i bu byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po pha rol tu phyin pa drug la spyod pa ni de ltar byang chub kyi lam yongs su sbyor bar byed do //
analyzed: tshe dang ldan pa sh'a ri'i bu byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po pha rol tu phyin pa drug la spyod pa ni de ltar byang chub kyi lam yongs su sbyor bar byed do //
translated: Venerable Śāriputra, thus do bodhisattva great beings practicing the six perfections thoroughly purify the path to awakening.”

original: sh'a ri'i bus smras pa /
analyzed: sh'a ri'i bus smras pa /
translated: Śāriputra said,

original: tshe dang ldan pa rab 'byor byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po'i byang chub kyi lam gang yin /
analyzed: tshe dang ldan pa rab 'byor byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po'i byang chub kyi lam gang yin /
translated: “Venerable Subhūti, what is the bodhisattva great beings’ path to awakening?”

original: rab 'byor gyis smras pa /
analyzed: rab 'byor gyis smras pa /
translated: Subhūti said,🔽“Venerable Śāriputra, the bodhisattva great beings’ path to awakening is this: the perfection of giving, the perfection of morality, the perfection of patience, the perfection of perseverance, the perfection of concentration, and the perfection of wisdom.

original: tshe dang ldan pa sh'a ri'i bu dran pa nye bar gzhag pa bzhi ni byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po'i byang chub kyi lam yin no //
analyzed: tshe dang ldan pa sh'a ri'i bu dran pa nye bar gzhag pa bzhi ni byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po'i byang chub kyi lam yin no //
translated: Venerable Śāriputra, the four establishments of mindfulness are the bodhisattvas’ and mahāsattvas’ path to enlightenment.

original: yang dag par spong ba bzhi dang / rdzu 'phrul gyi rkang pa bzhi dang / dbang po lnga dang / stobs lnga dang / byang chub kyi yan lag bdun dang / 'phags pa'i lam yan lag brgyad pa dang / rnam par thar pa'i sgo stong pa nyid dang /
analyzed: yang dag par spong ba bzhi dang / rdzu 'phrul gyi rkang pa bzhi dang / dbang po lnga dang / stobs lnga dang / byang chub kyi yan lag bdun dang / 'phags pa'i lam yan lag brgyad pa dang / rnam par thar pa'i sgo stong pa nyid dang /
translated: The four right efforts, the four legs of miraculous power, the five faculties, the five powers, the seven aspects of enlightenment, the noble eightfold path, the emptiness gate of liberation,

original: mtshan ma med pa dang / smon pa med pa dang / nang stong pa nyid nas dngos po med pa'i ngo bo nyid stong pa nyid kyi bar dang / ting nge 'dzin thams cad dang / gzungs kyi sgo thams cad dang / de bzhin gshegs pa'i stobs bcu dang /
analyzed: mtshan ma med pa dang / smon pa med pa dang / nang stong pa nyid nas dngos po med pa'i ngo bo nyid stong pa nyid kyi bar dang / ting nge 'dzin thams cad dang / gzungs kyi sgo thams cad dang / de bzhin gshegs pa'i stobs bcu dang /
translated: the signlessness gate of liberation, the wishlessness gate of liberation, the emptiness of internal phenomena, up to the emptiness of the essential nature of non-entities, all the meditative stabilizations, all the dhāraṇī gateways, the ten powers of the tathāgatas,

original: mi 'jigs pa bzhi dang / so so yang dag par rig pa bzhi dang / byams pa chen po dang / snying rje chen po dang / sangs rgyas kyi chos ma 'dres pa bcva brgyad dag ste /
analyzed: mi 'jigs pa bzhi dang / so so yang dag par rig pa bzhi dang / byams pa chen po dang / snying rje chen po dang / sangs rgyas kyi chos ma 'dres pa bcva brgyad dag ste /
translated: the four fearlessnesses, the four detailed and thorough knowledges, great love, great compassion, and the eighteen distinct attributes of a buddha.

original: tshe dang ldan pa sh'a ri'i bu de dag ni byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po'i byang chub kyi lam zhes bya'o //
analyzed: tshe dang ldan pa sh'a ri'i bu de dag ni byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po'i byang chub kyi lam zhes bya'o //
translated: Venerable Śāriputra, these are called the bodhisattva great beings’ path to awakening.”

original: sh'a ri'i bus smras pa /
analyzed: sh'a ri'i bus smras pa /
translated: Śāriputra said,

original: tshe dang ldan pa rab 'byor de ni pha rol tu phyin pa gang gi skyes bu'i rtsal yin /
analyzed: tshe dang ldan pa rab 'byor de ni pha rol tu phyin pa gang gi skyes bu'i rtsal yin /
translated: “Venerable Subhūti, whose power is this with regard to the perfections?”

original: rab 'byor gyis smras pa /
analyzed: rab 'byor gyis smras pa /
translated: Subhūti said,

original: tshe dang ldan pa sh'a ri'i bu de ni shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'i skyes bu'i rtsal yin no //
analyzed: tshe dang ldan pa sh'a ri'i bu de ni shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'i skyes bu'i rtsal yin no //
translated: “Venerable Śāriputra, this is the power of the perfection of wisdom.”

original: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: tshe dang ldan pa sh'a ri'i bu 'di ltar shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa ni nyan thos kyi chos rnams dang / rang sangs rgyas kyi chos rnams dang / byang chub sems dpa'i chos rnams dang / sangs rgyas kyi chos rnams dang / dge ba'i chos thams cad skyed par byed pa yin pa ste /
analyzed: tshe dang ldan pa sh'a ri'i bu 'di ltar shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa ni nyan thos kyi chos rnams dang / rang sangs rgyas kyi chos rnams dang / byang chub sems dpa'i chos rnams dang / sangs rgyas kyi chos rnams dang / dge ba'i chos thams cad skyed par byed pa yin pa ste /
translated: Venerable Śāriputra, it is because the perfection of wisdom gives rise to the dharmas of the śrāvakas, the dharmas of the pratyekabuddhas, the dharmas of the bodhisattvas, the dharmas of the buddhas, and all wholesome dharmas.

original: tshe dang ldan pa sh'a ri'i @6b bu shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa ni nyan thos kyi chos rnams dang / rang sangs rgyas kyi chos rnams dang / byang chub sems dpa'i chos rnams dang / sangs rgyas kyi chos rnams dang / dge ba'i chos thams cad yongs su 'dzin cing yang dag par 'dzin par byed pa yin no //
analyzed: tshe dang ldan pa sh'a ri'i @6b bu shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa ni nyan thos kyi chos rnams dang / rang sangs rgyas kyi chos rnams dang / byang chub sems dpa'i chos rnams dang / sangs rgyas kyi chos rnams dang / dge ba'i chos thams cad yongs su 'dzin cing yang dag par 'dzin par byed pa yin no //
translated: Venerable Śāriputra, the perfection of wisdom holds and upholds the dharmas of the śrāvakas, the dharmas of the pratyekabuddhas, the dharmas of the bodhisattvas, the dharmas of the buddhas, and all wholesome dharmas.”

original: tshe dang ldan pa sh'a ri'i bu sngon gyi de bzhin gshegs pa dgra bcom pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas de dag gis kyang shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa 'di la spyad de /
analyzed: tshe dang ldan pa sh'a ri'i bu sngon gyi de bzhin gshegs pa dgra bcom pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas de dag gis kyang shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa 'di la spyad de /
translated: The past tathāgatas, arhats, and completely enlightened buddhas also practiced this perfection of wisdom and

original: bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu mngon par rdzogs par sangs rgyas par gyur to //
analyzed: bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu mngon par rdzogs par sangs rgyas par gyur to //
translated: fully awakened to unsurpassed, perfect, complete awakening.

original: tshe dang ldan pa sh'a ri'i bu ma byon pa'i de bzhin gshegs pa dgra bcom pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas rnams kyang shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa 'di nyid la bslabs nas /
analyzed: tshe dang ldan pa sh'a ri'i bu ma byon pa'i de bzhin gshegs pa dgra bcom pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas rnams kyang shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa 'di nyid la bslabs nas /
translated: Venerable Śāriputra, the tathāgatas, arhats, and completely enlightened buddhas of the future will also train in this very perfection of wisdom and

original: bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu mngon par rdzogs par 'tshang rgya bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu mngon par rdzogs par 'tshang rgya bar 'gyur ro //
translated: fully awaken to unsurpassed, perfect, complete awakening.

original: tshe dang ldan pa sh'a ri'i bu de bzhin gshegs pa dgra bcom pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas gang dag da ltar phyogs bcu'i 'jig rten na bzhugs te 'tsho zhing gzhes pa de dag kyang shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa 'di nyid la bslabs
analyzed: tshe dang ldan pa sh'a ri'i bu de bzhin gshegs pa dgra bcom pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas gang dag da ltar phyogs bcu'i 'jig rten na bzhugs te 'tsho zhing gzhes pa de dag kyang shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa 'di nyid la bslabs
translated: “Venerable Śāriputra, those tathāgatas, worthy ones, perfectly complete buddhas who are now in the world in the ten directions and are living and dwelling there also trained in this perfection of wisdom.

original: nas bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu mngon par rdzogs par sangs rgyas so //
analyzed: nas bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu mngon par rdzogs par sangs rgyas so //
translated: “Venerable Śāriputra, those tathāgatas, arhats, perfectly enlightened buddhas who are present in the world systems in the ten directions, who are alive at present, and who are teaching the sacred doctrine, they too, Venerable Śāriputra, have trained in this very perfection of wisdom and have fully awakened to unsurpassed, perfect, complete awakening.

original: tshe dang ldan pa sh'a ri'i bu shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa 'di bshad pa na gal te byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po nem nur med cing rmongs par ma gyur na /
analyzed: tshe dang ldan pa sh'a ri'i bu shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa 'di bshad pa na gal te byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po nem nur med cing rmongs par ma gyur na /
translated: “Venerable Śāriputra, when this perfection of wisdom is being taught, if a bodhisattva great being does not doubt, does not hesitate,

original: byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po de ni gnas pa 'dis gnas shing yid la byed pa 'di dang ma bral bar rig par bya ste /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po de ni gnas pa 'dis gnas shing yid la byed pa 'di dang ma bral bar rig par bya ste /
translated: then, Venerable Śāriputra, you should know that bodhisattva great being is irreversible from awakening, is practicing this practice, and is not separated from this attention.

original: 'di lta ste /
analyzed: 'di lta ste /
translated: It is like this:

original: sems can thams cad yongs su bskyab pa'i don du sems can thams cad yongs su mi gtang ba'i yid la byed pa dang / snying rje chen po'i yid la byed pa dang ma bral ba'o //
analyzed: sems can thams cad yongs su bskyab pa'i don du sems can thams cad yongs su mi gtang ba'i yid la byed pa dang / snying rje chen po'i yid la byed pa dang ma bral ba'o //
translated: It is to be inseparable from the attention of not abandoning any sentient being for the sake of protecting all sentient beings, and from the attention of great compassion.

original: smras pa / tshe dang ldan pa rab 'byor byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po de ni gnas pa 'dis gnas shing yid la byed pa 'di dang ma bral bar rig par bya'o zhes gang smras pa /🔽rnam par spyod pa 'dis rnam par spyod cing 'di lta ste /🔽snying rje chen po yid la byed pa de dang ma bral bas byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen por 'dod na tshe dang ldan pa rab 'byor de lta na ni sems @7a * //
analyzed: smras pa / tshe dang ldan pa rab 'byor byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po de ni gnas pa 'dis gnas shing yid la byed pa 'di dang ma bral bar rig par bya'o zhes gang smras pa / rnam par spyod pa 'dis rnam par spyod cing 'di lta ste / snying rje chen po yid la byed pa de dang ma bral bas byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen por 'dod na tshe dang ldan pa rab 'byor de lta na ni sems @7a * //
translated: Subhūti, you said, ‘The bodhisattva great beings should be known as those who stand in this kind of standing and are not separated from this kind of attention.’

original: can thams cad kyang byang chub sems dpar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: can thams cad kyang byang chub sems dpar 'gyur ro //
translated: If you think that the bodhisattva great beings who stand in this kind of standing and are not separated from this kind of attention, that is, from the attention of great compassion, are bodhisattva great beings, then, venerable Subhūti, all sentient beings would be bodhisattva great beings.

original: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: tshe dang ldan pa rab 'byor sems can thams cad kyang snying rje chen po yid la byed pa dang ni ma bral lo //
analyzed: tshe dang ldan pa rab 'byor sems can thams cad kyang snying rje chen po yid la byed pa dang ni ma bral lo //
translated: “Venerable Subhūti, all sentient beings are never separate from the attention of great compassion.”

original: rab 'byor gyis smras pa /
analyzed: rab 'byor gyis smras pa /
translated: Subhūti said,

original: tshe dang ldan pa sh'a ri'i bu legs so legs so //
analyzed: tshe dang ldan pa sh'a ri'i bu legs so legs so //
translated: “Excellent, excellent, Venerable Śāriputra!

original: tshe dang ldan pa sh'a ri'i bus yang dag pa'i tshig tu brjod pas don 'di nyid du bzung na khyod la yang klan kar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: tshe dang ldan pa sh'a ri'i bus yang dag pa'i tshig tu brjod pas don 'di nyid du bzung na khyod la yang klan kar 'gyur ro //
translated: If you were to take up this topic with a correct statement, you would be open to criticism.

original: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: 'di ltar tshe dang ldan pa sh'a ri'i bu sems can med pa'i phyir yid la byed pa med par rig par bya'o //
analyzed: 'di ltar tshe dang ldan pa sh'a ri'i bu sems can med pa'i phyir yid la byed pa med par rig par bya'o //
translated: Venerable Śāriputra, you should know that attention does not exist because sentient beings do not exist.

original: sems can stong pa nyid kyi phyir yid la byed pa stong pa nyid du rig par bya'o //
analyzed: sems can stong pa nyid kyi phyir yid la byed pa stong pa nyid du rig par bya'o //
translated: You should know that attention is emptiness because sentient beings are emptiness.

original: sems can rang bzhin med pa'i phyir yid la byed pa rang bzhin med par rig par bya'o //
analyzed: sems can rang bzhin med pa'i phyir yid la byed pa rang bzhin med par rig par bya'o //
translated: You should know that attention is essenceless because sentient beings are essenceless.

original: sems can dben pa'i phyir yid la byed pa dben par rig par bya'o //
analyzed: sems can dben pa'i phyir yid la byed pa dben par rig par bya'o //
translated: You should know that attention is isolated because sentient beings are isolated.

original: sems can mngon par rdzogs par 'tshang mi rgya ba'i phyir yid la byed pa mngon par rdzogs par 'tshang mi rgya bar rig par bya'o //
analyzed: sems can mngon par rdzogs par 'tshang mi rgya ba'i phyir yid la byed pa mngon par rdzogs par 'tshang mi rgya bar rig par bya'o //
translated: One should know that mental activity does not fully awaken to supreme and perfect enlightenment because sentient beings do not fully awaken to supreme and perfect enlightenment.

original: tshe dang ldan pa sh'a ri'i bu gzugs med pa'i phyir yid la byed pa med par rig par bya'o //
analyzed: tshe dang ldan pa sh'a ri'i bu gzugs med pa'i phyir yid la byed pa med par rig par bya'o //
translated: Venerable Śāriputra, one should know that mental activity does not exist because form does not exist.

original: gzugs stong pa nyid kyi phyir yid la byed pa stong pa nyid du rig par bya'o //
analyzed: gzugs stong pa nyid kyi phyir yid la byed pa stong pa nyid du rig par bya'o //
translated: One should know that mental activity is emptiness because form is emptiness.

original: gzugs rang bzhin med pa'i phyir yid la byed pa rang bzhin med par rig par bya'o //
analyzed: gzugs rang bzhin med pa'i phyir yid la byed pa rang bzhin med par rig par bya'o //
translated: One should know that mental activity is essenceless because form is essenceless.

original: gzugs dben pa'i phyir yid la byed pa dben par rig par bya'o //
analyzed: gzugs dben pa'i phyir yid la byed pa dben par rig par bya'o //
translated: One should know that mental activity is isolated because form is isolated.

original: gzugs mngon par rdzogs par 'tshang mi rgya ba'i phyir yid la byed pa mngon par rdzogs par 'tshang mi rgya bar rig par bya'o //
analyzed: gzugs mngon par rdzogs par 'tshang mi rgya ba'i phyir yid la byed pa mngon par rdzogs par 'tshang mi rgya bar rig par bya'o //
translated: One should know that mental activity does not fully awaken to supreme and perfect enlightenment because form does not fully awaken to supreme and perfect enlightenment.

original: de bzhin du tshor ba dang / 'du shes dang / 'du byed rnams dang / rnam par shes pa med pa'i phyir yid la byed pa med par rig par bya'o //
analyzed: de bzhin du tshor ba dang / 'du shes dang / 'du byed rnams dang / rnam par shes pa med pa'i phyir yid la byed pa med par rig par bya'o //
translated: Likewise, because of the non-existence of feeling, perception, volitional formations, and consciousness, one should know that mental activity is non-existent.

original: rnam par shes pa stong pa nyid kyi phyir yid la byed pa stong pa nyid du rig par bya'o //
analyzed: rnam par shes pa stong pa nyid kyi phyir yid la byed pa stong pa nyid du rig par bya'o //
translated: Because of the emptiness of consciousness, one should know that mental activity is emptiness.

original: rnam par shes pa rang bzhin med pa'i phyir yid la byed pa rang bzhin med par rig par bya'o //
analyzed: rnam par shes pa rang bzhin med pa'i phyir yid la byed pa rang bzhin med par rig par bya'o //
translated: Because of the absence of intrinsic nature in consciousness, one should know that mental activity is without intrinsic nature.

original: rnam par shes pa dben pa'i phyir yid la byed pa dben par rig par bya'o //
analyzed: rnam par shes pa dben pa'i phyir yid la byed pa dben par rig par bya'o //
translated: Because of the isolation of consciousness, one should know that mental activity is isolated.

original: rnam par shes pa mngon par rdzogs par 'tshang mi rgya ba'i phyir yid la byed pa mngon par rdzogs par 'tshang mi rgya bar rig par bya'o //
analyzed: rnam par shes pa mngon par rdzogs par 'tshang mi rgya ba'i phyir yid la byed pa mngon par rdzogs par 'tshang mi rgya bar rig par bya'o //
translated: Because of the non-awakening of consciousness, one should know that mental activity does not awaken to perfect buddhahood.

original: de bzhin du khams rnams dang / skye mched rnams dang / rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba rnams dang / bden pa dang / byang chub kyi phyogs kyi chos dang / pha @7b rol tu phyin pa dang / stong pa nyid thams cad dang / mngon par shes pa thams cad dang /🔽ting nge 'dzin thams cad dang / gzungs kyi sgo thams cad dang / rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid kyi bar du med pa'i phyir yid la byed pa med par rig par bya'o //
analyzed: de bzhin du khams rnams dang / skye mched rnams dang / rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba rnams dang / bden pa dang / byang chub kyi phyogs kyi chos dang / pha @7b rol tu phyin pa dang / stong pa nyid thams cad dang / mngon par shes pa thams cad dang / ting nge 'dzin thams cad dang / gzungs kyi sgo thams cad dang / rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid kyi bar du med pa'i phyir yid la byed pa med par rig par bya'o //
translated: Similarly, it should be known that there is no attention because the constituents, the sense fields, dependent origination, the truths, the dharmas on the side of awakening, the perfections, all the emptinesses, all the clairvoyances,🔽all the meditative stabilizations, all the dhāraṇī gateways, up to and the knowledge of all aspects are nonexistent.

original: de bzhin du rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid ngo bo nyid med pa dang / rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid dben pa dang / rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid mngon par rdzogs par 'tshang rgya ba med pa'i phyir yid la byed pa mngon par rdzogs par 'tshang rgya ba med par rig par bya'o //
analyzed: de bzhin du rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid ngo bo nyid med pa dang / rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid dben pa dang / rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid mngon par rdzogs par 'tshang rgya ba med pa'i phyir yid la byed pa mngon par rdzogs par 'tshang rgya ba med par rig par bya'o //
translated: Similarly, it should be known that there is no attention because the knowledge of all aspects is essentially nonexistent, because the knowledge of all aspects is void, and because the knowledge of all aspects is not fully awakened.

original: tshe dang ldan pa sh'a ri'i bu rnam grangs des na byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po ni gnas pa 'di dang yid la byed pa 'di dang ma bral lo zhes kho bo smra'o //
analyzed: tshe dang ldan pa sh'a ri'i bu rnam grangs des na byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po ni gnas pa 'di dang yid la byed pa 'di dang ma bral lo zhes kho bo smra'o //
translated: For this reason, Venerable Śāriputra, I say that the bodhisattva great beings are not separated from this dwelling and this mental attention.

original: de nas bcom ldan 'das kyis tshe dang ldan pa rab 'byor la legs so zhes bya ba gnang ste /
analyzed: de nas bcom ldan 'das kyis tshe dang ldan pa rab 'byor la legs so zhes bya ba gnang ste /
translated: Then the Lord approved of the Venerable Su­bhūti as follows:

original: rab 'byor legs so legs so //🔽'di ltar de bzhin gshegs pa'i mthus rab 'byor khyod ji ltar ston pa de bzhin du byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po rnams la yang shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa bstan par bya'o //
analyzed: rab 'byor legs so legs so // 'di ltar de bzhin gshegs pa'i mthus rab 'byor khyod ji ltar ston pa de bzhin du byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po rnams la yang shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa bstan par bya'o //
translated: “Excellent, Su­bhūti, excellent!🔽In this way, through the power of the Tathā­gata, you have taught the perfection of wisdom to the bodhisattva great beings just as it should be taught.

original: byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen pos kyang ji ltar khyod kyis bstan pa de bzhin du shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la bslab par bya'o //
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen pos kyang ji ltar khyod kyis bstan pa de bzhin du shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la bslab par bya'o //
translated: The bodhisattva great beings should train in the perfection of wisdom just as you have taught it.

original: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'i le'u 'di bshad pa na stong gsum gyi stong chen po'i 'jig rten gyi khams 'di rnam par 'gyur ba drug tu g-yos te /🔽g-yos rab tu g-yos kun du rab tu g-yos so //🔽'gul rab tu 'gul kun du rab tu 'gul lo //
analyzed: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'i le'u 'di bshad pa na stong gsum gyi stong chen po'i 'jig rten gyi khams 'di rnam par 'gyur ba drug tu g-yos te / g-yos rab tu g-yos kun du rab tu g-yos so // 'gul rab tu 'gul kun du rab tu 'gul lo //
translated: When this chapter of the perfection of wisdom was being taught, this great trichiliocosm shook in six ways:🔽it quivered, quivered strongly, and quivered intensely;

original: ldeg rab tu ldeg kun du rab tu ldeg go //🔽'khrugs rab tu 'khrugs kun du rab tu 'khrugs so //
analyzed: ldeg rab tu ldeg kun du rab tu ldeg go // 'khrugs rab tu 'khrugs kun du rab tu 'khrugs so //
translated: it trembled, trembled strongly, and trembled intensely;🔽it quaked, quaked strongly, and quaked intensely;🔽it shuddered, shuddered strongly, and shuddered intensely;

original: 'ur 'ur rab tu 'ur kun du rab tu 'ur 'ur ro //🔽shar phyogs dma' na nub phyogs mtho /
analyzed: 'ur 'ur rab tu 'ur kun du rab tu 'ur 'ur ro // shar phyogs dma' na nub phyogs mtho /
translated: it roared, roared strongly, and roared intensely;🔽the east sank and the west rose,

original: nub phyogs dma' na shar phyogs mtho /🔽lho phyogs dma' na byang phyogs mtho /
analyzed: nub phyogs dma' na shar phyogs mtho / lho phyogs dma' na byang phyogs mtho /
translated: the west sank and the east rose,🔽the south sank and the north rose,

original: byang phyogs dma' na lho phyogs mtho /🔽dbus dma' na mtha' mtho /
analyzed: byang phyogs dma' na lho phyogs mtho / dbus dma' na mtha' mtho /
translated: the north sank and the south rose,🔽the center sank and the periphery rose,

original: mtha' dma' na dbus mtho bar gyur to //
analyzed: mtha' dma' na dbus mtho bar gyur to //
translated: and the periphery sank and the center rose.

original: de nas de'i tshe bcom ldan 'das kyis 'dzum pa mdzad do //
analyzed: de nas de'i tshe bcom ldan 'das kyis 'dzum pa mdzad do //
translated: Then at that time the Blessed One smiled.

original: de nas tshe dang ldan pa rab 'byor gyis bcom ldan 'das la 'di skad ces gsol to //🔽bcom ldan 'das 'dzum pa mdzad pa'i rgyu gang lags /
analyzed: de nas tshe dang ldan pa rab 'byor gyis bcom ldan 'das la 'di skad ces gsol to // bcom ldan 'das 'dzum pa mdzad pa'i rgyu gang lags /
translated: Then the venerable Subhūti said to the Lord:

original: rkyen gang lags /
analyzed: rkyen gang lags /
translated: “What is the cause, Lord, what is the reason for your smiling?🔽What is the reason, O Sugata?”

original: @8a * // bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /🔽rab 'byor ji ltar 'jig rten gyi khams mi mjed 'di nang shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa ston pa de bzhin du shar phyogs kyi 'jig rten gyi khams tshad med grangs med pa dag na yang de bzhin gshegs pa dgra bcom pa yang dag par rdzogs
analyzed: @8a * // bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa / rab 'byor ji ltar 'jig rten gyi khams mi mjed 'di nang shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa ston pa de bzhin du shar phyogs kyi 'jig rten gyi khams tshad med grangs med pa dag na yang de bzhin gshegs pa dgra bcom pa yang dag par rdzogs
translated: The Lord said:

original: pa'i sangs rgyas rnams shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa 'di nyid byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po rnams la ston par mdzad do //
analyzed: pa'i sangs rgyas rnams shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa 'di nyid byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po rnams la ston par mdzad do //
translated: “Subhūti, just as the perfection of wisdom is being taught in this great trichiliocosm, so also in countless world systems in the east, the tathāgatas, arhats, perfectly awakened buddhas are teaching just this perfection of wisdom to the bodhisattva great beings.

original: de bzhin du phyogs bcu kho ra khor yug kun gyi 'jig rten gyi khams tshad med grangs med pa dag na yang de bzhin gshegs pa dgra bcom pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas rnams shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa 'di nyid byang chub sems🔽dpa' sems dpa' chen po rnams la ston par mdzad do //
analyzed: de bzhin du phyogs bcu kho ra khor yug kun gyi 'jig rten gyi khams tshad med grangs med pa dag na yang de bzhin gshegs pa dgra bcom pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas rnams shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa 'di nyid byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po rnams la ston par mdzad do //
translated: In the same way, in the limitless, countless world systems in all ten directions, the tathāgatas, arhats, and completely enlightened buddhas teach just this perfection of wisdom to the bodhisattva great beings.

original: tshe dang ldan pa rab 'byor gyis shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa bstan pa 'di bshad pa'i tshe lha dang mi'i skye dgu rnams las khrag khrig phrag bcu gnyis mi skye ba'i chos la bzod pa skyes so //
analyzed: tshe dang ldan pa rab 'byor gyis shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa bstan pa 'di bshad pa'i tshe lha dang mi'i skye dgu rnams las khrag khrig phrag bcu gnyis mi skye ba'i chos la bzod pa skyes so //
translated: When the venerable Subhūti explained this teaching of the perfection of wisdom, twelve hundred million of the human and divine beings present gave rise to patience with phenomena.

original: phyogs bcu kun gyi 'jig rten gyi khams su sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams kyi shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa 'di bstan pa'i tshe yang sems can grangs med tshad med pa dag gis bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu sems
analyzed: phyogs bcu kun gyi 'jig rten gyi khams su sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams kyi shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa 'di bstan pa'i tshe yang sems can grangs med tshad med pa dag gis bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu sems
translated: When the Lord Buddhas in all the world systems of the ten directions teach this perfection of wisdom, then also countless beings produce the thought of unsurpassed, perfect enlightenment.

original: bskyed par gyur to zhes bya ba ni lam la nges par 'byung ba'o //
analyzed: bskyed par gyur to zhes bya ba ni lam la nges par 'byung ba'o //
translated: This is the emergence in the path.

original: 'di dag gis ni nges par 'byung ba'i sgrub pa bstan pa yin no //
analyzed: 'di dag gis ni nges par 'byung ba'i sgrub pa bstan pa yin no //
translated: By these, the accomplishment of emergence is shown.

original: rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid bstan zin to //
analyzed: rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid bstan zin to //
translated: The teaching of the knowledge of all aspects is finished.

original: 'phags pa bcom ldan 'das ma shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa stong phrag nyi shu lnga pa mngon par rtogs pa'i rgyan dang rjes su mthun par dag par gtugs pa las rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid kyi dbang du byas pa rab 'byor gyi le'u🔽ste dang po'o /
analyzed: 'phags pa bcom ldan 'das ma shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa stong phrag nyi shu lnga pa mngon par rtogs pa'i rgyan dang rjes su mthun par dag par gtugs pa las rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid kyi dbang du byas pa rab 'byor gyi le'u🔽ste dang po'o /
translated: Noble Mother Perfection of Wisdom in Twenty-five Thousand Lines, in Accordance with the Ornament of Clear Realization, Purely Compiled, from the Perspective of the Knowledge of All Aspects, the Chapter of Subhuti, the First.

original: // / de'i tshe yang stong gsum gyi stong chen po'i 'jig rten gyi khams 'di na rgyal po chen po bzhi ji snyed yod pa de dag thams cad kyang lha'i bu stong phrag du ma dang lhan cig 'khor de nyid du 'dus par gyur /🔽de bzhin du lha rnams kyi dbang po brgya byin rnams dang / 'thab bral rnams dang / dga' ldan rnams dang / gzhan 'phrul dbang byed rnams dang / tshangs 'khor rnams nas tshangs pa chen @8b po rnams kyi bar dang / gang yang stong gsum gyi stong chen po'i 'jig rten gyi khams 'di na 'od chung rnams nas gnas gtsang ma'i ris kyi lha rnams kyi bar gyi lha'i bu rnams gnas gtsang ma'i ris kyi lha'i bu bye ba khrag khrig brgya stong du ma dang lhan cig 'khor de
analyzed: // / de'i tshe yang stong gsum gyi stong chen po'i 'jig rten gyi khams 'di na rgyal po chen po bzhi ji snyed yod pa de dag thams cad kyang lha'i bu stong phrag du ma dang lhan cig 'khor de nyid du 'dus par gyur / de bzhin du lha rnams kyi dbang po brgya byin rnams dang / 'thab bral rnams dang / dga' ldan rnams dang / gzhan 'phrul dbang byed rnams dang / tshangs 'khor rnams nas tshangs pa chen @8b po rnams kyi bar dang / gang yang stong gsum gyi stong chen po'i 'jig rten gyi khams 'di na 'od chung rnams nas gnas gtsang ma'i ris kyi lha rnams kyi bar gyi lha'i bu rnams gnas gtsang ma'i ris kyi lha'i bu bye ba khrag khrig brgya stong du ma dang lhan cig 'khor de
translated: At that time, all the Four Great Kings in this great trichiliocosm, together with many thousands of sons of gods, were assembled in that very retinue.

original: nyid du 'dus par gyur te /
analyzed: nyid du 'dus par gyur te /
translated: Similarly, the lords of the gods, Śakra, Suyāma, Santuṣita, Sunirmita, Vaśavartin, and the Mahābrahmās, as well as the sons of gods from the Parīttābha realm up to the Śuddhāvāsa realm in this great trichiliocosm, together with many hundreds of thousands of sons of gods from the Śuddhāvāsa realm, were assembled in that very retinue.

original: rgyal chen bzhi'i ris kyi lha rnams kyi las kyi rnam par smin pa las skyes pa'i lus kyi 'od gang yin pa dang / sum cu rtsa gsum pa rnams dang / 'thab bral ba rnams dang / dga' ldan pa rnams dang / 'phrul dga' ba rnams dang /🔽gzhan 'phrul dbang byed pa rnams nas /
analyzed: rgyal chen bzhi'i ris kyi lha rnams kyi las kyi rnam par smin pa las skyes pa'i lus kyi 'od gang yin pa dang / sum cu rtsa gsum pa rnams dang / 'thab bral ba rnams dang / dga' ldan pa rnams dang / 'phrul dga' ba rnams dang / gzhan 'phrul dbang byed pa rnams nas /
translated: The light of the bodies of the gods of the Heaven of the Four Kings, which arises from the ripening of karma, and the light of the bodies of the gods of the Heaven of the Thirty-Three, the Yāma Heaven, the Heaven of Joy, the Heaven of Delighting in Emanations,

original: gnas gtsang ma'i ris kyi bar gyi lha'i bu rnams kyi las kyi rnam par smin pa las skyes pa'i lus kyi 'od gang yin pa de dag gis de bzhin gshegs pa'i rang bzhin gyi 'od kyi brgya'i char yang nye bar mi 'gro //
analyzed: gnas gtsang ma'i ris kyi bar gyi lha'i bu rnams kyi las kyi rnam par smin pa las skyes pa'i lus kyi 'od gang yin pa de dag gis de bzhin gshegs pa'i rang bzhin gyi 'od kyi brgya'i char yang nye bar mi 'gro //
translated: and the Heaven of Making Use of Others’ Emanations, up to the light of the bodies of the gods of the Pure Abodes, which arises from the ripening of karma, do not approach even a hundredth of the light of the Tathāgata’s nature.

original: stong gi char yang /🔽brgya phrag stong gi char yang /
analyzed: stong gi char yang / brgya phrag stong gi char yang /
translated: They do not approach even a thousandth,🔽a hundred thousandth,🔽a ten millionth,🔽a billionth,

original: bye ba brgya phrag stong gi char yang /
analyzed: bye ba brgya phrag stong gi char yang /
translated: a ten billionth,

original: grangs su yang /🔽char yang / bgrang bar yang /
analyzed: grangs su yang / char yang / bgrang bar yang /
translated: a trillionth,

original: dper yang / rgyur yang nye bar mi 'gro mi bzod de /
analyzed: dper yang / rgyur yang nye bar mi 'gro mi bzod de /
translated: or even a quintillionth of the Tathāgata’s light. They cannot bear comparison to it.

original: de bzhin gshegs pa'i 'od kyi drung na lha de rnams kyi 'od pas de bzhin gshegs pa'i 'od 'ba' zhig rab ces bya'o //
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa'i 'od kyi drung na lha de rnams kyi 'od pas de bzhin gshegs pa'i 'od 'ba' zhig rab ces bya'o //
translated: In the presence of the light of the Tathāgata, the light of those gods is not radiant, bright, clear,

original: dam pa dang / gtso bo dang / mchog dang / rab mchog dang / phul du phyin pa dang / bla na med pa dang / gong na med pa dang / gong ma'i yang gong ma zhes bya ste /
analyzed: dam pa dang / gtso bo dang / mchog dang / rab mchog dang / phul du phyin pa dang / bla na med pa dang / gong na med pa dang / gong ma'i yang gong ma zhes bya ste /
translated: or pure. It is said to be the best, the foremost, the highest, the supreme, the most excellent, the unsurpassed, the unequalled, and the most sublime.

original: dper na 'dzam bu'i chu klung gi gser gyi drung na lcags nag po lham me ma yin /
analyzed: dper na 'dzam bu'i chu klung gi gser gyi drung na lcags nag po lham me ma yin /
translated: For example, in the presence of the gold of the Jambu River, black iron is not radiant,

original: lhan ne ma yin /
analyzed: lhan ne ma yin /
translated: not bright,

original: lhang nge ma yin no //
analyzed: lhang nge ma yin no //
translated: and not clear.

original: de bzhin du gang de bzhin gshegs pa'i rang bzhin gyi 'od kyi drung na lha rnams kyi las kyi rnam par smin pa las skyes pa'i 'od ni lham me ma yin /🔽lhan ne ma yin /
analyzed: de bzhin du gang de bzhin gshegs pa'i rang bzhin gyi 'od kyi drung na lha rnams kyi las kyi rnam par smin pa las skyes pa'i 'od ni lham me ma yin / lhan ne ma yin /
translated: In the same way, in the presence of the natural light of the Tathāgata, the light born from the maturation of the karma of the gods is not radiant,🔽not bright,

original: lhang nge ma yin gyi /
analyzed: lhang nge ma yin gyi /
translated: and not clear.

original: de bzhin gshegs pa'i 'od 'ba' zhig rab ces bya'o //
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa'i 'od 'ba' zhig rab ces bya'o //
translated: Only the light of the Tathāgata is said to be radiant.

original: dam pa dang / gtso bo dang / mchog dang / rab mchog dang / phul du phyin pa dang / bla na med pa dang / gong na med pa dang / gong ma'i yang gong ma zhes bya'o zhes bya ba ni lha rnams kyi 'od mog mog por mdzad pa yin no //
analyzed: dam pa dang / gtso bo dang / mchog dang / rab mchog dang / phul du phyin pa dang / bla na med pa dang / gong na med pa dang / gong ma'i yang gong ma zhes bya'o zhes bya ba ni lha rnams kyi 'od mog mog por mdzad pa yin no //
translated: It is called sublime, foremost, excellent, most excellent, consummate, unsurpassed, unequaled, and beyond compare.

original: de nas lha rnams kyi dbang po brgya byin gyis tshe dang ldan pa rab 'byor la 'di skad ces smras so //
analyzed: de nas lha rnams kyi dbang po brgya byin gyis tshe dang ldan pa rab 'byor la 'di skad ces smras so //
translated: Then Śakra, Lord of the Gods, said to the venerable Su­bhūti,

original: btsun pa rab 'byor stong gsum gyi stong chen po'i @9a * //
analyzed: btsun pa rab 'byor stong gsum gyi stong chen po'i @9a * //
translated: “Venerable Su­bhūti, in this great trichiliocosm,

original: 'jig rten gyi khams na rgyal chen bzhi'i ris kyi lha rnams dang / sum cu rtsa gsum pa rnams dang / 'thab bral ba rnams dang / dga' ldan pa rnams dang / 'phrul dga' ba rnams dang / gzhan 'phrul dbang byed kyi lha rnams dang /
