original: tshad med pa bzhi dang / gzugs med pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa bzhi dang / de bzhin gshegs pa'i stobs bcu dang / mi 'jigs pa bzhi dang / so so yang dag par rig pa bzhi dang / sangs rgyas kyi chos ma 'dres pa bco brgyad bsgom mo //
analyzed: tshad med pa bzhi dang / gzugs med pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa bzhi dang / de bzhin gshegs pa'i stobs bcu dang / mi 'jigs pa bzhi dang / so so yang dag par rig pa bzhi dang / sangs rgyas kyi chos ma 'dres pa bco brgyad bsgom mo //
translated: the four formless absorptions, the ten powers of the tathāgatas, the four fearlessnesses, the four detailed and thorough knowledges, and the eighteen distinct attributes of a buddha.

original: koo shi ka gzhan yang byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po ni rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid dang ldan pa'i sems bskyed pas de mi dmigs pa'i tshul gyis sbyin pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod do //
analyzed: koo shi ka gzhan yang byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po ni rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid dang ldan pa'i sems bskyed pas de mi dmigs pa'i tshul gyis sbyin pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod do //
translated: “Furthermore, Kauśika, bodhisattva great beings, with the thought of awakening connected with the knowledge of all aspects, practice the perfection of giving by way of not apprehending anything.

original: tshul khrims kyi pha rol tu phyin pa dang / bzod pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa dang / brtson 'grus kyi pha rol tu phyin pa dang / bsam gtan gyi pha rol tu phyin pa dang / shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod do //
analyzed: tshul khrims kyi pha rol tu phyin pa dang / bzod pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa dang / brtson 'grus kyi pha rol tu phyin pa dang / bsam gtan gyi pha rol tu phyin pa dang / shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod do //
translated: They practice the perfection of morality, the perfection of patience, the perfection of perseverance, the perfection of concentration, and the perfection of wisdom.

original: koo shi ka gzhan yang byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod pa'i tshe /
analyzed: koo shi ka gzhan yang byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod pa'i tshe /
translated: “Furthermore, Kauśika, when bodhisattva great beings practice the perfection of wisdom,🔽they apply phenomena to phenomena, they equalize phenomena with phenomena, they perfect them, and they expand them.

original: chos kyi chos rnams sbyor bar byed pa dang / chos kyis chos rnams snyoms par byed pa dang / yongs su rdzogs par byed pa dang ; yongs su rgyas par byed pa la so sor brtags pas bdag med pas na chos thams cad ni 'di tsam ste /
analyzed: chos kyi chos rnams sbyor bar byed pa dang / chos kyis chos rnams snyoms par byed pa dang / yongs su rdzogs par byed pa dang ; yongs su rgyas par byed pa la so sor brtags pas bdag med pas na chos thams cad ni 'di tsam ste /
translated: Because they are examined by selflessness, all phenomena are just this much:

original: bdag gam bdag gi ba dang bral ba'o //
analyzed: bdag gam bdag gi ba dang bral ba'o //
translated: free from a self or anything that belongs to a self.

original: de ci'i phyir zhe na /🔽de ni 'di ltar byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po'i dge ba'i rtsa ba'i sems gang yin pa de yang byang @11a * //🔽chub kyi sems dang 'grogs pa ma yin /
analyzed: de ci'i phyir zhe na / de ni 'di ltar byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po'i dge ba'i rtsa ba'i sems gang yin pa de yang byang @11a * // chub kyi sems dang 'grogs pa ma yin /
translated: And why is that?🔽Because the mind of the roots of virtue of a bodhisattva great being is not accompanied by the mind of awakening,

original: yongs su bsngo ba'i sems gang yin pa de yang byang chub kyi sems dang dge ba'i rtsa ba'i sems dang 'grogs pa ma yin /
analyzed: yongs su bsngo ba'i sems gang yin pa de yang byang chub kyi sems dang dge ba'i rtsa ba'i sems dang 'grogs pa ma yin /
translated: and the mind of the dedication is not accompanied by the mind of awakening or the mind of the roots of virtue.

original: byang chub kyi sems gang yin pa de yang yongs su bsngo ba'i sems dang 'grogs pa ma yin pas so //
analyzed: byang chub kyi sems gang yin pa de yang yongs su bsngo ba'i sems dang 'grogs pa ma yin pas so //
translated: And that thought of enlightenment is not accompanied by the thought of dedication.

original: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: koo shi ka byang chub kyi sems gang yin pa de ni yongs su bsngo ba'i sems la med cing mi dmigs la /
analyzed: koo shi ka byang chub kyi sems gang yin pa de ni yongs su bsngo ba'i sems la med cing mi dmigs la /
translated: Kauśika, that thought of enlightenment is not in the thought of dedication, and is not apprehended there.

original: yongs su bsngo ba'i sems gang yin pa de yang byang chub kyi sems la med cing mi dmigs so //
analyzed: yongs su bsngo ba'i sems gang yin pa de yang byang chub kyi sems la med cing mi dmigs so //
translated: And that thought of dedication is not in the thought of enlightenment, and is not apprehended there.

original: koo shi ka de ltar na chos thams cad la so sor yang brtags pas /
analyzed: koo shi ka de ltar na chos thams cad la so sor yang brtags pas /
translated: Kauśika, thus, having investigated each and every dharma,

original: chos gang la yang mngon par zhen par mi byed cing mi dmigs pa 'di ni byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po'i shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'o //
analyzed: chos gang la yang mngon par zhen par mi byed cing mi dmigs pa 'di ni byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po'i shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'o //
translated: one should not settle down on, and should not apprehend, any dharma at all. This is the perfection of wisdom of bodhisattva great beings.

original: de skad ces smras pa dang / lha rnams kyi dbang po brgya byin gyis gnas brtan rab 'byor la 'di skad ces smras so //
analyzed: de skad ces smras pa dang / lha rnams kyi dbang po brgya byin gyis gnas brtan rab 'byor la 'di skad ces smras so //
translated: When this had been said, Śatakratu, head of the gods, asked the elder Subhūti,🔽“Venerable monk Subhūti, how should bodhisattva great beings train in the perfection of wisdom?”

original: btsun pa rab 'byor ji ltar na yongs su bsngo ba'i sems byang chub kyi sems dang 'grogs pa ma yin /
analyzed: btsun pa rab 'byor ji ltar na yongs su bsngo ba'i sems byang chub kyi sems dang 'grogs pa ma yin /
translated: Venerable Subhūti, how is the thought of dedication not accompanied by the thought of awakening?

original: ji ltar na byang chub kyi sems yongs su bsngo ba'i sems dang 'grogs pa ma yin /🔽ji ltar na yongs su bsngo ba'i sems byang chub kyi sems la med cing mi dmigs /
analyzed: ji ltar na byang chub kyi sems yongs su bsngo ba'i sems dang 'grogs pa ma yin / ji ltar na yongs su bsngo ba'i sems byang chub kyi sems la med cing mi dmigs /
translated: How is the thought of awakening not accompanied by the thought of dedication?🔽How is the thought of dedication not present in the thought of awakening, and not found there?

original: ji ltar na byang chub kyi sems yongs su bsngo ba'i sems la med cing mi dmigs /
analyzed: ji ltar na byang chub kyi sems yongs su bsngo ba'i sems la med cing mi dmigs /
translated: How is the thought of awakening not present in the thought of dedication, and not found there?

original: rab 'byor gyis smras pa /
analyzed: rab 'byor gyis smras pa /
translated: Subhūti replied,

original: koo shi ka yongs su bsngo ba'i sems gang yin pa de ni sems ma yin /
analyzed: koo shi ka yongs su bsngo ba'i sems gang yin pa de ni sems ma yin /
translated: “Kauśika, the thought of dedication is not a thought.

original: byang chub kyi sems gang yin pa de yang sems ma yin te /🔽sems ma yin pa de ni sems ma yin pas yongs su yang sems ma yin te /
analyzed: byang chub kyi sems gang yin pa de yang sems ma yin te / sems ma yin pa de ni sems ma yin pas yongs su yang sems ma yin te /
translated: The thought of awakening is also not a thought.🔽That which is not a thought is not a thought, and so it is not dedicated.

original: sems ma yin pa de ni sems ma yin pas yongs su bsngo ba med do //
analyzed: sems ma yin pa de ni sems ma yin pas yongs su bsngo ba med do //
translated: That which is not a thought is not a thought, and so it is not dedicated.

original: de ltar na sems ma yin pa gang yin pa de ni bsam gyis mi khyab pa'o //
analyzed: de ltar na sems ma yin pa gang yin pa de ni bsam gyis mi khyab pa'o //
translated: In that way, that which is not a thought is inconceivable.

original: bsam gyis mi khyab pa gang yin pa de ni sems ma yin pa ste /
analyzed: bsam gyis mi khyab pa gang yin pa de ni sems ma yin pa ste /
translated: What is inconceivable is not the mind.

original: sems ma yin pa de ni sems ma yin pas yongs su bsngo ba med do //
analyzed: sems ma yin pa de ni sems ma yin pas yongs su bsngo ba med do //
translated: That which is not the mind is not the mind, and so there is no dedication.

original: koo shi ka 'di ni byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po'i shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'o zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: koo shi ka 'di ni byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po'i shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'o zhes bya ba ni /
translated: Kauśika, this is the perfection of wisdom of bodhisattva great beings.

original: nyan thos kyi lam gyi bden pa bzhi la dmigs pa'i rnam pa bcu drug rnam par gzhag pa yin no //
analyzed: nyan thos kyi lam gyi bden pa bzhi la dmigs pa'i rnam pa bcu drug rnam par gzhag pa yin no //
translated: This is the presentation of the sixteen aspects that focus on the four noble truths of the śrāvaka path.

original: de nas bcom ldan 'das kyis tshe dang ldan pa rab 'byor la bka' stsal pa /
analyzed: de nas bcom ldan 'das kyis tshe dang ldan pa rab 'byor la bka' stsal pa /
translated: Then the Lord said to the venerable Subhūti:

original: rab 'byor legs so legs so //
analyzed: rab 'byor legs so legs so //
translated: “Excellent, Subhūti, excellent!

original: de ltar byang @11b chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po rnams la shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa ston cing spro ba bskyed pa rab 'byor khyod yang legs so legs so //
analyzed: de ltar byang @11b chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po rnams la shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa ston cing spro ba bskyed pa rab 'byor khyod yang legs so legs so //
translated: It is excellent that you have inspired bodhisattva great beings by teaching them the perfection of wisdom in this way.

original: rab 'byor gyis gsol pa /
analyzed: rab 'byor gyis gsol pa /
translated: Subhūti said:

original: bcom ldan 'das bdag cag gis ni bka' drin dran par bgyi ste bka' drin mi dran par mi bgyi'o //
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das bdag cag gis ni bka' drin dran par bgyi ste bka' drin mi dran par mi bgyi'o //
translated: Blessed One, we should remember your kindness and not forget it.

original: de ni 'di ltar sngon bcom ldan 'das byang chub sems dpa'i spyad pa spyod pa'i tshe /
analyzed: de ni 'di ltar sngon bcom ldan 'das byang chub sems dpa'i spyad pa spyod pa'i tshe /
translated: Because in the past, Blessed One, when you were practicing the conduct of a bodhisattva,

original: sngon gyi de bzhin gshegs pa dgra bcom pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas rnams kyi drung na gnas pa'i nyan thos de dag gis pha rol tu phyin pa drug la gdams pa dang / rjes su bstan pa dang / yang dag par bstan pa dang /
analyzed: sngon gyi de bzhin gshegs pa dgra bcom pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas rnams kyi drung na gnas pa'i nyan thos de dag gis pha rol tu phyin pa drug la gdams pa dang / rjes su bstan pa dang / yang dag par bstan pa dang /
translated: you instructed, taught, and explained the six perfections to the śrāvakas who were in the presence of the thus-gone, worthy, perfect buddhas of the past.

original: len du gzhug pa dang / gzengs bstod pa dang / yang dag par rab tu dga' bar bya ba dang / nges par gzhug par bya ba dang / rab tu gnas par bgyis nas sngon gyi byang chub sems dpar gyur pa'i tshe /
analyzed: len du gzhug pa dang / gzengs bstod pa dang / yang dag par rab tu dga' bar bya ba dang / nges par gzhug par bya ba dang / rab tu gnas par bgyis nas sngon gyi byang chub sems dpar gyur pa'i tshe /
translated: You encouraged them, uplifted them, brought them joy, inspired them, and established them.

original: pha rol tu phyin pa drug la bslabs pa gang gis bcom ldan 'das kyis bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu mngon par rdzogs par sangs rgyas so //
analyzed: pha rol tu phyin pa drug la bslabs pa gang gis bcom ldan 'das kyis bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu mngon par rdzogs par sangs rgyas so //
translated: The Blessed One fully awakened to unsurpassed, perfect, complete awakening through training in the six perfections.

original: bcom ldan 'das de kho na bzhin du bdag cag gis kyang byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po rnams pha rol tu phyin pa drug la gdams par bgyi'o //🔽rjes su bstan par bgyi'o //
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das de kho na bzhin du bdag cag gis kyang byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po rnams pha rol tu phyin pa drug la gdams par bgyi'o // rjes su bstan par bgyi'o //
translated: Blessed One, just so we too should instruct the bodhisattva great beings in the six perfections,🔽we should teach them,

original: yang dag par bstan par bgyi'o //
analyzed: yang dag par bstan par bgyi'o //
translated: we should demonstrate them,

original: len du gzhug par bgyi'o //🔽gzengs bstod par bgyi'o //
analyzed: len du gzhug par bgyi'o // gzengs bstod par bgyi'o //
translated: we should make them take them up,🔽we should make them enthusiastic,

original: yang dag par rab tu dga' bar bgyi'o //🔽nges par gzhug par bgyi'o //
analyzed: yang dag par rab tu dga' bar bgyi'o // nges par gzhug par bgyi'o //
translated: we should make them rejoice,🔽we should make them certain,

original: rab tu gnas par bgyi'o //
analyzed: rab tu gnas par bgyi'o //
translated: we should make them stable,🔽and

original: bdag cag gis byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po pha rol tu phyin pa drug la gdams pa dang / rjes su bstan pa dang / yang dag par bstan pa dang / len du gzhug pa dang / gzengs bstod pa dang / yang dag par rab tu dga' bar bya ba dang /
analyzed: bdag cag gis byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po pha rol tu phyin pa drug la gdams pa dang / rjes su bstan pa dang / yang dag par bstan pa dang / len du gzhug pa dang / gzengs bstod pa dang / yang dag par rab tu dga' bar bya ba dang /
translated: We have instructed, taught, explained, inspired, encouraged, established, and caused many beings to enter into the six perfections.

original: nges par gzhug pa dang / rab tu gnas par bya ba dag kyang bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu mngon par rdzogs par 'tshang rgya bar 'gyur ro //🔽de nas tshe dang ldan pa rab 'byor gyis lha rnams kyi dbang po brgya byin la 'di skad ces smras so //
analyzed: nges par gzhug pa dang / rab tu gnas par bya ba dag kyang bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu mngon par rdzogs par 'tshang rgya bar 'gyur ro // de nas tshe dang ldan pa rab 'byor gyis lha rnams kyi dbang po brgya byin la 'di skad ces smras so //
translated: They will also fully awaken to unsurpassed, perfect, complete awakening.

original: koo shi ka de'i phyir shin tu legs par nyon la yid la zung shig dang / ji ltar byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' @12a * //
analyzed: koo shi ka de'i phyir shin tu legs par nyon la yid la zung shig dang / ji ltar byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' @12a * //
translated: Then venerable Subhūti said to Śatakratu, head of the gods, “Kauśika, therefore listen well and remember, for I will tell you how bodhisattva great beings

original: chen pos shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la gnas par bya ba dang / ji ltar mi gnas par bya ba dag bdag gis bshad do //
analyzed: chen pos shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la gnas par bya ba dang / ji ltar mi gnas par bya ba dag bdag gis bshad do //
translated: “I will teach you, Kauśika, how great bodhisattva beings should stand in the perfection of wisdom and how they should not stand in it.

original: koo shi ka gzugs ni gzugs kyis stong ngo //
analyzed: koo shi ka gzugs ni gzugs kyis stong ngo //
translated: “Kauśika, form is empty of form.

original: koo shi ka tshor ba dang / 'du shes dang / 'du byed rnams dang / rnam par shes pa ni rnam par shes pas stong ngo //
analyzed: koo shi ka tshor ba dang / 'du shes dang / 'du byed rnams dang / rnam par shes pa ni rnam par shes pas stong ngo //
translated: “Kauśika, feeling, perception, volitional factors, and consciousness are empty of consciousness.

original: byang chub sems dpa' ni byang chub sems dpas stong ngo //
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' ni byang chub sems dpas stong ngo //
translated: “A bodhisattva is empty of a bodhisattva.

original: koo shi ka de ltar na gzugs kyi stong pa nyid gang yin pa dang / tshor ba dang / 'du shes dang / 'du byed rnams dang / rnam par shes pa'i stong pa nyid gang yin pa dang / byang chub sems dpa'i stong pa nyid gang yin pa de la gnyis su med cing gnyis su byar med do //
analyzed: koo shi ka de ltar na gzugs kyi stong pa nyid gang yin pa dang / tshor ba dang / 'du shes dang / 'du byed rnams dang / rnam par shes pa'i stong pa nyid gang yin pa dang / byang chub sems dpa'i stong pa nyid gang yin pa de la gnyis su med cing gnyis su byar med do //
translated: “Therefore, Kauśika, the emptiness of form, the emptiness of feeling, the emptiness of perception, the emptiness of volitional factors, the emptiness of consciousness, and the emptiness of a bodhisattva—these are not two, nor are they divided.”

original: koo shi ka byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen pos shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la de ltar gnas par bya'o //
analyzed: koo shi ka byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen pos shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la de ltar gnas par bya'o //
translated: “Kauśika, bodhisattva great beings should stand in the perfection of wisdom like that.

original: koo shi ka gzhan yang mig ni mig gis stong ngo //
analyzed: koo shi ka gzhan yang mig ni mig gis stong ngo //
translated: “Furthermore, Kauśika, the eye is empty of the eye.

original: de bzhin du rna ba dang / sna dang / lce dang / lus dang / yid ni yid kyis stong ngo //
analyzed: de bzhin du rna ba dang / sna dang / lce dang / lus dang / yid ni yid kyis stong ngo //
translated: Similarly, the ear, nose, tongue, body, and thinking mind is empty of the thinking mind.

original: byang chub sems dpa' ni byang chub sems dpas stong ngo //
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' ni byang chub sems dpas stong ngo //
translated: A bodhisattva is empty of a bodhisattva.

original: koo shi ka de ltar mig gi stong pa nyid gang yin pa dang / rna ba dang / sna dang / lce dang / lus dang / yid kyi stong pa nyid gang yin pa dang / byang chub sems dpa'i stong pa nyid gang yin pa de la gnyis su med cing gnyis su byar med do //
analyzed: koo shi ka de ltar mig gi stong pa nyid gang yin pa dang / rna ba dang / sna dang / lce dang / lus dang / yid kyi stong pa nyid gang yin pa dang / byang chub sems dpa'i stong pa nyid gang yin pa de la gnyis su med cing gnyis su byar med do //
translated: Kauśika, in that emptiness of the eye, emptiness of the ear, emptiness of the nose, emptiness of the tongue, emptiness of the body, emptiness of the thinking mind, and emptiness of a bodhisattva there is no duality and there is no nonduality.

original: koo shi ka byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen pos shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la de ltar gnas par bya'o //
analyzed: koo shi ka byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen pos shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la de ltar gnas par bya'o //
translated: Kauśika, bodhisattva great beings should stand in the perfection of wisdom like that.”🔽“Kauśika, in that emptiness of the eye, emptiness of the ear, emptiness of the nose, emptiness of the tongue, emptiness of the body, emptiness of the thinking mind, and emptiness of a bodhisattva there is no duality and there is no nonduality.

original: koo shi ka gzhan yang sa'i khams ni sa'i khams kyis stong ngo //
analyzed: koo shi ka gzhan yang sa'i khams ni sa'i khams kyis stong ngo //
translated: “Furthermore, Kauśika, the earth element is empty of the earth element.

original: de bzhin du chu'i khams dang / mi'i khams dang / rlung gi khams dang / nam mkha'i khams dang / rnam par shes pa'i khams ni rnam par shes pa'i khams kyis stong ngo //
analyzed: de bzhin du chu'i khams dang / mi'i khams dang / rlung gi khams dang / nam mkha'i khams dang / rnam par shes pa'i khams ni rnam par shes pa'i khams kyis stong ngo //
translated: Similarly, the water element, the fire element, the wind element, the space element, and the consciousness element are empty of the consciousness element.

original: byang chub sems dpa' ni byang chub sems dpas stong ngo //
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' ni byang chub sems dpas stong ngo //
translated: A bodhisattva is empty of a bodhisattva.

original: koo shi ka de ltar na sa'i khams stong pa nyid dang / chu'i khams stong pa nyid dang / me'i khams stong pa nyid dang / rlung gi khams stong pa nyid dang / nam mkha'i khams stong pa nyid dang / rnam par shes pa'i khams stong pa nyid dang /

translated: Similarly, one should not stand in the four right efforts, the four legs of miraculous power, the five faculties, the five powers, the seven factors of awakening, the eightfold noble path, the ten powers of a Tathagata, the four fearlessnesses, the four correct understandings, the eighteen distinct attributes of a Buddha, the four noble truths, the concentrations, the immeasurables, the formless absorptions, the ten powers, the fearlessnesses, the detailed and thorough knowledges, or the distinct attributes of a Buddha.

analyzed: dmigs pa'i tshul gyis rgyun du zhugs pa'i 'bras bu la gnas par mi bya'o //
translated: One should not stand in the result of stream enterer,

original: de bzhin du lan cig phyir 'ong ba'i 'bras bu dang / phyir mi 'ong ba'i 'bras bu dang / dgra bcom pa'i 'bras bu dang / rang sangs rgyas nas /
analyzed: de bzhin du lan cig phyir 'ong ba'i 'bras bu dang / phyir mi 'ong ba'i 'bras bu dang / dgra bcom pa'i 'bras bu dang / rang sangs rgyas nas /

original: sangs rgyas kyi bar la gnas par mi bya'o zhes pa ni rtse mor gtogs pa yin no //
analyzed: sangs rgyas kyi bar la gnas par mi bya'o zhes pa ni rtse mor gtogs pa yin no //
translated: This is the peak.

original: dmigs pa'i tshul gyis gzugs rtag ces bya bar gnas par mi bya'o //🔽de bzhin du mi rtag ces bya ba dang / bde zhes bya ba dang / sdug bsngal zhes bya ba dang / bdag ces bya ba dang / bdag med ces bya ba dang / zhi zhes bya ba dang / ma zhi zhes bya ba dang /
analyzed: dmigs pa'i tshul gyis gzugs rtag ces bya bar gnas par mi bya'o // de bzhin du mi rtag ces bya ba dang / bde zhes bya ba dang / sdug bsngal zhes bya ba dang / bdag ces bya ba dang / bdag med ces bya ba dang / zhi zhes bya ba dang / ma zhi zhes bya ba dang /
translated: One should not abide in the view that form is permanent.

original: dben zhes bya ba dang / mi dben zhes bya bar gnas par mi bya'o //
analyzed: dben zhes bya ba dang / mi dben zhes bya bar gnas par mi bya'o //
translated: Similarly, one should not abide in the view that it is impermanent, that it is happiness, that it is suffering, that it has a self, that it is without a self, that it is peaceful, that it is not peaceful,🔽that it is empty, that it is not empty, that it is with signs, that it is signless, that it has wishes, or that it is without wishes.

original: gzugs stong zhes bya ba dang / mi stong zhes bya ba dang / mtshan ma yod ces bya ba dang / mtshan ma med ces bya ba dang / smon pa yod ces bya ba dang / smon pa med ces bya bar gnas par mi bya'o //
analyzed: gzugs stong zhes bya ba dang / mi stong zhes bya ba dang / mtshan ma yod ces bya ba dang / mtshan ma med ces bya ba dang / smon pa yod ces bya ba dang / smon pa med ces bya bar gnas par mi bya'o //
translated: One should not abide in the view that form is empty or not empty, that it has signs or is signless, that it has wishes or is without wishes.

original: dmigs pa'i tshul gyis tshor ba dang / 'du shes dang / 'du byed rnams dang / rnam par shes pa rtag ces bya bar gnas par mi bya'o //
analyzed: dmigs pa'i tshul gyis tshor ba dang / 'du shes dang / 'du byed rnams dang / rnam par shes pa rtag ces bya bar gnas par mi bya'o //
translated: One should not abide in the view that feeling, perception, volitional factors, or consciousness is permanent.

original: de bzhin du mi rtag ces bya ba dang / bde zhes bya ba dang / sdug bsngal zhes bya ba dang / bdag ces bya ba dang / bdag med ces bya ba dang / zhi zhes bya ba dang / ma zhi zhes bya ba dang /
analyzed: de bzhin du mi rtag ces bya ba dang / bde zhes bya ba dang / sdug bsngal zhes bya ba dang / bdag ces bya ba dang / bdag med ces bya ba dang / zhi zhes bya ba dang / ma zhi zhes bya ba dang /
translated: Similarly, one should not dwell on the idea that it is impermanent, or that it is happiness, or that it is suffering, or that it is a self, or that it is not a self, or that it is peace, or that it is not peace,

original: dben zhes bya ba dang / mi dben zhes bya ba dang / stong zhes bya ba dang / mi stong zhes bya ba dang / mtshan ma yod ces bya ba dang / mtshan ma med ces bya ba dang / smon pa yod ces bya ba dang /🔽smon pa med ces bya bar gnas par mi bya'o //
analyzed: dben zhes bya ba dang / mi dben zhes bya ba dang / stong zhes bya ba dang / mi stong zhes bya ba dang / mtshan ma yod ces bya ba dang / mtshan ma med ces bya ba dang / smon pa yod ces bya ba dang / smon pa med ces bya bar gnas par mi bya'o //
translated: or that it is empty, or that it is not empty, or that it is with signs, or that it is signless, or that it has a wish, or that it is wishless.

translated: Similarly, one should not dwell on the idea that the aggregates, the elements, the sense sources, dependent origination, the perfections, the factors of awakening,

translated: the immeasurables, the dhyānas, the formless absorptions, the truths, the higher knowledges, the meditative stabilizations, the dhāraṇī gateways, the powers, the fearlessnesses,

original: de bzhin du mi rtag ces bya ba dang / bde zhes bya ba dang / sdug bsngal zhes bya ba dang / bdag ces bya ba dang / bdag med ces bya ba dang / zhi zhes bya ba dang / ma zhi zhes bya ba dang /
analyzed: de bzhin du mi rtag ces bya ba dang / bde zhes bya ba dang / sdug bsngal zhes bya ba dang / bdag ces bya ba dang / bdag med ces bya ba dang / zhi zhes bya ba dang / ma zhi zhes bya ba dang /
translated: the detailed and thorough knowledges, and the eighteen distinct attributes of a buddha, up to and including the knowledge of all aspects, should not be objectified as ‘permanent’ or ‘impermanent,’ or as ‘happiness’ or ‘suffering,’ or as ‘self’ or ‘selfless,’ or as ‘calm’ or ‘not calm,’ or as ‘isolated’ or ‘not isolated.’

original: dben zhes bya ba dang / mi dben zhes bya ba dang / stong zhes bya ba dang / mi stong zhes bya ba dang / mtshan ma yod ces bya ba dang / mtshan ma med ces bya ba dang / smon pa yod ces bya ba dang /🔽smon pa med ces bya bar gnas par mi bya'o //
analyzed: dben zhes bya ba dang / mi dben zhes bya ba dang / stong zhes bya ba dang / mi stong zhes bya ba dang / mtshan ma yod ces bya ba dang / mtshan ma med ces bya ba dang / smon pa yod ces bya ba dang / smon pa med ces bya bar gnas par mi bya'o //
translated: “isolated” or “not isolated,” “empty” or “not empty,” “with signs” or “signless,” “with wishes” or “wishless,”

original: koo shi ka gzhan yang rgyun du zhugs pa'i 'bras bu 'dus ma byas las gdags zhes bya bar dmigs pa'i tshul gyis gnas par mi bya'o //
analyzed: koo shi ka gzhan yang rgyun du zhugs pa'i 'bras bu 'dus ma byas las gdags zhes bya bar dmigs pa'i tshul gyis gnas par mi bya'o //
translated: he should not abide in the notion that ‘the fruit of entering the stream is imputed on the basis of the unconditioned,’

original: de bzhin du lan cig phyir 'ong ba'i 'bras bu dang / phyir mi 'ong ba'i 'bras bu dang / dgra bcom pa nyid dang / rang byang chub 'dus ma byas las gdags zhes bya bar gnas par mi bya'o //
analyzed: de bzhin du lan cig phyir 'ong ba'i 'bras bu dang / phyir mi 'ong ba'i 'bras bu dang / dgra bcom pa nyid dang / rang byang chub 'dus ma byas las gdags zhes bya bar gnas par mi bya'o //
translated: similarly, he should not abide in the notion that ‘the fruit of being tied to one more rebirth, the fruit of no longer being subject to rebirth, arhatship, individual enlightenment, and unsurpassed, perfect, complete awakening are imputed on the basis of the unconditioned,’

original: rang sangs rgyas nyid 'dus ma byas las gdags zhes bya bar gnas par mi bya'o //
analyzed: rang sangs rgyas nyid 'dus ma byas las gdags zhes bya bar gnas par mi bya'o //
translated: and he should not abide in the notion that ‘a pratyekabuddha is imputed on the basis of the unconditioned.’

original: rgyun du zhugs pa sbyin pa'i gnas zhes bya bar gnas par mi bya'o //
analyzed: rgyun du zhugs pa sbyin pa'i gnas zhes bya bar gnas par mi bya'o //
translated: He should not abide in the notion that ‘one who has entered the stream is a recipient of gifts,’

original: de bzhin du lan cig phyir 'ong ba dang / phyir mi 'ong ba dang / dgra bcom pa nyid dang / rang byang chub dang / de bzhin gshegs pa sbyin pa'i gnas zhes bya bar gnas par mi bya'o zhes bya ba ni bzod par gtogs pa yin no //
analyzed: de bzhin du lan cig phyir 'ong ba dang / phyir mi 'ong ba dang / dgra bcom pa nyid dang / rang byang chub dang / de bzhin gshegs pa sbyin pa'i gnas zhes bya bar gnas par mi bya'o zhes bya ba ni bzod par gtogs pa yin no //
translated: Similarly, he should not stand in the notion that ‘I am a once-returner, a non-returner, or an arhat,’ or in the notion that ‘I am a pratyekabuddha,’ or in the notion that ‘I am a tathāgata, worthy of offerings, perfectly awakened.’

original: koo shi ka gzhan yang byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen pos sa dang po la dmigs pa'i tshul gyis gnas par mi bya'o //
analyzed: koo shi ka gzhan yang byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen pos sa dang po la dmigs pa'i tshul gyis gnas par mi bya'o //
translated: “Furthermore, Kauśika, bodhisattva great beings should not stand in the first level by way of apprehending something.

original: sa gnyis pa dang / sa gsum pa dang / sa bzhi pa dang / sa lnga pa dang / sa drug pa dang / sa bdun pa dang / sa brgyad pa dang / sa dgu pa dang / sa bcu pa la dmigs pa'i tshul gyis gnas par mi bya'o //
analyzed: sa gnyis pa dang / sa gsum pa dang / sa bzhi pa dang / sa lnga pa dang / sa drug pa dang / sa bdun pa dang / sa brgyad pa dang / sa dgu pa dang / sa bcu pa la dmigs pa'i tshul gyis gnas par mi bya'o //
translated: They should not stand in the second, third, fourth, fifth, sixth, seventh, eighth, ninth, or tenth level by way of apprehending something.

original: sems dang po bskyed pa la gnas te sbyin pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa yongs su rdzogs par bya'o zhes bya bar dmigs pa'i tshul gyis @15a * //🔽gnas par mi bya'o //
analyzed: sems dang po bskyed pa la gnas te sbyin pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa yongs su rdzogs par bya'o zhes bya bar dmigs pa'i tshul gyis @15a * //🔽gnas par mi bya'o //
translated: They should not stand in the first production of the thought, thinking, ‘I will complete the perfection of giving.’🔽They should not stand in the second production of the thought, thinking, ‘I will complete the perfection of morality, the perfection of patience, the perfection of perseverance, the perfection of concentration, and the perfection of wisdom.’

original: de bzhin du tshul khrims kyi pha rol tu phyin pa dang / bzod pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa dang / brtson 'grus kyi pha rol tu phyin pa dang / bsam gtan gyi pha rol tu phyin pa dang / shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa yongs su rdzogs par bya'o zhes bya bar dmigs pa'i tshul gyis gnas par mi bya'o //
analyzed: de bzhin du tshul khrims kyi pha rol tu phyin pa dang / bzod pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa dang / brtson 'grus kyi pha rol tu phyin pa dang / bsam gtan gyi pha rol tu phyin pa dang / shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa yongs su rdzogs par bya'o zhes bya bar dmigs pa'i tshul gyis gnas par mi bya'o //
translated: Similarly, one should not abide in the notion that “I will perfect the transcendent perfection of ethical discipline, the transcendent perfection of patience, the transcendent perfection of perseverance, the transcendent perfection of meditative concentration, and the transcendent perfection of wisdom.”

original: de bzhin du dran pa nye bar gzhag pa rnams dang / yang dag par spong ba rnams dang / rdzu 'phrul gyi rkang pa rnams dang / dbang po rnams dang / stobs rnams dang / byang chub kyi yan lag rnams dang / lam rnams yongs su rdzogs par bya'o zhes bya bar dmigs pa'i tshul gyis gnas par mi bya'o //
analyzed: de bzhin du dran pa nye bar gzhag pa rnams dang / yang dag par spong ba rnams dang / rdzu 'phrul gyi rkang pa rnams dang / dbang po rnams dang / stobs rnams dang / byang chub kyi yan lag rnams dang / lam rnams yongs su rdzogs par bya'o zhes bya bar dmigs pa'i tshul gyis gnas par mi bya'o //
translated: Similarly, one should not abide in the notion that “I will perfect the applications of mindfulness, the right efforts, the legs of miraculous power, the faculties, the powers, the branches of enlightenment, and the path.”

original: byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen pos byang chub sems dpa'i skyon med par 'jug par bya'o zhes bya bar dmigs pa'i tshul gyis gnas par mi bya'o //
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen pos byang chub sems dpa'i skyon med par 'jug par bya'o zhes bya bar dmigs pa'i tshul gyis gnas par mi bya'o //
translated: “Bodhisattva great beings should enter into the certainty of the bodhisattvas,” they should not dwell on that as a method of apprehending.

original: byang chub sems dpa'i skyon med par zhugs nas phyir mi ldog pa'i sa la gnas par bya'o zhes de ltar yang dmigs pa'i tshul gyis gnas par mi bya'o //
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa'i skyon med par zhugs nas phyir mi ldog pa'i sa la gnas par bya'o zhes de ltar yang dmigs pa'i tshul gyis gnas par mi bya'o //
translated: “Having entered into the certainty of the bodhisattvas, they should dwell in the irreversible level,” they should not dwell on that as a method of apprehending.

original: byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen pos mngon par shes pa lnga yongs su rdzogs par bya'o zhes dmigs pa'i tshul gyis gnas par mi bya'o //
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen pos mngon par shes pa lnga yongs su rdzogs par bya'o zhes dmigs pa'i tshul gyis gnas par mi bya'o //
translated: “Bodhisattva great beings should perfect the five superknowledges,” they should not dwell on that as a method of apprehending.

original: byang chub sems dpa'i mngon par shes pa lnga la gnas te /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa'i mngon par shes pa lnga la gnas te /
translated: “Bodhisattvas should dwell in the five superknowledges,

original: sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams la blta ba dang / phyag bya ba dang / mchod pa dang / bsnyen bkur ba dang / chos nyan pa dang / thos nas kyang de bzhin du gzhan la bstan par bya ba'i phyir sangs rgyas kyi zhing grangs med pa dang /

translated: In order to see the blessed buddhas, to pay homage to them, to make offerings to them, to honor them, to hear the Dharma from them, and to teach it to others after having heard it, the bodhisattva great beings should go to the buddhafields that are innumerable,🔽incalculable, and immeasurable.

original: gzhal du med pa dang / tshad med par 'gro'o zhes de ltar yang byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen pos dmigs pa'i tshul gyis gnas par mi bya'o //

translated: In this way, the bodhisattva great beings should not abide in a manner of apprehending.

original: sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das de rnams kyi sangs rgyas kyi zhing ma 'dres pa ci 'dra ba de 'dra ba nyid du yongs su bsgrub par bya'o zhes byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen pos dmigs pa'i tshul gyis gnas par mi bya'o //
analyzed: sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das de rnams kyi sangs rgyas kyi zhing ma 'dres pa ci 'dra ba de 'dra ba nyid du yongs su bsgrub par bya'o zhes byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen pos dmigs pa'i tshul gyis gnas par mi bya'o //
translated: The bodhisattva great beings should not abide in a manner of apprehending, thinking, ‘I will fully accomplish buddhafields of the blessed buddhas that are just like that.’

original: sems can rnams bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu yongs su smin par bya'o zhes de ltar yang byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen pos dmigs pa'i @15b tshul gyis gnas par mi bya'o //

translated: The nature of the eye is neither profound nor subtle.

original: rna ba'i ma yin /🔽sna'i ma yin /
analyzed: rna ba'i ma yin / sna'i ma yin /
translated: The nature of the ear is not.🔽The nature of the nose is not.

original: lce'i ma yin /
analyzed: lce'i ma yin /
translated: The nature of the tongue is not.

original: lus kyi ma yin /
analyzed: lus kyi ma yin /
translated: The nature of the body is not.

original: yid kyi rang bzhin ni zab pa ma yin phra ba ma yin no //
analyzed: yid kyi rang bzhin ni zab pa ma yin phra ba ma yin no //
translated: The nature of the thinking mind is neither profound nor subtle.

original: sa'i khams kyi rang bzhin ni zab pa ma yin phra ba ma yin no //
analyzed: sa'i khams kyi rang bzhin ni zab pa ma yin phra ba ma yin no //
translated: The nature of the earth element is not profound and not subtle.

original: chu'i khams kyi ma yin /
analyzed: chu'i khams kyi ma yin /
translated: The nature of the water element is not profound and not subtle.

original: me'i khams kyi ma yin ;
analyzed: me'i khams kyi ma yin ;
translated: The nature of the fire element is not profound and not subtle.

original: rlung gi khams kyi ma yin /🔽nam mkha'i khams kyi ma yin /
analyzed: rlung gi khams kyi ma yin / nam mkha'i khams kyi ma yin /
translated: The nature of the wind element is not profound and not subtle.🔽The nature of the space element is not profound and not subtle.

original: rnam par shes pa'i khams kyi rang bzhin ni zab pa ma yin phra ba ma yin no //
analyzed: rnam par shes pa'i khams kyi rang bzhin ni zab pa ma yin phra ba ma yin no //
translated: The nature of the consciousness element is not profound and not subtle.

original: sbyin pa'i pha rol tu phyin ba'i rang bzhin ni zab pa ma yin phra ba ma yin no //
analyzed: sbyin pa'i pha rol tu phyin ba'i rang bzhin ni zab pa ma yin phra ba ma yin no //
translated: The nature of the perfection of giving is not profound and not subtle.

original: tshul khrims kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'i ma yin /🔽bzod pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa'i ma yin /
analyzed: tshul khrims kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'i ma yin / bzod pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa'i ma yin /
translated: The nature of the perfection of morality is not profound and not subtle.🔽The nature of the perfection of patience is not profound and not subtle.

original: brtson 'grus kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'i ma yin /🔽bsam gtan gyi pha rol tu phyin pa'i ma yin /
analyzed: brtson 'grus kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'i ma yin / bsam gtan gyi pha rol tu phyin pa'i ma yin /
translated: The nature of the perfection of perseverance is not profound and not subtle.🔽The nature of the perfection of concentration is not profound and not subtle.

original: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'i rang bzhin ni zab pa ma yin phra ba ma yin no //🔽nang stong pa nyid kyi rang bzhin ni zab pa ma yin phra ba ma yin no //
analyzed: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'i rang bzhin ni zab pa ma yin phra ba ma yin no // nang stong pa nyid kyi rang bzhin ni zab pa ma yin phra ba ma yin no //
translated: The nature of the perfection of wisdom is not profound and not subtle.🔽The nature of inner emptiness is not profound and not subtle.

original: phyi stong pa nyid kyi ma yin /
analyzed: phyi stong pa nyid kyi ma yin /
translated: The nature of outer emptiness is not profound and not subtle.

original: phyi nang stong pa nyid kyi ma yin /
analyzed: phyi nang stong pa nyid kyi ma yin /
translated: It is not the emptiness of external and internal phenomena.

original: dngos po med pa'i ngo bo nyid stong pa nyid kyi bar gyi rang bzhin ni zab pa ma yin phra ba ma yin no //
analyzed: dngos po med pa'i ngo bo nyid stong pa nyid kyi bar gyi rang bzhin ni zab pa ma yin phra ba ma yin no //
translated: The nature of the emptiness of non-apprehension, the emptiness of inherent existence, the emptiness of all phenomena, the emptiness of intrinsic defining characteristics, the emptiness of non-apprehension, the emptiness of inherent nature, the emptiness of all phenomena, the emptiness of the unobservable, the emptiness of intrinsic identity, and the emptiness of the intrinsic identity of non-entities is not profound and not subtle.

original: dran pa nye bar gzhag pa rnams kyi rang bzhin ni zab pa ma yin phra ba ma yin no //
analyzed: dran pa nye bar gzhag pa rnams kyi rang bzhin ni zab pa ma yin phra ba ma yin no //
translated: The nature of the applications of mindfulness is not profound and not subtle.

original: de bzhin du yang dag par spong ba rnams dang / rdzu 'phrul gyi rkang pa rnams dang / dbang po rnams dang / stobs rnams dang / byang chub kyi yan lag rnams dang / 'phags pa'i lam yan lag brgyad pa dang / 'phags pa'i bden pa rnams dang /
analyzed: de bzhin du yang dag par spong ba rnams dang / rdzu 'phrul gyi rkang pa rnams dang / dbang po rnams dang / stobs rnams dang / byang chub kyi yan lag rnams dang / 'phags pa'i lam yan lag brgyad pa dang / 'phags pa'i bden pa rnams dang /
translated: Similarly, the nature of the right efforts, legs of miraculous power, faculties, powers, branches of enlightenment, noble eightfold path, and the noble truths is not profound and not subtle.

original: mngon par shes pa rnams dang / tshad med pa bzhi dang / bsam gtan bzhi @19b dang ; gzugs med pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa bzhi dang / de bzhin gshegs pa'i stobs bcu dang / mi 'jigs pa bzhi dang / so so yang dag par rig pa bzhi dang /
analyzed: mngon par shes pa rnams dang / tshad med pa bzhi dang / bsam gtan bzhi @19b dang ; gzugs med pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa bzhi dang / de bzhin gshegs pa'i stobs bcu dang / mi 'jigs pa bzhi dang / so so yang dag par rig pa bzhi dang /
translated: The nature of the four fearlessnesses, four detailed and thorough knowledges, four immeasurables, four formless absorptions, and ten powers of the tathāgatas is not profound and not subtle.

original: sangs rgyas kyi chos ma 'dres pa bco brgyad kyi rang bzhin ni zab pa ma yin phra ba ma yin no //
analyzed: sangs rgyas kyi chos ma 'dres pa bco brgyad kyi rang bzhin ni zab pa ma yin phra ba ma yin no //
translated: The nature of the eighteen distinct attributes of a buddha is neither deep nor subtle.

original: ting nge 'dzin dang / gzungs kyi sgo thams cad kyi rang bzhin ni zab pa ma yin phra ba ma yin no //
analyzed: ting nge 'dzin dang / gzungs kyi sgo thams cad kyi rang bzhin ni zab pa ma yin phra ba ma yin no //
translated: The nature of all the dhāraṇī gateways and all the samādhi gateways is neither deep nor subtle.

original: rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid kyi bar ni zab pa ma yin phra ba ma yin no //
analyzed: rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid kyi bar ni zab pa ma yin phra ba ma yin no //
translated: Up to the nature of omniscience is neither deep nor subtle.

original: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: If you ask why,

original: 'di ltar rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid kyi rang bzhin ni zab pa ma yin phra ba ma yin no //🔽de nas lha'i bu de dag 'di snyam du sems par gyur te /
analyzed: 'di ltar rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid kyi rang bzhin ni zab pa ma yin phra ba ma yin no // de nas lha'i bu de dag 'di snyam du sems par gyur te /
translated: it is because the nature of omniscience is neither deep nor subtle.

original: chos bstan pa 'di la ni gzugs su btags pa med do //
analyzed: chos bstan pa 'di la ni gzugs su btags pa med do //
translated: Then the gods thought, “In this teaching of the Dharma there is no designation of form,

original: tshor ba med do //
analyzed: tshor ba med do //
translated: no feeling,

original: 'du shes su med do //
analyzed: 'du shes su med do //
translated: no perception,

original: 'du byed rnams su med do //
analyzed: 'du byed rnams su med do //
translated: no volitional factors,

original: rnam par shes par btags pa med do //🔽skye mched du med do //
analyzed: rnam par shes par btags pa med do // skye mched du med do //
translated: and no designation of consciousness.🔽There are no designations of the sense fields,

original: khams su med do //
analyzed: khams su med do //
translated: no elements,

original: rten cing 'brel par 'byung bar btags pa med do //
analyzed: rten cing 'brel par 'byung bar btags pa med do //
translated: and no dependent origination.

original: pha rol tu phyin par btags pa med do //
analyzed: pha rol tu phyin par btags pa med do //
translated: the perfections are not imputed;

original: byang chub kyi phyogs kyi chos rnams su btags pa med do //
analyzed: byang chub kyi phyogs kyi chos rnams su btags pa med do //
translated: the factors of awakening are not imputed;

original: tshad med pa dang / bsam gtan rnams dang / gzugs med pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa rnams dang / stong pa nyid thams cad du med do //
analyzed: tshad med pa dang / bsam gtan rnams dang / gzugs med pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa rnams dang / stong pa nyid thams cad du med do //
translated: the immeasurables, the concentrations, the formless absorptions, and all emptinesses are not imputed;

original: ting nge 'dzin thams cad du med do //
analyzed: ting nge 'dzin thams cad du med do //
translated: all meditative stabilities are not imputed;

original: gzungs kyi sgo thams cad du med do //
analyzed: gzungs kyi sgo thams cad du med do //
translated: all dhāraṇī gateways are not imputed;

original: de bzhin gshegs pa'i stobs rnams su med do //
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa'i stobs rnams su med do //
translated: the powers of the tathāgatas are not imputed;

original: mi 'jigs pa rnams su med do //
analyzed: mi 'jigs pa rnams su med do //
translated: the fearlessnesses are not imputed;

original: so so yang dag par rig pa rnams su med do //
analyzed: so so yang dag par rig pa rnams su med do //
translated: the detailed and thorough knowledges are not imputed;

original: sangs rgyas kyi chos ma 'dres pa bco brgyad du btags pa med do //
analyzed: sangs rgyas kyi chos ma 'dres pa bco brgyad du btags pa med do //
translated: the eighteen distinct attributes of a buddha are not imputed;

original: chos bstan pa 'di la ni rgyun du zhugs pa'i 'bras bur btags pa med do //
analyzed: chos bstan pa 'di la ni rgyun du zhugs pa'i 'bras bur btags pa med do //
translated: in this teaching of the Dharma the result of stream enterer is not imputed;

original: lan cig phyir 'ong ba'i 'bras bu dang / phyir mi 'ong ba'i 'bras bur med do //
analyzed: lan cig phyir 'ong ba'i 'bras bu dang / phyir mi 'ong ba'i 'bras bur med do //
translated: the result of once-returner and the result of non-returner are not imputed;

original: dgra bcom pa nyid du med do //
analyzed: dgra bcom pa nyid du med do //
translated: the state of a worthy one is not imputed;

original: rang byang chub med sems dpa' rnams su med do //
analyzed: rang byang chub med sems dpa' rnams su med do //
translated: There is no pratyekabuddhahood.

original: byang chub tu btags pa me do //
analyzed: byang chub tu btags pa me do //
translated: There is no designation of enlightenment.

original: yi ge rnams su btags pa med do snyam mo //🔽de nas tshe dang ldan pa rab 'byor gyis lha'i bu de dag la 'di skad ces smras so //
analyzed: yi ge rnams su btags pa med do snyam mo // de nas tshe dang ldan pa rab 'byor gyis lha'i bu de dag la 'di skad ces smras so //
translated: There is no designation of letters.”

original: lha'i bu dag de de bzhin no //🔽de de bzhin te /
analyzed: lha'i bu dag de de bzhin no // de de bzhin te /
translated: Then the venerable Subhūti said to those gods, “Exactly so, divine princes, exactly so!

original: de bzhin gshegs pa'i byang chub ni brjod du med do //
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa'i byang chub ni brjod du med do //
translated: The enlightenment of the Tathāgata is inexpressible.

original: smrar med do //
analyzed: smrar med do //
translated: It is not spoken.

original: de ni sus kyang bstan pa med do //🔽sus kyang @20a * //
analyzed: de ni sus kyang bstan pa med do // sus kyang @20a * //
translated: It has not been taught by anyone.

original: thos pa med do //
analyzed: thos pa med do //
translated: It has not been heard by anyone.

original: sus kyang shes pa med do //
analyzed: sus kyang shes pa med do //
translated: It has not been understood by anyone.

original: lha'i bu dag de lta bas na gang rgyun du zhugs pa'i 'bras bu gnas par 'dod cing /
analyzed: lha'i bu dag de lta bas na gang rgyun du zhugs pa'i 'bras bu gnas par 'dod cing /
translated: Therefore, divine princes, those who wish to abide in the result of stream enterer,

original: rgyun du zhugs pa'i 'bras bu mngon du bya bar 'dod na yang bzod pa 'di la dmigs rten du mi rung ngo //
analyzed: rgyun du zhugs pa'i 'bras bu mngon du bya bar 'dod na yang bzod pa 'di la dmigs rten du mi rung ngo //
translated: who wish to manifest the result of stream enterer, should not take this acceptance as a basis.”

original: gang lan cig phyir 'ong ba'i 'bras bu dang / phyir mi 'ong ba'i 'bras bu dang / dgra bcom pa nyid dang / gang rang byang chub nyid la gnas par 'dod pa dang / gang rang byang chub nyid thob par 'dod pas kyang bzod pa 'di la dmigs rten du mi rung ngo //🔽lha'i bu dag de ltar byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen pos sems dang po bskyed pa nas brjod pa dang / mnyam du med pa las bzung ste /
analyzed: gang lan cig phyir 'ong ba'i 'bras bu dang / phyir mi 'ong ba'i 'bras bu dang / dgra bcom pa nyid dang / gang rang byang chub nyid la gnas par 'dod pa dang / gang rang byang chub nyid thob par 'dod pas kyang bzod pa 'di la dmigs rten du mi rung ngo // lha'i bu dag de ltar byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen pos sems dang po bskyed pa nas brjod pa dang / mnyam du med pa las bzung ste /
translated: Those who wish to remain in the fruit of once-returning, the fruit of non-returning, and arhatship, and those who wish to remain in the state of a pratyekabuddha, and those who wish to attain the state of a pratyekabuddha, should also not take this acceptance as a basis.🔽Thus, O sons of gods, the bodhisattva mahāsattva, from the first production of the thought of enlightenment up to the site of enlightenment, should abide in the perfection of wisdom, as has been explained, and as has been taught by the Tathāgata.

original: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la gnas par bya'o zhes bya ba ni rang sangs rgyas rnams kyis gzung ba'i rtog pa spang pa bstan pa yin no //
analyzed: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la gnas par bya'o zhes bya ba ni rang sangs rgyas rnams kyis gzung ba'i rtog pa spang pa bstan pa yin no //
translated: This shows the abandonment of the conception of the pratyekabuddhas.

original: de nas lha'i bu de dag 'di snyam du sems par gyur te /
analyzed: de nas lha'i bu de dag 'di snyam du sems par gyur te /
translated: Then the gods thought this:

original: gnas brtan rab 'byor la chos nyan pa rnam pa ji lta bu dag btsal bar bya snyam pa dang / de nas tshe dang ldan pa rab 'byor gyis lha'i bu de dag gi sems kyi rnam par rtog pa sems kyis yongs su shes nas lha'i bu de dag la 'di skad ces smras so //
analyzed: gnas brtan rab 'byor la chos nyan pa rnam pa ji lta bu dag btsal bar bya snyam pa dang / de nas tshe dang ldan pa rab 'byor gyis lha'i bu de dag gi sems kyi rnam par rtog pa sems kyis yongs su shes nas lha'i bu de dag la 'di skad ces smras so //
translated: What kind of students of the Dharma should I look for?”🔽Then the venerable Subhūti, knowing in his own mind the thoughts occurring to those devaputras, said to those devaputras,🔽“Devaputras, I should look for students of the Dharma who are like an illusion,

original: lha'i bu dag bdag la chos nyan pa ni sgyu ma lta bu dang / lha'i bu dag bdag la chos nyan pa ni sprul pa lta bur btsal bar bya ste /
analyzed: lha'i bu dag bdag la chos nyan pa ni sgyu ma lta bu dang / lha'i bu dag bdag la chos nyan pa ni sprul pa lta bur btsal bar bya ste /
translated: and, Devaputras, I should look for students of the Dharma who are like a magical creation,

original: des na ci yang mnyan pa med cing ci yang mngon du bya ba med do //
analyzed: des na ci yang mnyan pa med cing ci yang mngon du bya ba med do //
translated: so that there is nothing at all to listen to and nothing at all to actualize.”

original: de nas lha'i bu de dag gis tshe dang ldan pa rab 'byor la 'di skad ces smras so //
analyzed: de nas lha'i bu de dag gis tshe dang ldan pa rab 'byor la 'di skad ces smras so //
translated: Then those devaputras said to the venerable Subhūti,

original: btsun pa rab 'byor ci sems can de dag sgyu ma lta bu ste //
analyzed: btsun pa rab 'byor ci sems can de dag sgyu ma lta bu ste //
translated: “Venerable Subhūti, are those sentient beings like an illusion?

original: nyan pa de dag kyang sgyu ma lta bu yin nam /
analyzed: nyan pa de dag kyang sgyu ma lta bu yin nam /
translated: Are those listeners also like an illusion?

original: sems can de dag sprul pa lta bu ste /
analyzed: sems can de dag sprul pa lta bu ste /
translated: Are those sentient beings like a magical creation?

original: chos nyan pa de dag kyang sprul pa lta bu yin nam /
analyzed: chos nyan pa de dag kyang sprul pa lta bu yin nam /
translated: Are those who listen to the Dharma also like magical creations?

original: rab 'byor gyis smras pa /
analyzed: rab 'byor gyis smras pa /
translated: Subhūti replied,

original: lha'i bu dag de de bzhin no //
analyzed: lha'i bu dag de de bzhin no //
translated: “Divine princes, it is so!

original: de de bzhin te /
analyzed: de de bzhin te /
translated: It is just as you have said!

original: sems can de dag ni sgyu ma lta bu ste /
analyzed: sems can de dag ni sgyu ma lta bu ste /
translated: Those sentient beings are like an illusion.

original: chos nyan pa de dag kyang sgyu ma lta bu'o //
analyzed: chos nyan pa de dag kyang sgyu ma lta bu'o //
translated: Those who listen to the Dharma are also like an illusion.

original: sems can de dag ni sprul pa lta bu ste /
analyzed: sems can de dag ni sprul pa lta bu ste /
translated: Those sentient beings are like a magical creation.

original: chos nyan pa de dag kyang sprul pa lta bu'o //
analyzed: chos nyan pa de dag kyang sprul pa lta bu'o //
translated: Those who listen to the Dharma are also like a magical creation.

original: lha'i bu dag gzugs kyang rmi lam lta bu sgyu ma lta bu'o //
analyzed: lha'i bu dag gzugs kyang rmi lam lta bu sgyu ma lta bu'o //
translated: Divine princes, form is like a dream, like an illusion.

original: lha'i bu dag tshor ba dang / 'du shes dang / 'du byed rnams dang / rnam par shes pa yang rmi lam lta bu sgyu ma lta bu'o //
analyzed: lha'i bu dag tshor ba dang / 'du shes dang / 'du byed rnams dang / rnam par shes pa yang rmi lam lta bu sgyu ma lta bu'o //
translated: Divine princes, feeling, perception, volitional factors, and consciousness are like a dream, like an illusion.

original: lha'i bu dag mig @20b kyang rmi lam lta bu sgyu ma lta bu'o //
analyzed: lha'i bu dag mig @20b kyang rmi lam lta bu sgyu ma lta bu'o //
translated: Divine princes, the eyes are like a dream, like an illusion.

original: de bzhin du rna ba dang / sna dang / lce dang / lus dang / yid kyang rmi lam lta bu sgyu ma lta bu'o //
analyzed: de bzhin du rna ba dang / sna dang / lce dang / lus dang / yid kyang rmi lam lta bu sgyu ma lta bu'o //
translated: Similarly, the ears, nose, tongue, body, and thinking mind are like a dream, like an illusion.

original: de bzhin du sgra dang / dri dang / ro dang / reg dang / lha'i bu dag chos kyang rmi lam lta bu sgyu ma lta bu'o //
analyzed: de bzhin du sgra dang / dri dang / ro dang / reg dang / lha'i bu dag chos kyang rmi lam lta bu sgyu ma lta bu'o //
translated: Likewise, sound, smell, taste, touch, and mental objects are like a dream, like an illusion.

original: mig gi rnam par shes pa dang / mig gi 'dus te reg pa dang / mig gi 'dus te reg pa las byung ba'i tshor ba yang rmi lam lta bu sgyu ma lta bu'o //
analyzed: mig gi rnam par shes pa dang / mig gi 'dus te reg pa dang / mig gi 'dus te reg pa las byung ba'i tshor ba yang rmi lam lta bu sgyu ma lta bu'o //
translated: Visual consciousness, eye contact, and the feelings that arise from eye contact are like a dream, like an illusion.

original: de bzhin du rna ba dang / sna dang / lce dang / lus dang / yid kyi rnam par shes pa dang / yid kyi 'dus te reg pa dang / yid kyi 'dus te reg pa las byung ba'i tshor ba yang rmi lam lta bu sgyu ma lta bu'o //
analyzed: de bzhin du rna ba dang / sna dang / lce dang / lus dang / yid kyi rnam par shes pa dang / yid kyi 'dus te reg pa dang / yid kyi 'dus te reg pa las byung ba'i tshor ba yang rmi lam lta bu sgyu ma lta bu'o //
translated: Likewise, ear, nose, tongue, body, and mind consciousness, and mental contact, and the feelings that arise from mental contact are like a dream, like an illusion.

original: sbyin pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa yang rmi lam lta bu sgyu ma lta bu'o //
analyzed: sbyin pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa yang rmi lam lta bu sgyu ma lta bu'o //
translated: The perfection of generosity is like a dream, like an illusion.

original: de bzhin du tshul khrims kyi pha rol tu phyin pa dang / bzod pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa dang / brtson 'grus kyi pha rol tu phyin pa dang / bsam gtan gyi pha rol tu phyin pa dang / shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa yang rmi lam lta bu sgyu ma lta bu'o //
analyzed: de bzhin du tshul khrims kyi pha rol tu phyin pa dang / bzod pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa dang / brtson 'grus kyi pha rol tu phyin pa dang / bsam gtan gyi pha rol tu phyin pa dang / shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa yang rmi lam lta bu sgyu ma lta bu'o //
translated: In the same way, the perfection of morality, the perfection of patience, the perfection of perseverance, the perfection of concentration, and the perfection of wisdom are like a dream, like an illusion.

original: de bzhin du nang stong pa nyid dang / phyi stong pa nyid dang / phyi nang stong pa nyid nas /
analyzed: de bzhin du nang stong pa nyid dang / phyi stong pa nyid dang / phyi nang stong pa nyid nas /
translated: In the same way, inner emptiness, outer emptiness, inner and outer emptiness,

original: dngos po med pa'i ngo bo nyid stong pa nyid kyi bar yang rmi lam lta bu sgyu ma lta bu'o //
analyzed: dngos po med pa'i ngo bo nyid stong pa nyid kyi bar yang rmi lam lta bu sgyu ma lta bu'o //
translated: up to the emptiness that is the nonexistence of an intrinsic nature are like a dream, like an illusion.

original: dran pa nye bar gzhag pa rnams kyang rmi lam lta bu sgyu ma lta bu'o //
analyzed: dran pa nye bar gzhag pa rnams kyang rmi lam lta bu sgyu ma lta bu'o //
translated: The applications of mindfulness are like a dream, like an illusion.

original: de bzhin du yang dag par spong ba rnams dang / rdzu 'phrul gyi rkang pa rnams dang / dbang po rnams dang / stobs rnams dang / byang chub kyi yan lag rnams dang / 'phags pa'i lam yan lag brgyad pa dang / tshad med pa dang /
analyzed: de bzhin du yang dag par spong ba rnams dang / rdzu 'phrul gyi rkang pa rnams dang / dbang po rnams dang / stobs rnams dang / byang chub kyi yan lag rnams dang / 'phags pa'i lam yan lag brgyad pa dang / tshad med pa dang /
translated: In the same way, the right efforts, the legs of miraculous power, the faculties, the powers, the branches of enlightenment, the noble eightfold path, the immeasurables,

analyzed: rgyun du zhugs pa'i 'bras bu yang rmi lam lta bu sgyu ma lta bu'o //

translated: In the same way, the fruit of once-returner, the one who is a once-returner, the fruit of non-returner, the one who is a non-returner, the fruit of arhatship, and the arhat are like a dream, like an illusion.

analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' nyid kyang rmi lam lta bu sgyu ma lta bu'o //

analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' yang rmi lam lta bu sgyu ma lta bu'o //
translated: A bodhisattva is like a dream, like an illusion.

original: bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub nyid kyang rmi lam lta bu sgyu ma lta bu'o //
analyzed: bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub nyid kyang rmi lam lta bu sgyu ma lta bu'o //
translated: Unsurpassed, perfect, complete awakening is like a dream, like an illusion.

original: sangs rgyas kyang rmi lam lta bu sgyu ma lta bu'o //
analyzed: sangs rgyas kyang rmi lam lta bu sgyu ma lta bu'o //

analyzed: gnas brtan rab 'byor byang chub kyang rmi lam lta bu sgyu ma lta bur bshad dam /
translated: “Elder Subhūti, do you explain that awakening is like a dream, like an illusion?

analyzed: ci de mya ngan las 'das pa yang rmi lam lta bu sgyu ma lta bur bshad dam /

analyzed: lha'i bu dag bdag ni mya ngan las 'das pa yang rmi lam lta bu sgyu ma lta bur smra ste ;

original: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: de ci'i phyir zhe na /

translated: Divine princes, it is because a dream, an illusion, and nirvāṇa are not two, nor are they divided.” This teaches the avoidance of the conception of grasping on the part of the solitary buddhas.

translated: the perfection of generosity, the perfection of moral discipline, the perfection of patience, the perfection of perseverance, the perfection of concentration, and the perfection of wisdom;

original: dran pa nye bar gzhag pa bzhi dang / yang dag par spong ba bzhi dang / rdzu 'phrul gyi rkang pa bzhi dang / dbang po lnga dang / stobs lnga dang / byang chub kyi yan lag bdun dang / 'phags pa'i lam yan @24a * //

translated: the four establishments of mindfulness, the four right efforts, the four legs of supernatural power, the five faculties, the five powers, the seven factors of awakening, and the eightfold noble path;

translated: Is it not taught for the sake of the four detailed and thorough knowledges, the eighteen distinct attributes of a buddha, all the emptinesses, all the meditative stabilizations, all the dhāraṇī gateways, and for the sake of the bodhisattva great beings?

analyzed: btsun pa rab 'byor me tog 'di dag ni ma byung ste me tog 'di dag ni yid las byung ba ma yin no //
translated: “Venerable monk Subhūti, these flowers are not unarisen. These flowers are not born of mind.

original: shing dang / ldum bu dang / 'khri shing las byung ba ma yin no //
analyzed: shing dang / ldum bu dang / 'khri shing las byung ba ma yin no //
translated: They are not born of trees, shrubs, or vines.”

original: rab 'byor gyis smras pa /
analyzed: rab 'byor gyis smras pa /
translated: Subhūti said,

original: koo shi ka 'di skad du me tog 'di dag ni ma skyes pa ste /
analyzed: koo shi ka 'di skad du me tog 'di dag ni ma skyes pa ste /
translated: “Kauśika, you say, ‘These flowers are not unarisen.

original: me tog 'di dag ni yid las byung ba ma yin /
analyzed: me tog 'di dag ni yid las byung ba ma yin /
translated: These flowers are not born of mind.

original: shing dang / ldum bu dang / 'khri shing las byung ba ma yin no zhes zer na /
analyzed: shing dang / ldum bu dang / 'khri shing las byung ba ma yin no zhes zer na /
translated: They are not born of trees, shrubs, or vines.’

original: koo shi ka gang ma skyes pa de ni me tog kyang ma yin no //
analyzed: koo shi ka gang ma skyes pa de ni me tog kyang ma yin no //
translated: Kauśika, what is unarisen is not a flower.

original: lha rnams kyi dbang po brgya byin gyis smras pa /
analyzed: lha rnams kyi dbang po brgya byin gyis smras pa /
translated: Śakra, Lord of the Gods, said,

original: btsun pa rab 'byor me tog 'di dag kho na ma byung ba yin nam /
analyzed: btsun pa rab 'byor me tog 'di dag kho na ma byung ba yin nam /
translated: “Venerable Subhūti, are only these flowers unarisen,

original: 'on te gzugs kyang ma byung ;
analyzed: 'on te gzugs kyang ma byung ;
translated: or are also form,

original: tshor ba dang / 'du shes dang / 'du byed rnams dang / rnam par shes pa yang ma byung ba yin /
analyzed: tshor ba dang / 'du shes dang / 'du byed rnams dang / rnam par shes pa yang ma byung ba yin /
translated: feeling, notion, co-producing factors, and consciousness unarisen?”

original: rab 'byor gyis smras pa /
analyzed: rab 'byor gyis smras pa /
translated: Subhūti said,

original: koo shi ka me tog 'di dag kho na ma byung ba ma yin gyi /
analyzed: koo shi ka me tog 'di dag kho na ma byung ba ma yin gyi /
translated: “Kauśika, not only are these flowers unarisen,

original: koo shi ka gzugs kyang ma byung ba ste /
analyzed: koo shi ka gzugs kyang ma byung ba ste /
translated: Kauśika, form is also unarisen.

original: gang ma byung ba de ni gzugs ma yin no //
analyzed: gang ma byung ba de ni gzugs ma yin no //
translated: What is unarisen is not form.

original: koo shi ka tshor ba dang / 'du shes dang / 'du byed rnams dang / rnam par shes pa yang ma byung ba ste /
analyzed: koo shi ka tshor ba dang / 'du shes dang / 'du byed rnams dang / rnam par shes pa yang ma byung ba ste /
translated: Kauśika, feeling, notion, co-producing factors, and consciousness are also unarisen.

original: gang ma byung ba de ni rnam par shes pa ma yin no //
analyzed: gang ma byung ba de ni rnam par shes pa ma yin no //
translated: What is unarisen is not consciousness.

original: koo shi ka mig ni ma byung ba ste /
analyzed: koo shi ka mig ni ma byung ba ste /
translated: Kauśika, the eyes are unarisen.

original: gang ma byung ba de ni mig ma yin no //
analyzed: gang ma byung ba de ni mig ma yin no //
translated: What is unarisen is not the eyes.

original: koo shi ka de bzhin du rna ba dang / sna dang / lce dang / lus dang / yid ni ma byung ba ste gang ma byung ba de ni yid ma yin no //
analyzed: koo shi ka de bzhin du rna ba dang / sna dang / lce dang / lus dang / yid ni ma byung ba ste gang ma byung ba de ni yid ma yin no //
translated: “Similarly, Kauśika, the ear, nose, tongue, body, and mind have not come into being.

original: koo shi ka sa'i khams ni ma byung ba ste /
analyzed: koo shi ka sa'i khams ni ma byung ba ste /
translated: Kauśika, the earth element has not come into being.

original: gang ma byung ba de ni sa'i khams ma yin no //
analyzed: gang ma byung ba de ni sa'i khams ma yin no //
translated: What has not come into being is not the earth element.

original: koo shi ka de bzhin du chu'i khams dang / me'i khams dang / rlung gi khams dang / nam mkha'i khams dang / rnam par shes pa'i khams ni ma byung ba ste /
analyzed: koo shi ka de bzhin du chu'i khams dang / me'i khams dang / rlung gi khams dang / nam mkha'i khams dang / rnam par shes pa'i khams ni ma byung ba ste /
translated: Similarly, Kauśika, the water element, the fire element, the wind element, the space element, and the consciousness element have not come into being.

original: gang ma byung ba de ni rnam par shes pa'i khams ma yin no //
analyzed: gang ma byung ba de ni rnam par shes pa'i khams ma yin no //
translated: What has not come into being is not the consciousness element.

original: koo shi ka sbyin pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa ni ma byung ba ste /
analyzed: koo shi ka sbyin pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa ni ma byung ba ste /
translated: Kauśika, the perfection of giving has not come into being.

original: gang ma byung ba de ni sbyin pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa ma yin no //
analyzed: gang ma byung ba de ni sbyin pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa ma yin no //
translated: What has not come into being is not the perfection of giving.

original: koo shi ka de bzhin du tshul khrims kyi pha rol tu phyin pa dang / bzod pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa dang / @26b brtson 'grus kyi pha rol tu phyin pa dang / bsam gtan gyi pha rol tu phyin pa dang / shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa ni ma byung ba ste /
analyzed: koo shi ka de bzhin du tshul khrims kyi pha rol tu phyin pa dang / bzod pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa dang / @26b brtson 'grus kyi pha rol tu phyin pa dang / bsam gtan gyi pha rol tu phyin pa dang / shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa ni ma byung ba ste /
translated: Similarly, Kauśika, the perfection of morality, the perfection of patience, the perfection of perseverance, the perfection of concentration, and the perfection of wisdom have not come into being.

original: gang ma byung ba de ni shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa ma yin no //
analyzed: gang ma byung ba de ni shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa ma yin no //
translated: What has not come into being is not the perfection of wisdom.

original: koo shi ka nang stong pa nyid ni ma byung ba ste /
analyzed: koo shi ka nang stong pa nyid ni ma byung ba ste /
translated: Kauśika, inner emptiness has not come into being.

original: gang ma byung ba de ni nang stong pa nyid ma yin no //
analyzed: gang ma byung ba de ni nang stong pa nyid ma yin no //
translated: What has not come into being is not inner emptiness.

original: koo shi ka dngos po med pa'i ngo bo nyid stong pa nyid kyi bar ni ma byung ba ste /
analyzed: koo shi ka dngos po med pa'i ngo bo nyid stong pa nyid kyi bar ni ma byung ba ste /
translated: Kauśika, up to the emptiness that is the nonexistence of an intrinsic nature has not come into being.

original: gang ma byung ba de ni dngos po med pa'i ngo bo nyid stong pa nyid ma yin no //
analyzed: gang ma byung ba de ni dngos po med pa'i ngo bo nyid stong pa nyid ma yin no //
translated: What has not come into being is not the emptiness that is the nonexistence of an intrinsic nature.

original: koo shi ka dran pa nye bar gzhag pa rnams ni ma byung ba ste /
analyzed: koo shi ka dran pa nye bar gzhag pa rnams ni ma byung ba ste /
translated: Kauśika, the applications of mindfulness have not come into being.

original: gang ma byung ba de ni dran pa nye bar gzhag pa rnams ma yin no //
analyzed: gang ma byung ba de ni dran pa nye bar gzhag pa rnams ma yin no //
translated: What has not arisen is not the applications of mindfulness.

original: koo shi ka de bzhin du yang dag par spong ba rnams dang / rdzu 'phrul gyi rkang pa rnams dang / dbang po rnams dang / stobs rnams dang / byang chub kyi yan lag rnams dang / 'phags pa'i lam yan lag brgyad pa ni ma byung ba ste /
analyzed: koo shi ka de bzhin du yang dag par spong ba rnams dang / rdzu 'phrul gyi rkang pa rnams dang / dbang po rnams dang / stobs rnams dang / byang chub kyi yan lag rnams dang / 'phags pa'i lam yan lag brgyad pa ni ma byung ba ste /
translated: “Kauśika, in the same way, the right efforts, legs of miraculous power, faculties, powers, branches of awakening, and eightfold noble path have not arisen.

original: gang ma byung ba de ni 'phags pa'i lam yan lag brgyad pa ma yin no ;
analyzed: gang ma byung ba de ni 'phags pa'i lam yan lag brgyad pa ma yin no ;
translated: What has not arisen is not the eightfold noble path.

original: / koo shi ka de bzhin du mngon par shes pa rnams dang / bden pa dang / tshad med pa dang / bsam gtan dang / gzugs med pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa dang / de bzhin gshegs pa'i stobs dang / mi 'jigs pa bzhi dang /
analyzed: / koo shi ka de bzhin du mngon par shes pa rnams dang / bden pa dang / tshad med pa dang / bsam gtan dang / gzugs med pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa dang / de bzhin gshegs pa'i stobs dang / mi 'jigs pa bzhi dang /
translated: “Kauśika, in the same way, the clairvoyances, truths, immeasurables, concentrations, formless absorptions, powers of the tathāgatas, four fearlessnesses,

original: so so yang dag par rig pa bzhi dang / sangs rgyas kyi chos ma 'dres pa bco brgyad ni ma byung ba ste /
analyzed: so so yang dag par rig pa bzhi dang / sangs rgyas kyi chos ma 'dres pa bco brgyad ni ma byung ba ste /
translated: four detailed and thorough knowledges, and eighteen distinct attributes of a buddha have not arisen.

original: gang ma byung ba de ni sangs rgyas kyi chos ma 'dres pa rnams ma yin no //
analyzed: gang ma byung ba de ni sangs rgyas kyi chos ma 'dres pa rnams ma yin no //
translated: That which has not come into being is not the eighteen distinct qualities of the buddhas.

original: koo shi ka rgyun du zhugs pa'i 'bras bu ni ma byung ba ste /
analyzed: koo shi ka rgyun du zhugs pa'i 'bras bu ni ma byung ba ste /
translated: “Kauśika, the fruit of entering the stream is not something that has come into being.

original: gang ma byung ba de ni rgyun du zhugs pa'i 'bras bu ma yin no //
analyzed: gang ma byung ba de ni rgyun du zhugs pa'i 'bras bu ma yin no //
translated: That which has not come into being is not the fruit of entering the stream.

original: koo shi ka de bzhin du lan cig phyir 'ong ba'i 'bras bu dang / phyir mi 'ong ba'i 'bras bu dang / dgra bcom pa nyid dang / rang sangs rgyas dang / rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid ni ma byung ba ste /
analyzed: koo shi ka de bzhin du lan cig phyir 'ong ba'i 'bras bu dang / phyir mi 'ong ba'i 'bras bu dang / dgra bcom pa nyid dang / rang sangs rgyas dang / rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid ni ma byung ba ste /
translated: “Kauśika, similarly, the fruit of being tied to one more rebirth, the fruit of no longer being subject to rebirth, arhatship, individual enlightenment, and the knowledge of all aspects is not something that has come into being.

original: gang ma byung ba de ni rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid ma yin no //
analyzed: gang ma byung ba de ni rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid ma yin no //
translated: That which has not come into being is not the knowledge of all aspects.

original: koo shi ka rgyun du zhugs pa ni ma byung ba ste ;
analyzed: koo shi ka rgyun du zhugs pa ni ma byung ba ste ;
translated: “Kauśika, one who has entered the stream is not something that has come into being.

original: gang ma byung ba de ni rgyun du zhugs pa ma yin no //
analyzed: gang ma byung ba de ni rgyun du zhugs pa ma yin no //
translated: That which has not come into being is not one who has entered the stream.

original: koo shi ka de bzhin du lan cig phyir 'ong ba dang / phyir mi 'ong ba dang / dgra bcom ba nyid dang / rang sangs rgyas dang / de bzhin gshegs pa dgra bcom pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas ni ma byung ba ste /🔽gang ma byung ba de ni de @27a * //
analyzed: koo shi ka de bzhin du lan cig phyir 'ong ba dang / phyir mi 'ong ba dang / dgra bcom ba nyid dang / rang sangs rgyas dang / de bzhin gshegs pa dgra bcom pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas ni ma byung ba ste / gang ma byung ba de ni de @27a * //
translated: In the same way, Kauśika, the once-returner, the non-returner, the arhat, the pratyekabuddha, and the Tathāgata, Arhat, Perfectly Awakened One have not come into being.🔽What has not come into being is not the Tathāgata.

original: bzhin gshegs pa ma yin no zhes bya bas ni mngon par rtogs pa'i rigs bstan pa yin no //
analyzed: bzhin gshegs pa ma yin no zhes bya bas ni mngon par rtogs pa'i rigs bstan pa yin no //
translated: By this, the family of realization is taught.

original: de nas lha'i dbang po brgya byin gyis bcom ldan 'das la 'di skad ces gsol to //
analyzed: de nas lha'i dbang po brgya byin gyis bcom ldan 'das la 'di skad ces gsol to //
translated: Then Śakra, Lord of the Gods, said to the Blessed One:

original: kye ma gnas brtan rab 'byor 'di ltar btags pa dang yang mi 'gal la /
analyzed: kye ma gnas brtan rab 'byor 'di ltar btags pa dang yang mi 'gal la /
translated: Ah! The elder Subhūti, in this way, does not contradict designation,

original: chos nyid kyang ston pa ni shes rab zab mo dang ldan no /
analyzed: chos nyid kyang ston pa ni shes rab zab mo dang ldan no /
translated: and yet teaches the true nature of dharmas. He possesses profound wisdom.

original: de nas bcom ldan 'das kyis lha rnams kyi dbang po brgya byin la bka' stsal pa /🔽de de bzhin no //
analyzed: de nas bcom ldan 'das kyis lha rnams kyi dbang po brgya byin la bka' stsal pa / de de bzhin no //
translated: Then the Blessed One said to Śakra, Lord of the Gods:🔽So it is, Kauśika, so it is!

original: koo shi ka de de bzhin te /
analyzed: koo shi ka de de bzhin te /
translated: Kauśika, it is just as you have said.

original: gnas brtan rab 'byor 'di ni shes rab zab mo dang ldan pa ste /
analyzed: gnas brtan rab 'byor 'di ni shes rab zab mo dang ldan pa ste /
translated: The elder Subhūti is endowed with profound wisdom.

original: de ltar btags pa dang yang mi 'gal la chos nyid kyang ston to //
analyzed: de ltar btags pa dang yang mi 'gal la chos nyid kyang ston to //
translated: Thus, he does not contradict designations and yet teaches the intrinsic nature.

original: de nas lha rnams kyi dbang po brgya byin gyis bcom ldan 'das la gsol pa /
analyzed: de nas lha rnams kyi dbang po brgya byin gyis bcom ldan 'das la gsol pa /
translated: Then Śatakratu, head of the gods, said to the Lord,

original: bcom ldan 'das ji ltar gnas brtan rab 'byor 'di ni btags pa dang yang mi 'gal la chos nyid kyang ston pa lags /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das ji ltar gnas brtan rab 'byor 'di ni btags pa dang yang mi 'gal la chos nyid kyang ston pa lags /
translated: “Lord, how is it that the elder Subhūti does not contradict designations and yet teaches the intrinsic nature?”

original: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
translated: The Lord said,

original: koo shi ka gzugs ni btags pa tsam mo //
analyzed: koo shi ka gzugs ni btags pa tsam mo //
translated: “Kauśika, form is a mere designation.

original: btags pa tsam gang yin pa de ni chos nyid de /
analyzed: btags pa tsam gang yin pa de ni chos nyid de /
translated: What is a mere designation is the intrinsic nature.

original: de ni gnas brtan rab 'byor gyis mi 'gal bar bstan to //
analyzed: de ni gnas brtan rab 'byor gyis mi 'gal bar bstan to //
translated: That is taught by the elder Subhūti without contradicting it.

original: koo shi ka tshor ba dang / 'du shes dang / 'du byed rnams dang / rnam par shes pa ni btags pa tsam mo //
analyzed: koo shi ka tshor ba dang / 'du shes dang / 'du byed rnams dang / rnam par shes pa ni btags pa tsam mo //
translated: Kauśika, feeling, perception, volitional factors, and consciousness are mere designations.

original: btags pa tsam gang yin pa de ni chos nyid de //
analyzed: btags pa tsam gang yin pa de ni chos nyid de //
translated: What is a mere designation is the intrinsic nature.

original: de ni gnas brtan rab 'byor gyis mi 'gal bar bstan to //
analyzed: de ni gnas brtan rab 'byor gyis mi 'gal bar bstan to //
translated: That is taught by the elder Subhūti without contradicting it.

original: koo shi ka de ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: koo shi ka de ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: “Kauśika, why is that?

original: chos rnams kyi chos nyid gang yin pa de ni mi 'gal rnam par mi 'gal lo //
analyzed: chos rnams kyi chos nyid gang yin pa de ni mi 'gal rnam par mi 'gal lo //
translated: The intrinsic nature of phenomena is not contradictory and is not non-contradictory.

original: gang mi 'gal rnam par mi 'gal ba de ni /
analyzed: gang mi 'gal rnam par mi 'gal ba de ni /
translated: That which is not contradictory and is not non-contradictory

original: gnas brtan rab 'byor gyis bstan te 'gal ba med do //
analyzed: gnas brtan rab 'byor gyis bstan te 'gal ba med do //
translated: is taught by the elder Subhūti without contradiction.

original: koo shi ka so so ba dang / bsdus pa'i phung po dang / khams dang / skye mched dang / rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba'i yan lag rnams dang / sbyin pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa dang / tshul khrims kyi pha rol tu phyin pa dang /
analyzed: koo shi ka so so ba dang / bsdus pa'i phung po dang / khams dang / skye mched dang / rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba'i yan lag rnams dang / sbyin pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa dang / tshul khrims kyi pha rol tu phyin pa dang /
translated: “Kauśika, the individual and the combined aggregates, elements, sense fields, and links of dependent origination, and the perfections—the perfection of generosity, the perfection of conduct,
