analyzed: bzod pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa dang / brtson 'grus kyi pha rol tu phyin pa dang dang ; bsam gtan gyi pha rol tu phyin pa dang / shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa dang / de bzhin du nang stong pa nyid dang /
translated: the perfection of patience, the perfection of diligence, the perfection of concentration, the perfection of wisdom, and likewise, internal emptiness,

translated: up to the emptiness that is the nonexistence of an intrinsic nature, and similarly, the applications of mindfulness, the right efforts, the legs of miraculous power, the faculties, the powers,

analyzed: byang chub kyi yan lag rnams dang / 'phags pa'i lam yan lag brgyad pa rnams dang / tshad med pa rnams dang / bsam gtan rnams dang / gzugs med pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa rnams dang / mngon par shes pa rnams dang / bden pa rnams dang /
translated: the branches of awakening, the noble eightfold path, the immeasurables, the concentrations, the formless absorptions, the clairvoyances, the truths,

analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa'i stobs bcu rnams dang / mi 'jigs pa rnams dang / so so yang dag par rig pa rnams dang / sangs rgyas kyi chos ma 'dres pa bco brgyad po rnams dang / de bzhin du rgyun du zhugs pa'i 'bras bu dang /
translated: the ten powers of the tathāgatas, the fearlessnesses, the detailed and thorough knowledges, the eighteen distinct attributes of a buddha, and similarly, the result of stream enterer,

analyzed: lan cig phyir 'ong ba'i 'bras bu dang ; phyir mi 'ong ba'i 'bras bu dang / dgra bcom ba nyid dang / rang byang chub nyid dang / rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid dang / rgyun du zhugs pa ni btags pa tsam mo //

translated: What is a mere designation is the real nature of dharmas.

analyzed: de ni gnas brtan rab 'byor gyis mi 'gal bar bstan to //
translated: That is taught by the elder Subhūti without contradicting it.

original: koo shi ka de bzhin du lan cig phyir 'ong ba dang / phyir mi 'ong ba dang / dgra bcom pa dang / rang sangs rgyas dang / de bzhin gshegs pa dgra bcom pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas ni btags pa tsam mo //
analyzed: koo shi ka de bzhin du lan cig phyir 'ong ba dang / phyir mi 'ong ba dang / dgra bcom pa dang / rang sangs rgyas dang / de bzhin gshegs pa dgra bcom pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas ni btags pa tsam mo //
translated: In the same way, Kauśika, the once-returner, the non-returner, the arhat, the pratyekabuddha, and the tathāgata, arhat, perfectly awakened buddha are mere designations.

original: btags pa tsam gang yin pa de ni chos nyid de /
analyzed: btags pa tsam gang yin pa de ni chos nyid de /
translated: What is a mere designation is the real nature of dharmas.

original: de ni gnas brtan rab 'byor gyis mi 'gal bar bstan to //
analyzed: de ni gnas brtan rab 'byor gyis mi 'gal bar bstan to //
translated: That is taught by the elder Subhūti without contradicting it.

original: koo shi ka de ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: koo shi ka de ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that, Kauśika?

original: chos rnams kyi chos nyid de ni mi 'gal ba ste /
analyzed: chos rnams kyi chos nyid de ni mi 'gal ba ste /
translated: The real nature of dharmas is non-contradictory.

original: gang mi 'gal ba de ni gnas brtan rab 'byor gyis bstan te 'gal ba med do //
analyzed: gang mi 'gal ba de ni gnas brtan rab 'byor gyis bstan te 'gal ba med do //
translated: What is not in conflict, that is what the elder Subhūti teaches, and there is no conflict.

original: koo shi ka de ltar na gnas brtan rab 'byor ni btags pa dang 'gal bar mi byed la chos nyid kyang ston te //
analyzed: koo shi ka de ltar na gnas brtan rab 'byor ni btags pa dang 'gal bar mi byed la chos nyid kyang ston te //
translated: In this way, Kauśika, the elder Subhūti does not contradict designations and also teaches the intrinsic nature.

original: rab 'byor gyis smras pa /
analyzed: rab 'byor gyis smras pa /
translated: Subhūti said,

original: koo shi ka de de bzhin no //
analyzed: koo shi ka de de bzhin no //
translated: “Kauśika, it is so!

original: de de bzhin te /
analyzed: de de bzhin te /
translated: It is just as you have said.

original: de ltar bcom ldan 'das kyis kyang chos thams cad ni btags pa tsam du bstan to //
analyzed: de ltar bcom ldan 'das kyis kyang chos thams cad ni btags pa tsam du bstan to //
translated: In that way, the Blessed One has also taught that all phenomena are mere designations.

original: koo shi ka byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen pos kyang de ltar chos thams cad btags pa tsam du rig nas shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la bslab par bya'o //
analyzed: koo shi ka byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen pos kyang de ltar chos thams cad btags pa tsam du rig nas shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la bslab par bya'o //
translated: Kauśika, bodhisattva great beings, knowing that all phenomena are mere designations, should train in the perfection of wisdom.

original: koo shi ka byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen pos de ltar slob pa ni gzugs la mi slob /🔽tshor ba dang / 'du shes dang / 'du byed rnams dang / rnam par @28a * //
analyzed: koo shi ka byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen pos de ltar slob pa ni gzugs la mi slob / tshor ba dang / 'du shes dang / 'du byed rnams dang / rnam par @28a * //
translated: Kauśika, bodhisattva great beings who train like that do not train in form,

original: shes pa la mi slob po //
analyzed: shes pa la mi slob po //
translated: and do not train in feeling, perception, volitional factors, or consciousness.

original: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: de ni 'di ltar des gang la bslab par bya ba'i gzugs yang dag par rjes su mi mthong /
analyzed: de ni 'di ltar des gang la bslab par bya ba'i gzugs yang dag par rjes su mi mthong /
translated: It is because they do not see any form in which they should train.

original: de bzhin du gang la bslab par bya ba'i tshor ba dang / 'du shes dang / 'du byed rnams dang / rnam par shes pa yang dag par rjes su mi mthong ngo //
analyzed: de bzhin du gang la bslab par bya ba'i tshor ba dang / 'du shes dang / 'du byed rnams dang / rnam par shes pa yang dag par rjes su mi mthong ngo //
translated: Similarly, they do not see any feeling, perception, volitional factors, or consciousness in which they should train.

original: byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po de ltar slob pa ni sbyin pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa la mi slob ste /🔽de ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po de ltar slob pa ni sbyin pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa la mi slob ste / de ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: “Bodhisattva great beings who train like that do not train in the perfection of giving.

original: 'di ltar des gang la bslab par bya ba'i sbyin pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa de yang dag par rjes su mi mthong bas so //
analyzed: 'di ltar des gang la bslab par bya ba'i sbyin pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa de yang dag par rjes su mi mthong bas so //
translated: If you ask why, it is because they do not see any perfection of giving in which they should train.

original: de bzhin du tshul khrims kyi pha rol tu phyin pa dang / bzod pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa dang / brtson 'grus kyi pha rol tu phyin pa dang / bsam gtan gyi pha rol tu phyin pa dang / shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la mi slob ste /
analyzed: de bzhin du tshul khrims kyi pha rol tu phyin pa dang / bzod pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa dang / brtson 'grus kyi pha rol tu phyin pa dang / bsam gtan gyi pha rol tu phyin pa dang / shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la mi slob ste /
translated: Similarly, they do not train in the perfection of morality, the perfection of patience, the perfection of perseverance, the perfection of concentration, or the perfection of wisdom.

original: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is this?🔽

original: 'di ltar des gang la bslab par bya ba'i shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa de yang dag par rjes su mi mthong bas so //
analyzed: 'di ltar des gang la bslab par bya ba'i shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa de yang dag par rjes su mi mthong bas so //
translated: If you ask why, it is because they do not see even the perfection of wisdom in which they should train.

original: nang stong pa nyid la mi slob /
analyzed: nang stong pa nyid la mi slob /
translated: They do not train in inner emptiness,

original: dngos po med pa'i ngo bo nyid stong pa nyid kyi bar la yang mi slob ste /🔽de ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: dngos po med pa'i ngo bo nyid stong pa nyid kyi bar la yang mi slob ste / de ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: up to they do not train in the emptiness that is the nonexistence of an intrinsic nature.

original: 'di ltar des gang la bslab par bya ba'i nang stong pa nyid de yang dag par rjes su mi mthong ba dang / dngos po med pa'i ngo bo nyid stong pa nyid kyi bar de yang dag par rjes su mi mthong bas so //
analyzed: 'di ltar des gang la bslab par bya ba'i nang stong pa nyid de yang dag par rjes su mi mthong ba dang / dngos po med pa'i ngo bo nyid stong pa nyid kyi bar de yang dag par rjes su mi mthong bas so //
translated: If you ask why, it is because they do not see even the inner emptiness in which they should train, up to they do not see even the emptiness that is the nonexistence of an intrinsic nature in which they should train.

original: byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po de ltar slob na ni dran pa nye bar gzhag pa bzhi la mi slob ste /🔽de ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po de ltar slob na ni dran pa nye bar gzhag pa bzhi la mi slob ste / de ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: “Bodhisattva great beings training like that do not train in the four applications of mindfulness.

original: 'di ltar des gang la bslab par bya ba'i dran pa nye bar gzhag pa de yang dag par rjes su mi mthong bas so //
analyzed: 'di ltar des gang la bslab par bya ba'i dran pa nye bar gzhag pa de yang dag par rjes su mi mthong bas so //
translated: If you ask why, it is because they do not see even the applications of mindfulness in which they should train.

original: de bzhin du yang dag par spong ba dang / rdzu 'phrul gyi rkang pa dang / dbang po dang / stobs dang / byang chub kyi yan lag dang / 'phags pa'i lam yan lag brgyad pa dang / tshad med pa rnams dang / bsam gtan rnams dang /
analyzed: de bzhin du yang dag par spong ba dang / rdzu 'phrul gyi rkang pa dang / dbang po dang / stobs dang / byang chub kyi yan lag dang / 'phags pa'i lam yan lag brgyad pa dang / tshad med pa rnams dang / bsam gtan rnams dang /
translated: Similarly, they do not train in the right efforts, legs of miraculous power, faculties, powers, limbs of awakening, eightfold noble path, immeasurables,🔽meditative stabilizations,

original: gzugs med pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa rnams dang ; mngon par shes pa rnams dang / bden pa rnams dang / stobs rnams dang / mi 'jigs pa rnams dang / so so yang dag par rig pa rnams dang / sangs rgyas kyi chos ma 'dres pa rnams la mi slob po //
analyzed: gzugs med pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa rnams dang ; mngon par shes pa rnams dang / bden pa rnams dang / stobs rnams dang / mi 'jigs pa rnams dang / so so yang dag par rig pa rnams dang / sangs rgyas kyi chos ma 'dres pa rnams la mi slob po //
translated: meditative absorptions, clairvoyances, truths, powers, fearlessnesses, unshared qualities of a buddha, or aspects of awakening.

original: rgyun tu zhugs pa'i 'bras bu dang / lan cig phyir 'ong ba'i 'bras bu @28b dang ; phyir mi 'ong ba'i 'bras bu dang / dgra bcom pa nyid dang / rang byang chub la mi slob /
analyzed: rgyun tu zhugs pa'i 'bras bu dang / lan cig phyir 'ong ba'i 'bras bu @28b dang ; phyir mi 'ong ba'i 'bras bu dang / dgra bcom pa nyid dang / rang byang chub la mi slob /
translated: They do not train in the result of stream enterer, the result of once-returner, the result of non-returner, the state of a worthy one, or a pratyekabuddha’s awakening.

original: rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid la mi slob ste /
analyzed: rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid la mi slob ste /
translated: They do not train in the knowledge of all aspects.

original: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: 'di ltar des gang la bslab par bya ba'i rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid de yang dag par rjes su mi mthong bas so //
analyzed: 'di ltar des gang la bslab par bya ba'i rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid de yang dag par rjes su mi mthong bas so //
translated: Because he does not see that all-knowledge in which he should train.

original: de nas lha rnams kyi dbang po brgya byin gyis gnas brtan rab 'byor la 'di skad ces smras so //
analyzed: de nas lha rnams kyi dbang po brgya byin gyis gnas brtan rab 'byor la 'di skad ces smras so //
translated: Then Śatakratu, head of the gods, said to the elder Subhūti,

original: btsun pa rab 'byor byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen pos gzugs yang dag par rjes su mi mthong /
analyzed: btsun pa rab 'byor byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen pos gzugs yang dag par rjes su mi mthong /
translated: “Venerable monk Subhūti, bodhisattva great beings do not see form,

original: tshor ba dang / 'du shes dang / 'du byed rnams dang / rnam par shes pa yang dag par rjes su mi mthong bas so //
analyzed: tshor ba dang / 'du shes dang / 'du byed rnams dang / rnam par shes pa yang dag par rjes su mi mthong bas so //
translated: do not see feeling, perception, volitional factors, or consciousness, and do not see the perfection of wisdom.

original: de bzhin du so so ba dang / bsdus pa'i phung po dang / khams dang / skye mched dang / rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba'am /
analyzed: de bzhin du so so ba dang / bsdus pa'i phung po dang / khams dang / skye mched dang / rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba'am /
translated: Similarly, they do not see the aggregates, elements, sense fields, or dependent origination either separately or in combination;

original: pha rol tu phyin pa rnams dang / stong pa nyid thams cad dang / byang chub kyi phyogs kyi chos rnams yang dag par rjes su mi mthong /
analyzed: pha rol tu phyin pa rnams dang / stong pa nyid thams cad dang / byang chub kyi phyogs kyi chos rnams yang dag par rjes su mi mthong /
translated: they do not see the perfections, the emptinesses, or the thirty-seven dharmas on the side of awakening;

original: tshad med pa dang / bsam gtan dang / gzugs med pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa yang dag par rjes su mi mthong /
analyzed: tshad med pa dang / bsam gtan dang / gzugs med pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa yang dag par rjes su mi mthong /
translated: They do not see the immeasurables, the concentrations, or the formless absorptions.

original: gang la bslab par bya ba'i bden pa rnams dang / mngon par shes pa rnams dang / de bzhin gshegs pa'i stobs bcu dang / mi 'jigs pa bzhi dang / so so yang dag par rig pa rnams dang / sangs rgyas kyi chos ma 'dres pa bco brgyad yang dag par rjes su mi mthong /
analyzed: gang la bslab par bya ba'i bden pa rnams dang / mngon par shes pa rnams dang / de bzhin gshegs pa'i stobs bcu dang / mi 'jigs pa bzhi dang / so so yang dag par rig pa rnams dang / sangs rgyas kyi chos ma 'dres pa bco brgyad yang dag par rjes su mi mthong /
translated: They do not see the truths, the clairvoyances, the ten powers of the tathāgatas, the four fearlessnesses, the four detailed and thorough knowledges, or the eighteen distinct attributes of a buddha, which are the objects of training.

original: rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid kyi bar du yang dag par rjes su mi mthong ngo //
analyzed: rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid kyi bar du yang dag par rjes su mi mthong ngo //
translated: They do not see the knowledge of all aspects.

original: rab 'byor gyis smras pa /
analyzed: rab 'byor gyis smras pa /
translated: Subhūti said,

original: koo shi ka 'di ltar gzugs gzugs kyis stong ngo //
analyzed: koo shi ka 'di ltar gzugs gzugs kyis stong ngo //
translated: “Kauśika, it is because form is empty of form.

original: tshor ba dang / 'du shes dang / 'du byed rnams dang / rnam par shes pa rnam par shes pas stong ngo //
analyzed: tshor ba dang / 'du shes dang / 'du byed rnams dang / rnam par shes pa rnam par shes pas stong ngo //
translated: Feeling, perception, volitional factors, and consciousness are empty of consciousness.

original: de bzhin du phung po dang / khams dang / skye mched dang / rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba dang / pha rol tu phyin pa rnams dang / stong pa nyid thams cad dang / ting nge 'dzin thams cad dang / gzungs kyi sgo thams cad dang /
analyzed: de bzhin du phung po dang / khams dang / skye mched dang / rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba dang / pha rol tu phyin pa rnams dang / stong pa nyid thams cad dang / ting nge 'dzin thams cad dang / gzungs kyi sgo thams cad dang /
translated: Similarly, the aggregates, the constituents, the sense fields, dependent origination, the perfections, all the emptinesses, all the meditative stabilizations, all the dhāraṇī gateways,

original: byang chub kyi phyogs kyi chos sum cu rtsa bdun dang / tshad med pa dang / bsam gtan dang / gzugs med pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa dang / bden pa rnams dang / mngon par shes pa rnams dang / de bzhin gshegs pa'i stobs bcu dang /
analyzed: byang chub kyi phyogs kyi chos sum cu rtsa bdun dang / tshad med pa dang / bsam gtan dang / gzugs med pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa dang / bden pa rnams dang / mngon par shes pa rnams dang / de bzhin gshegs pa'i stobs bcu dang /
translated: the thirty-seven dharmas on the side of awakening, the immeasurables, the concentrations, the formless absorptions, the truths, the clairvoyances, the ten tathāgata powers,

original: mi 'jigs pa dang / so so yang dag par rig pa @29a * //
analyzed: mi 'jigs pa dang / so so yang dag par rig pa @29a * //
translated: the fearlessnesses, the detailed and thorough knowledges,

original: dang / sangs rgyas kyi chos ma 'dres pa bco brgyad dang / rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid kyi bar rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid kyis stong ngo //
analyzed: dang / sangs rgyas kyi chos ma 'dres pa bco brgyad dang / rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid kyi bar rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid kyis stong ngo //
translated: the eighteen distinct attributes of a buddha, up to the knowledge of all aspects is empty of the knowledge of all aspects.

original: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: If you ask why,

original: koo shi ka gzugs stong pa nyid kyis gzugs stong pa nyid yang dag par rjes su mi mthong bas so //
analyzed: koo shi ka gzugs stong pa nyid kyis gzugs stong pa nyid yang dag par rjes su mi mthong bas so //
translated: Kauśika, it is because the emptiness of form does not see the emptiness of form.

original: rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid kyi bar stong pa nyid kyis rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid kyi bar stong pa nyid yang dag par rjes su mi mthong bas so //
analyzed: rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid kyi bar stong pa nyid kyis rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid kyi bar stong pa nyid yang dag par rjes su mi mthong bas so //
translated: Up to the emptiness of the knowledge of all aspects does not see the emptiness of the knowledge of all aspects.

original: koo shi ka gang stong pa nyid la slob pa de ni gnyis su byar med pas gzugs stong pa nyid la slob po //
analyzed: koo shi ka gang stong pa nyid la slob pa de ni gnyis su byar med pas gzugs stong pa nyid la slob po //
translated: Kauśika, one who trains in emptiness trains in the nonduality of form’s emptiness.

original: gnyis su byar med pas tshor ba dang 'du shes dang / 'du byed rnams dang / rnam par shes pa stong pa nyid la slob po //
analyzed: gnyis su byar med pas tshor ba dang 'du shes dang / 'du byed rnams dang / rnam par shes pa stong pa nyid la slob po //
translated: One trains in the nonduality of the emptiness of feeling, perception, volitional factors, and consciousness.

original: gnyis su byar med pas so so ba dang / bsdus pa'i phung po rnams dang / khams rnams dang / skye mched rnams dang / rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba rnams dang / pha rol tu phyin pa rnams dang / byang chub kyi phyogs kyi chos sum cu rtsa bdun dang /
analyzed: gnyis su byar med pas so so ba dang / bsdus pa'i phung po rnams dang / khams rnams dang / skye mched rnams dang / rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba rnams dang / pha rol tu phyin pa rnams dang / byang chub kyi phyogs kyi chos sum cu rtsa bdun dang /
translated: because they are not dual and not discrete, and also because of the aggregates, elements, sense fields, dependent originations, perfections, thirty-seven aspects of enlightenment,

original: tshad med pa rnams dang / bsam gtan rnams dang / gzugs med pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa rnams dang / bden pa rnams dang / mngon par shes pa rnams dang / stong pa nyid thams cad dang / ting nge 'dzin thams cad dang / gzungs kyi sgo thams cad dang /
analyzed: tshad med pa rnams dang / bsam gtan rnams dang / gzugs med pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa rnams dang / bden pa rnams dang / mngon par shes pa rnams dang / stong pa nyid thams cad dang / ting nge 'dzin thams cad dang / gzungs kyi sgo thams cad dang /
translated: immeasurables, concentrations, formless absorptions, truths, superknowledges, all emptinesses, all meditative stabilizations, all dhāraṇī gateways,

original: de bzhin gshegs pa'i stobs bcu po rnams dang / mi 'jigs pa rnams dang / so so yang dag par rig pa rnams dang / sangs rgyas kyi chos ma 'dres pa rnams dang / rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid kyi bar stong pa nyid la slob po //
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa'i stobs bcu po rnams dang / mi 'jigs pa rnams dang / so so yang dag par rig pa rnams dang / sangs rgyas kyi chos ma 'dres pa rnams dang / rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid kyi bar stong pa nyid la slob po //
translated: He trains in the emptiness of the ten powers of the tathāgatas, the fearlessnesses, the detailed and thorough knowledges, the eighteen distinct attributes of a buddha, up to the knowledge of all aspects.

original: koo shi ka gang gzugs stong pa nyid la gnyis su byar med pas slob pa dang / rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid kyi bar stong pa nyid la gnyis su byar med pas slob pa de ni gnyis su byar med pas sbyin pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa la slob po //
analyzed: koo shi ka gang gzugs stong pa nyid la gnyis su byar med pas slob pa dang / rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid kyi bar stong pa nyid la gnyis su byar med pas slob pa de ni gnyis su byar med pas sbyin pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa la slob po //
translated: Kauśika, he trains in the emptiness of form without making a division into two, and he trains in the emptiness of the knowledge of all aspects without making a division into two. He trains in the perfection of giving without making a division into two.

original: de ni gnyis su byar med pas tshul khrims kyi pha rol tu phyin pa dang / bzod pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa dang / brtson 'grus kyi pha rol tu phyin pa dang / bsam gtan gyi pha rol tu phyin pa dang / shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la slob po //
analyzed: de ni gnyis su byar med pas tshul khrims kyi pha rol tu phyin pa dang / bzod pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa dang / brtson 'grus kyi pha rol tu phyin pa dang / bsam gtan gyi pha rol tu phyin pa dang / shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la slob po //
translated: They train in the perfection of morality, the perfection of patience, the perfection of perseverance, the perfection of concentration, and the perfection of wisdom, without making anything into a duality.

original: de ni gnyis su byar med pas nang stong pa nyid la slob po //
analyzed: de ni gnyis su byar med pas nang stong pa nyid la slob po //
translated: They train in inner emptiness, without making anything into a duality.

original: dngos po med pa'i ngo bo nyid @29b stong pa nyid kyi bar la slob po //🔽de ni gnyis su byar med pas dran pa nye bar gzhag pa rnams dang / yang dag par spong ba rnams dang / rdzu 'phrul gyi rkang pa rnams dang / dbang po rnams dang / stobs rnams dang / byang chub kyi yan lag rnams dang /
analyzed: dngos po med pa'i ngo bo nyid @29b stong pa nyid kyi bar la slob po // de ni gnyis su byar med pas dran pa nye bar gzhag pa rnams dang / yang dag par spong ba rnams dang / rdzu 'phrul gyi rkang pa rnams dang / dbang po rnams dang / stobs rnams dang / byang chub kyi yan lag rnams dang /
translated: They train in outer emptiness, inner and outer emptiness, the emptiness of emptiness, great emptiness, the emptiness of ultimate reality, the emptiness of the compounded, the emptiness of the uncompounded, the emptiness of what is beyond extremes, the emptiness of middle and extremes, the emptiness of the beginningless and endless, the emptiness of non-dispersal, the emptiness of inherent existence, the emptiness of all things, the emptiness of intrinsic defining characteristics, the emptiness of non-apprehension, the emptiness of non-entities, and the emptiness of the essential nature of non-entities, without making anything into a duality.

original: 'phags pa'i lam yan lag brgyad pa rnams la slob po //
analyzed: 'phags pa'i lam yan lag brgyad pa rnams la slob po //
translated: They train in the applications of mindfulness, the right efforts, the legs of miraculous power, the faculties, the powers, the seven branches of enlightenment, and the noble eightfold path, without making anything into a duality.

original: de ni gnyis su byar med pas tshad med pa rnams dang / bsam gtan rnams dang / gzugs med pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa rnams dang / de bzhin gshegs pa'i stobs bcu po dang / mi 'jigs pa rnams dang / so so yang dag par rig pa rnams dang /
analyzed: de ni gnyis su byar med pas tshad med pa rnams dang / bsam gtan rnams dang / gzugs med pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa rnams dang / de bzhin gshegs pa'i stobs bcu po dang / mi 'jigs pa rnams dang / so so yang dag par rig pa rnams dang /
translated: They train in the ten powers of the tathāgatas, the four fearlessnesses, the four detailed and thorough knowledges, and the eighteen distinct attributes of a buddha.

original: sangs rgyas kyi chos ma 'dres pa rnams la slob po //
analyzed: sangs rgyas kyi chos ma 'dres pa rnams la slob po //
translated: They train in the thirty-seven dharmas on the side of awakening.🔽They train in the emptiness meditative stabilization, signless meditative stabilization, and wishless meditative stabilization.

original: gnyis su byar med pas ting nge 'dzin rnams dang / gzungs kyi sgo thams cad la slob po //
analyzed: gnyis su byar med pas ting nge 'dzin rnams dang / gzungs kyi sgo thams cad la slob po //
translated: They train in the dhāraṇī gateways.

original: gnyis su byar med pas sangs rgyas kyi chos grangs med gzhal du med pa la slob po //
analyzed: gnyis su byar med pas sangs rgyas kyi chos grangs med gzhal du med pa la slob po //

original: tshe dang ldan pa sh'a ri'i bu byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen pos tshor ba dang / 'du shes dang / 'du byed rnams dang / rnam par shes ba'i skye ba mi mthong ngo //
analyzed: tshe dang ldan pa sh'a ri'i bu byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen pos tshor ba dang / 'du shes dang / 'du byed rnams dang / rnam par shes ba'i skye ba mi mthong ngo //
translated: Venerable Śāriputra, bodhisattva great beings do not see the production of feeling, perception, volitional factors, or consciousness.

original: 'gag pa dang / blang ba dang / dor ba dang / kun nas nyon mongs pa dang / rnam par byang ba dang / stsogs pa dang / 'bri ba dang / 'grib pa dang / @31b 'phel ba mi mthong ngo //
analyzed: 'gag pa dang / blang ba dang / dor ba dang / kun nas nyon mongs pa dang / rnam par byang ba dang / stsogs pa dang / 'bri ba dang / 'grib pa dang / @31b 'phel ba mi mthong ngo //
translated: He does not see cessation, taking up, or laying down; defilement or purification; increase or decrease.

original: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: tshe dang ldan pa sh'a ri'i bu de ni 'di ltar rnam par shes pa'i rang bzhin gyis med pas so //
analyzed: tshe dang ldan pa sh'a ri'i bu de ni 'di ltar rnam par shes pa'i rang bzhin gyis med pas so //
translated: Venerable Śāriputra, it is because the intrinsic nature of consciousness does not exist.

original: de bzhin du so so ba dang / bsdus pa'i phung po rnams dang / khams rnams dang / skye mched rnams dang / stong pa nyid thams cad dang / rten cing 'brel bar 'byung ba rnams dang / pha rol tu phyin pa rnams dang / byang chub kyi phyogs kyi chos sum cu rtsa bdun dang /
analyzed: de bzhin du so so ba dang / bsdus pa'i phung po rnams dang / khams rnams dang / skye mched rnams dang / stong pa nyid thams cad dang / rten cing 'brel bar 'byung ba rnams dang / pha rol tu phyin pa rnams dang / byang chub kyi phyogs kyi chos sum cu rtsa bdun dang /
translated: Similarly, he does not see the individual and composite aggregates, elements, sense fields, all the emptinesses, the dependent originations, the perfections, the thirty-seven aspects of enlightenment,

original: tshad med pa rnams dang / bsam gtan rnams dang / gzugs med pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa rnams dang / bden pa rnams dang / mngon par shes pa rnams dang / ting nge 'dzin rnams dang / stobs rnams dang / so so yang dag par rig pa rnams dang /
analyzed: tshad med pa rnams dang / bsam gtan rnams dang / gzugs med pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa rnams dang / bden pa rnams dang / mngon par shes pa rnams dang / ting nge 'dzin rnams dang / stobs rnams dang / so so yang dag par rig pa rnams dang /
translated: He does not see the immeasurables, the concentrations, the formless absorptions, the truths, the higher knowledges, the meditative stabilizations, the powers, the fearlessnesses, the detailed and thorough knowledges,

original: sangs rgyas kyi chos ma 'dres pa rnams dang / rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid kyi bar gyi skye ba mi mthong /
analyzed: sangs rgyas kyi chos ma 'dres pa rnams dang / rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid kyi bar gyi skye ba mi mthong /
translated: or the eighteen distinct attributes of a buddha up to or the knowledge of all aspects.

original: 'gag pa dang / blang ba dang / dor ba dang / kun nas nyon mongs pa dang / rnam par byang ba dang / stsogs pa dang / 'bri ba dang / 'grib pa dang / 'phel ba mi mthong ngo //
analyzed: 'gag pa dang / blang ba dang / dor ba dang / kun nas nyon mongs pa dang / rnam par byang ba dang / stsogs pa dang / 'bri ba dang / 'grib pa dang / 'phel ba mi mthong ngo //
translated: He does not see arising or cessation, taking up or putting down, defilement or purification, increase or decrease, or diminution or growth.

original: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: de ni 'di ltar rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid kyi bar gyi rang bzhin gyis med cing mi dmigs pas so //
analyzed: de ni 'di ltar rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid kyi bar gyi rang bzhin gyis med cing mi dmigs pas so //
translated: It is because the knowledge of all aspects up to the knowledge of all aspects is non-existent and non-apprehensible in its very nature.

original: tshe dang ldan pa sh'a ri'i bu de ltar na byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po chos thams cad skye ba med pa dang / 'gag pa med pa dang / blang ba med pa dang / dor ba med pa dang / kun nas nyon mongs pa med pa dang /
analyzed: tshe dang ldan pa sh'a ri'i bu de ltar na byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po chos thams cad skye ba med pa dang / 'gag pa med pa dang / blang ba med pa dang / dor ba med pa dang / kun nas nyon mongs pa med pa dang /
translated: not ceasing, not being something to be taken up, not being something to be put down, not being defiled,

original: rnam par byang ba med pa dang / stsogs pa med pa dang / 'bri ba med pa dang / 'grib pa med pa dang / 'phel ba med pa'i phyir slob na /
analyzed: rnam par byang ba med pa dang / stsogs pa med pa dang / 'bri ba med pa dang / 'grib pa med pa dang / 'phel ba med pa'i phyir slob na /
translated: not being purified, not increasing, not decreasing, not being diminished, and not waxing,🔽they train in the perfection of wisdom in a way that is not training and not definitely emerging, and they will definitely emerge in the knowledge of all aspects.”

original: mi slob pa dang / nges par mi 'byung ba'i tshul gyis shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la bslabs nas rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid du nges par 'byung ngo zhes bya ba ni de nyid kyi chos kyi mchog tu gtogs ba yin no //
analyzed: mi slob pa dang / nges par mi 'byung ba'i tshul gyis shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la bslabs nas rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid du nges par 'byung ngo zhes bya ba ni de nyid kyi chos kyi mchog tu gtogs ba yin no //
translated: This is the supreme mundane quality that is included in that [stage].

original: 'di dag gis ni rang sangs rgyas kyi lam gsungs pa yin no //
analyzed: 'di dag gis ni rang sangs rgyas kyi lam gsungs pa yin no //
translated: These [verses] teach the path of the solitary realizers.

original: de nas lha rnams kyi dbang po brgya byin gyis tshe dang ldan pa sh'a ri'i bu la 'di skad ces smras so //
analyzed: de nas lha rnams kyi dbang po brgya byin gyis tshe dang ldan pa sh'a ri'i bu la 'di skad ces smras so //
translated: Then Śakra, Lord of the Gods, said to the Venerable Śāriputra:

original: btsun pa sh'a ri'i bu shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa gang las btsal bar bya /
analyzed: btsun pa sh'a ri'i bu shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa gang las btsal bar bya /
translated: “Venerable Śāriputra, where should one seek the perfection of wisdom?

original: sh'a ri'i bus smras pa /🔽koo shi ka shes rab kyi pha @32a * //
analyzed: sh'a ri'i bus smras pa / koo shi ka shes rab kyi pha @32a * //
translated: ” Śāriputra replied:

original: rol tu phyin pa ni rab 'byor gyi le'u las btsal bar bya'o //
analyzed: rol tu phyin pa ni rab 'byor gyi le'u las btsal bar bya'o //
translated: “Kauśika, the perfection of wisdom should be sought in the chapter of Subhūti.🔽”

original: de nas lha rnams kyi dbang po brgya byin gyis tshe dang ldan pa rab 'byor la 'di skad ces smras so //
analyzed: de nas lha rnams kyi dbang po brgya byin gyis tshe dang ldan pa rab 'byor la 'di skad ces smras so //
translated: Then Śakra, Lord of the Gods, said to the Venerable Subhūti:

original: 'phags pa rab 'byor 'phags pa sh'a ri'i bu 'di skad du koo shi ka shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa ni rab 'byor gyi le'u las btsal bar bya'o zhes zer ba de khyod kyi mthu yin nam /
analyzed: 'phags pa rab 'byor 'phags pa sh'a ri'i bu 'di skad du koo shi ka shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa ni rab 'byor gyi le'u las btsal bar bya'o zhes zer ba de khyod kyi mthu yin nam /
translated: “Noble Subhūti, the noble Śāriputra says that the perfection of wisdom should be sought in the chapter of Subhūti. Is that your power?

original: khyod kyi byin gyi rlabs yin nam /
analyzed: khyod kyi byin gyi rlabs yin nam /
translated: Is that your blessing?

original: rab 'byor gyis smras pa /
analyzed: rab 'byor gyis smras pa /
translated: ” Subhūti replied:

original: koo shi ka 'di ni bdag gi mthu ma yin /
analyzed: koo shi ka 'di ni bdag gi mthu ma yin /
translated: “Kauśika, that is not my power,

original: 'di ni bdag gi byin gyi rlabs ma yin no //
analyzed: 'di ni bdag gi byin gyi rlabs ma yin no //
translated: “This is not my blessing.”

original: brgya byin gyis smras pa /
analyzed: brgya byin gyis smras pa /
translated: Śakra said,

original: btsun pa rab 'byor 'o na de su'i mthu su'i byin gyi rlabs /
analyzed: btsun pa rab 'byor 'o na de su'i mthu su'i byin gyi rlabs /
translated: “Venerable Subhūti, then whose power is it? Whose blessing is it?”

original: rab 'byor gyis smras pa /
analyzed: rab 'byor gyis smras pa /
translated: Subhūti said,

original: koo shi ka 'di ni de bzhin gshegs pa'i mthu /
analyzed: koo shi ka 'di ni de bzhin gshegs pa'i mthu /
translated: “Kauśika, it is the power of the Tathāgata.

original: 'di ni de bzhin gshegs pa'i byin gyi rlabs so //
analyzed: 'di ni de bzhin gshegs pa'i byin gyi rlabs so //
translated: It is the blessing of the Tathāgata.

original: lha rnams kyi dbang po byin gyi rlabs med pa'i chos nyid las gzhan na yang de bzhin gshegs pa mi dmigs de bzhin nyid las gzhan na yang de bzhin gshegs pa mi dmigs te /
analyzed: lha rnams kyi dbang po byin gyi rlabs med pa'i chos nyid las gzhan na yang de bzhin gshegs pa mi dmigs de bzhin nyid las gzhan na yang de bzhin gshegs pa mi dmigs te /
translated: Kauśika, apart from the reality that is without blessing, the Tathāgata is not apprehended. Apart from suchness, the Tathāgata is not apprehended.

original: chos thams cad byin gyi rlabs med pa'i //
analyzed: chos thams cad byin gyi rlabs med pa'i //
translated: Kauśika, all phenomena are without blessing.

original: lha rnams kyi dbang pos smras pa /
analyzed: lha rnams kyi dbang pos smras pa /
translated: The lord of gods said,

original: 'phags pa rab 'byor chos thams cad byin gyi rlabs med pa yin na /🔽ci'i phyir de skad du 'di ni de bzhin gshegs pa'i mthu'o //
analyzed: 'phags pa rab 'byor chos thams cad byin gyi rlabs med pa yin na / ci'i phyir de skad du 'di ni de bzhin gshegs pa'i mthu'o //
translated: “Noble Subhūti, if all phenomena are without blessing,🔽why do you say, ‘This is the power of the Tathāgata.

original: 'di ni de bzhin gshegs ba'i phyin gyi rlabs so zhes smra /
analyzed: 'di ni de bzhin gshegs ba'i phyin gyi rlabs so zhes smra /
translated: This is the blessing of the Tathāgata’?

original: rab 'byor gyis smras pa /
analyzed: rab 'byor gyis smras pa /
translated: ” Subhūti said,🔽“Kauśika,

original: koo shi ka de de bzhin no //
analyzed: koo shi ka de de bzhin no //
translated: “Kauśika, it is so!

original: de de bzhin te /
analyzed: de de bzhin te /
translated: It is just as you have said.

original: byin gyi rlabs med pa'i chos nyid las gzhan na yang de bzhin gshegs pa me dmigs la /
analyzed: byin gyi rlabs med pa'i chos nyid las gzhan na yang de bzhin gshegs pa me dmigs la /

original: de bzhin nyid las gzhan na yang de bzhin gshegs pa mi dmigs so //🔽byin gyi rlabs med pa'i chos nyid la yang de bzhin gshegs pa mi dmigs la /
analyzed: de bzhin nyid las gzhan na yang de bzhin gshegs pa mi dmigs so // byin gyi rlabs med pa'i chos nyid la yang de bzhin gshegs pa mi dmigs la /

original: de bzhin gshegs pa la yang byin gyi rlabs med pa'i chos nyid mi dmigs so //🔽de bzhin nyid la yang de bzhin gshegs pa mi dmigs so //
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa la yang byin gyi rlabs med pa'i chos nyid mi dmigs so // de bzhin nyid la yang de bzhin gshegs pa mi dmigs so //

analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa la yang de bzhin nyid mi dmigs so // gzugs kyi de bzhin nyid la yang de bzhin gshegs pa mi dmigs so // de bzhin gshegs pa la yang gzugs kyi de bzhin nyid mi dmigs so //
translated: and suchness is not apprehended in the Tathāgata.🔽The Tathāgata is not apprehended in the suchness of form,🔽and the suchness of form is not apprehended in the Tathāgata.

original: gzugs kyi chos nyid la yang de bzhin gshegs pa mi dmigs so //
analyzed: gzugs kyi chos nyid la yang de bzhin gshegs pa mi dmigs so //
translated: The Tathāgata is not apprehended in the real nature of form,🔽and the real nature of form is not apprehended in the Tathāgata.

original: de bzhin gshegs pa la yang gzugs kyi chos nyid mi dmigs so /
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa la yang gzugs kyi chos nyid mi dmigs so /

original: @32b tshor ba'i de bzhin nyid dang / 'du shes kyi de bzhin nyid dang / 'du byed rnams kyi de bzhin nyid dang / rnam par shes pa'i de bzhin nyid la yang de bzhin gshegs pa mi dmigs so //🔽de bzhin gshegs pa la yang rnam par shes pa'i de bzhin nyid mi dmigs so //🔽rnam par shes pa'i chos nyid la yang de bzhin gshegs pa mi dmigs so //

analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa la yang rnam par shes pa'i chos nyid mi dmigs so //
translated: The real nature of consciousness is not apprehended in the Thus-Gone One.

original: de bzhin du phung po rnams dang / khams dang / skye mched dang / rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba dang / pha rol tu phyin pa rnams dang / mngon par shes pa rnams dang / 'phags pa'i bden pa rnams dang / byang chub kyi phyogs kyi chos sum cu rtsa bdun dang /
analyzed: de bzhin du phung po rnams dang / khams dang / skye mched dang / rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba dang / pha rol tu phyin pa rnams dang / mngon par shes pa rnams dang / 'phags pa'i bden pa rnams dang / byang chub kyi phyogs kyi chos sum cu rtsa bdun dang /
translated: In the same way, the aggregates, the constituents, the sense fields, dependent origination, the perfections, the superknowledges, the noble truths, the thirty-seven aspects of enlightenment,

original: tshad med pa rnams dang / bsam gtan rnams dang / gzugs med pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa rnams dang / stong pa nyid thams cad dang / ting nge 'dzin thams cad dang / gzungs kyi sgo thams cad dang / stobs dang / mi 'jigs pa dang /
analyzed: tshad med pa rnams dang / bsam gtan rnams dang / gzugs med pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa rnams dang / stong pa nyid thams cad dang / ting nge 'dzin thams cad dang / gzungs kyi sgo thams cad dang / stobs dang / mi 'jigs pa dang /
translated: the immeasurables, the concentrations, the formless absorptions, all emptinesses, all meditative stabilizations, all dhāraṇī gateways, the powers, the fearlessnesses,

analyzed: so so yang dag par rig pa dang / sangs rgyas kyi chos ma 'dres pa dang / rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid kyi bar gyi de bzhin nyid la yang de bzhin gshegs pa mi dmigs so //

translated: The thusness of the knowledge of all aspects is not apprehended in the Tathāgata.🔽The Tathāgata is not apprehended in the real nature of the knowledge of all aspects.

original: de bzhin gshegs pa la yang rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid kyi chos nyid mi dmigs so //🔽de ci'i phyir zhe na /🔽koo shi ka de bzhin gshegs pa dang / gzugs kyi de bzhin nyid gang yin pa de ni ldan pa yang ma yin /
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa la yang rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid kyi chos nyid mi dmigs so // de ci'i phyir zhe na / koo shi ka de bzhin gshegs pa dang / gzugs kyi de bzhin nyid gang yin pa de ni ldan pa yang ma yin /
translated: The real nature of the knowledge of all aspects is not apprehended in the Tathāgata.

original: bral ba yang ma yin pas so //
analyzed: bral ba yang ma yin pas so //
translated: The thusness of feeling, perception, volitional factors, and consciousness is neither joined nor disjoined.

analyzed: koo shi ka de bzhin gshegs pa dang gzugs kyi chos nyid gang yin pa ldan pa yang ma yin bral ba yang ma yin pas so //
translated: Kauśika, the Tathāgata and the real nature of form are neither joined nor disjoined.

analyzed: tshor ba dang / 'du shes dang / 'du byed rnams dang / rnam par shes pa'i chos nyid ldan pa yang ma yin /

original: bral ba yang ma yin pas @33a * //
analyzed: bral ba yang ma yin pas @33a * //
translated: that they are separate from it.

analyzed: so ; / gzugs kyi de bzhin nyid ma yin pa gzhan dang ldan pa yang ma yin /

original: bral ba yang ma yin pas so //
analyzed: bral ba yang ma yin pas so //
translated: that it is separate from it.

original: gzugs kyi chos nyid ma yin pa gzhan dang ldan pa yang ma yin /
analyzed: gzugs kyi chos nyid ma yin pa gzhan dang ldan pa yang ma yin /
translated: It is not that what is other than the dharmatā of form is endowed with it or

original: bral ba yang ma yin pas so //
analyzed: bral ba yang ma yin pas so //
translated: that it is separate from it.

analyzed: tshor ba dang / 'du shes dang / 'du byed rnams dang ; rnam par shes pa'i de bzhin nyid ma yin pa gzhan dang ldan pa yang ma yin /
translated: It is not that what is other than the suchness of feeling, perception, formation, and consciousness is endowed with it or

original: bral ba yang ma yin pas so //
analyzed: bral ba yang ma yin pas so //
translated: that it is separate from it.

analyzed: rnam par shes pa'i chos nyid ma yin pa gzhan dang ldan pa yang ma yin /
translated: It is not that what is other than the dharmatā of feeling, perception, formation, and consciousness is endowed with it or

original: bral ba yang ma yin pas so //
analyzed: bral ba yang ma yin pas so //
translated: that it is separate from it.

translated: In detail, it is because the Tathāgata is neither conjoined nor disjoined with the real nature of the Tathāgata, up to and the real nature of the knowledge of all aspects is neither conjoined nor disjoined with the knowledge of all aspects.

original: rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid kyi chos nyid dang ldan pa yang ma yin /🔽bral ba yang ma yin pas so //
analyzed: rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid kyi chos nyid dang ldan pa yang ma yin / bral ba yang ma yin pas so //
translated: The real nature of the knowledge of all aspects is neither conjoined nor disjoined with the knowledge of all aspects.

original: rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid kyi de bzhin nyid ma yin pa gzhan dang ldan pa yang ma yin /🔽bral ba yang ma yin pas so //🔽rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid kyi chos nyid ma yin pa gzhan dang ldan pa yang ma yin /
analyzed: rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid kyi de bzhin nyid ma yin pa gzhan dang ldan pa yang ma yin / bral ba yang ma yin pas so // rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid kyi chos nyid ma yin pa gzhan dang ldan pa yang ma yin /

original: sems can de dag tshul @45b khrims kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la rab tu bkod pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: sems can de dag tshul @45b khrims kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la rab tu bkod pa'i phyir ro //
translated: He does so in order to establish those sentient beings in the perfection of moral discipline.

original: gang gi don du sems can de dag yun ring por khro ba dang / gnod sems dang / 'tshe bar gyur pa'i phyi nang gi chos de dag byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen pos yongs su btang ste /
analyzed: gang gi don du sems can de dag yun ring por khro ba dang / gnod sems dang / 'tshe bar gyur pa'i phyi nang gi chos de dag byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen pos yongs su btang ste /
translated: For the sake of those sentient beings, the bodhisattva-mahāsattva gives up those outer and inner phenomena due to which they have been angry, malicious, and violent for a long time.

original: sems can de dag bzod pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa la rab tu bkod pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: sems can de dag bzod pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa la rab tu bkod pa'i phyir ro //
translated: It is in order to establish those sentient beings in the perfection of patience.

original: gang gi don du sems can de dag yun ring por le lor byed par gyur pa'i phyi nang gi chos de dag byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen pos yongs su btang ste /
analyzed: gang gi don du sems can de dag yun ring por le lor byed par gyur pa'i phyi nang gi chos de dag byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen pos yongs su btang ste /
translated: For the sake of those sentient beings, the bodhisattva-mahāsattva gives up those outer and inner phenomena due to which they have been lazy for a long time.

original: sems can de dag brtson 'grus kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la rab tu bkod pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: sems can de dag brtson 'grus kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la rab tu bkod pa'i phyir ro //
translated: It is in order to establish those sentient beings in the perfection of effort.

original: gang gi don du sems can de dag yun ring por sems g-yengs par gyur pa'i phyi nang gi chos de dag byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen pos yongs su btang ste /
analyzed: gang gi don du sems can de dag yun ring por sems g-yengs par gyur pa'i phyi nang gi chos de dag byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen pos yongs su btang ste /
translated: For the sake of those sentient beings, the bodhisattva-mahāsattva gives up those outer and inner phenomena due to which their minds have been distracted for a long time.

original: sems can de dag bsam gtan gyi pha rol tu phyin pa la rab tu bkod pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: sems can de dag bsam gtan gyi pha rol tu phyin pa la rab tu bkod pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because he has established those beings in the perfection of meditative stabilization.

original: gang gi don du sems can de dag yun ring por shes rab 'chal bar gyur pa'i phyi nang gi chos de dag byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen pos yongs su btang ste /
analyzed: gang gi don du sems can de dag yun ring por shes rab 'chal bar gyur pa'i phyi nang gi chos de dag byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen pos yongs su btang ste /
translated: because he has given up those inner and outer phenomena for the sake of which those beings have long been confused about wisdom,

original: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la rab tu bkod pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la rab tu bkod pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because he has established those beings in the perfection of wisdom.

original: koo shi ka gang gi don du sems can de dag 'di lta ste /
analyzed: koo shi ka gang gi don du sems can de dag 'di lta ste /
translated: “Kauśika, for the sake of which those beings have been revolving in cyclic existence, namely

original: rjes su chags pa dang / khong khro ba dang / kun nas ldang ba 'khor ba nas 'khor bar gyur pa de dag byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen pos rnam par bcil te /
analyzed: rjes su chags pa dang / khong khro ba dang / kun nas ldang ba 'khor ba nas 'khor bar gyur pa de dag byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen pos rnam par bcil te /
translated: attachment, aversion, and the afflictions, those have been eliminated by the bodhisattva great beings,

original: sems can de dag bsam gtan bzhi dang / tshad med pa bzhi dang / gzugs med pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa bzhi la rab tu bkod pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: sems can de dag bsam gtan bzhi dang / tshad med pa bzhi dang / gzugs med pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa bzhi la rab tu bkod pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because he has established those beings in the four meditative stabilizations, the four immeasurable aspirations, and the four formless meditative attainments.

original: dran pa nye bar gzhag pa bzhi la rab tu bkod pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: dran pa nye bar gzhag pa bzhi la rab tu bkod pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because they have been established in the four establishments of mindfulness.

original: de bzhin du yang dag par spong ba rnams dang / rdzu 'phrul gyi rkang pa rnams dang / dbang po rnams dang / stobs rnams dang / byang chub kyi yan lag rnams dang / 'phags pa'i lam yan lag brgyad pa rnams dang / stong pa nyid rnams dang /🔽mtshan ma med pa rnams dang / smon pa med pa rnams dang / ting nge 'dzin rnams dang / gzungs kyi sgo rnams la rab tu bkod pa'i phyir ro //🔽'phags pa'i bden pa bzhi po rnams dang / mngon par shes pa rnams dang / stobs bcu po rnams dang / mi 'jigs pa rnams dang / so so yang dag par rig par rig pa rnams dang / sangs @46a * //

translated: Similarly, they have been established in the four right efforts, the four legs of miraculous power, the five faculties, the five powers, the seven aspects of enlightenment, the noble eightfold path, the ten powers, the four fearlessnesses, the four detailed and thorough knowledges, and the eighteen distinct attributes of a buddha.

original: rgyas kyi chos ma 'dres pa bco brgyad po rnams la rab tu bkod pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rgyas kyi chos ma 'dres pa bco brgyad po rnams la rab tu bkod pa'i phyir ro //
translated: They have been established in the four noble truths, the six clairvoyances, the ten powers, the four fearlessnesses, the four detailed and thorough knowledges, and the eighteen distinct attributes of a buddha.

original: rgyun du zhugs pa'i 'bras bu dang / lan cig phyir 'ong ba'i 'bras bu dang / phyir mi 'ong ba'i 'bras bu dang / dgra bcom pa'i 'bras bu la rab tu bkod pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rgyun du zhugs pa'i 'bras bu dang / lan cig phyir 'ong ba'i 'bras bu dang / phyir mi 'ong ba'i 'bras bu dang / dgra bcom pa'i 'bras bu la rab tu bkod pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because they have established them in the fruit of entering the stream, in the fruit of being tied to one more rebirth, in the fruit of no longer being subject to rebirth, and in the fruit of becoming a worthy one;

original: rang byang chub la rab tu bkod pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rang byang chub la rab tu bkod pa'i phyir ro //

analyzed: bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub la rab tu bkod pa'i phyir ro //

original: koo shi ka de ltar byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po byang chub sems dpa'i spyad pa spyod pa na mthong ba'i chos 'di la phan yon 'di dag 'byung ste /
analyzed: koo shi ka de ltar byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po byang chub sems dpa'i spyad pa spyod pa na mthong ba'i chos 'di la phan yon 'di dag 'byung ste /
translated: Kauśika, when bodhisattva great beings practice the bodhisattva practice, these benefits are seen in this very life.

original: tshe rabs gzhan la yang bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu mngon par rdzogs par sangs rgyas nas chos kyi 'khor lo bskor te /
analyzed: tshe rabs gzhan la yang bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu mngon par rdzogs par sangs rgyas nas chos kyi 'khor lo bskor te /
translated: In other lives, having fully awakened to unsurpassed, perfect, complete awakening, they turn the wheel of the Dharma.

original: sems can rnams smon lam ji lta ba bzhin du rab tu bkod nas phung po lhag ma ma lus pa'i mya ngan las 'das pa'i dbyings su yongs su mya ngan las 'da' bar 'gyur ro //

translated: and having established sentient beings in accordance with their aspirations, they will pass into the realm of nirvāṇa without any remainder of the aggregates.

original: koo shi ka 'di ni byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po rnams kyi tshe rabs gzhan la 'byung ba'i phan yon zhes bya ba ni 'gog pa la rjes su shes pa'i bzod pa yin no //🔽koo shi ka gzhan yang sa'i phyogs gang na rigs kyi bu'am /

translated: “Kauśika, this is called the benefit that arises in other lives for bodhisattva great beings. This is the acceptance of subsequent knowledge with regard to cessation.”

analyzed: rigs kyi bu mo shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa 'di 'dzin pa dang / 'chad ba dang / klog pa dang / kun chub par byed pa dang / tshul bzhin du yid la byed pa yod pa'i sa phyogs der bdud dang / bdud kyi rigs su gtogs pa'i lha'am /
translated: “Furthermore, Kauśika, in whatever place a son or daughter of good family holds, recites, reads, masters, and properly pays attention to this perfection of wisdom, in that place the māras, or the gods of the class of Māra,

analyzed: mu stegs can gzhan dag kun tu rgyu ba'am /
translated: or the other tīrthikas, the wandering mendicants,

analyzed: gang zag nga rgyal can rnams kyis shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa 'di la sems rnam par g-yengs pa'am /
translated: Those who are conceited will not be able to come here to this perfection of wisdom in order to confuse their minds,

original: brgal ba'am / brtsad pa'am /
analyzed: brgal ba'am / brtsad pa'am /
translated: or to argue, or to dispute,

original: 'gal bar bya ba'i phyir 'ong bar mi nus te /

original: de'i 'og tu de dag la phan yon 'byung bar 'gyur ba ni shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa 'di mnyan pa'i rim pas theg pa gsum gyis nges par byung nas sdug bsngal mthar phyin par 'gyur ro //🔽koo shi ka 'di lta ste dper na /

translated: After that, the benefit that will come to them is that, by the stages of listening to this perfection of wisdom, they will go forth in the three vehicles and put an end to suffering.

original: rtsi ma ghi zhes bya ba dug thams cad zhi bar byed pa zhig yod de /🔽der  sbrul lam srog chags bkres pas mnar zhing zas tshol ba zhig gis srog chags kyi rigs la la zhig mthong bar gyur te /
analyzed: rtsi ma ghi zhes bya ba dug thams cad zhi bar byed pa zhig yod de / der  sbrul lam srog chags bkres pas mnar zhing zas tshol ba zhig gis srog chags kyi rigs la la zhig mthong bar gyur te /
translated: Kauśika, it is just as if there were a medicine called ‘maghi’ that would cure all poisons.🔽A snake, tormented by hunger and looking for food, would see a certain kind of animal.

analyzed: des srog chags kyi rigs de bza' bar 'dod nas de'i rjes su 'brangs te bsnyen par @46b gyur na ;
